Description: GUAM IS CENTERED IN THE SPRAWLS OF THE PACIFIC, ASIA, AND OCEANIA REGIONS, WHEREIN THE GUAM POLICE DEPARTMENT (GPD) PRIDES ITSELF IN BEING ABLE TO MAKE MORE HAPPEN WITH LIMITED RESOURCES. BY ADOPTING AND NATURALIZING THE COMMUNITY POLICING STRATEGY INTO ITS WAY OF POLICING, THE DEPARTMENT HAS BUILT PARTNERSHIPS (STAKEHOLDERS) WITH ALL LEVELS OF LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCIES AND NON-GOVERNMENTAL ORGANIZATIONS AND BUILT STRONGER BONDS WITH OUR COMMUNITY. WHILE THE “COMMUNITY TRUST” HAS BEEN BUILT WITH COMMUNITY POLICING, THE SECONDARY EFFECT IS THE ABILITY TO SHARE, LEVERAGE, AND REDUCE WASTE WITH THE PARTNERSHIPS FORMED. THIS SAME TRUST MUST BE BUILT WITH THE VERY OFFICERS WHO WORK HARD TO ADVOCATE COMMUNITY POLICING AND KEEP OUR COMMUNITY SAFE. THE GUAM POLICE DEPARTMENT WANTS TO PROVIDE A LONG-AWAITED AND MUCH NEEDED MENTAL HEALTH AND WELLNESS SERVICES TO ITS OFFICERS THROUGH THE LAW ENFORCEMENT PEER SUPPORT IMPLEMENTATION PROJECT.

ABSTRACTTHE CITY OF DOUGLAS POLICE DEPARTMENT AND CONVERSE COUNTY SCHOOL DISTRICT #1 IDENTIFIED A CRITICAL COMMUNICATIONS DEFICIENCY WHILE ACTIVATING AN EMERGENCY LOCKDOWN OF ALL SCHOOLS WITHIN THE CITY SUBSEQUENT TO A BANK ROBBERY SUSPECT LAST SEEN LEAVING ON FOOT IN THE IMMEDIATE AREA OF THE HIGH SCHOOL AND PRIMARY SCHOOL. A SUBSEQUENT COMPREHENSIVE SCHOOL SAFETY ASSESSMENT OF THE DISTRICT SCHOOLS IDENTIFIED THE DEFICIENCY AS A CRITICAL SAFETY CONCERN AS WELL. WORKING WITH THE POLICE DEPARTMENT, LOCAL EMERGENCY RESPONSE AGENCIES AND THE LOCAL PROVIDER FOR MOTOROLA RADIO EQUIPMENT, A COMPREHENSIVE PLAN WAS DEVELOPED, ALONG WITH A QUOTE FOR THE PURCHASE AND INSTALLATION OF THE EQUIPMENT NEEDED TO ASSURE EMERGENCY COMMUNICATIONS WITH ALL SCHOOLS, ADMINISTRATION AND BUSSES WITHIN THE DISTRICT, AS WELL AS DIRECT COMMUNICATION WITH THE POLICE DEPARTMENT AND OFFICERS RESPONDING TO EMERGENCIES. SOLE SOURCE JUSTIFICATION WILL BE PROVIDED IN THE APPROPRIATE SECTION; HOWEVER, TO BRIEFLY NOTE HERE, ALL OF THE CONVERSE COUNTY AND CITY OF DOUGLAS LAW ENFORCEMENT COMMUNICATIONS SYSTEMS ARE PROVIDED BY MOTOROLA AND, THEREFORE, TO REACH THE DESIRED GOAL OF COMPLETE INTEROPERABLE COMMUNICATIONS, COMPATIBLE MOTOROLA RADIOS AND EQUIPMENT MUST BE UTILIZED BY CONVERSE COUNTY SCHOOL DISTRICT #1. WHEN COMPLETED, PERSONNEL IN EACH SCHOOL BUILDING, RURAL SCHOOL BUILDING AND SCHOOL BUS IN THE DISTRICT WILL BE ABLE TO CLEARLY AND QUICKLY COMMUNICATE WITH THE OTHER FACILITIES AND, MOST IMPORTANTLY, LAW ENFORCEMENT PERSONNEL, TO INCLUDE THE SCHOOL RESOURCE OFFICERS.

THE PROJECT PURPOSE WOULD BE TO INCREASE BUILDING SECURITY AND COMMUNICATION WITH LAW ENFORCEMENT. THE PROPOSED CRISIS ALERT SOFTWARE ALLOWS ANY STAFF OR STUDENT TO INITIATE A SECURITY BREACH NOTIFICATION WHICH IS THEN IMMEDIATELY AVAILABLE TO ALL SCHOOL PERSONNEL. CAMERAS WOULD ALLOW FOR LOCAL POLICE AND SCHOOL SECURITY PERSONNEL TO MONITOR ACCESS POINTS FROM A CENTRAL LOCATION AND RELAY ANY CONCERNS OR BREACHES TO OTHER PERSONNEL. LAPTOPS WOULD ALLOW FOR STATIONED SCHOOL RESOURCE OFFICERS TO COMMUNICATE WITH OTHER POLICE IN OTHER BUILDINGS AND MAINTAIN A STATION IN THE BUILDING AS OPPOSED TO LEAVING THE SCHOOL TO RETURN TO THE POLICE STATION FOR INCIDENT ENTRIES. CAMERA SOFTWARE INSTALLED ON THE LAPTOPS WOULD ALLOW THE OFFICER TO SEE FOOTAGE ANYWHERE IN THE BUILDING. NEW TWO-WAY RADIOS WILL ENABLE MORE RELIABLE COMMUNICATION ACROSS THE DISTRICT BUILDINGS AND WITH LOCAL LAW ENFORCEMENT. AUTOMATED LICENSE PLATE READERS NEAR DISTRICT SCHOOLS WILL BOOST LOCAL POLICE SURVEILLANCE FOR HIGH-RISK INDIVIDUALS NEAR SCHOOLS. ADDITIONALLY, A NEW SERVER IS NEEDED TO HANDLE THE ADDITIONAL CAMERAS.

THE HURON SCHOOL DISTRICT IS WORKING WITH THE HURON TOWNSHIP POLICE DEPARTMENT TO COORDINATE SAFETY AND SECURITY EFFORTS IN THE SCHOOL DISTRICT. THIS INCLUDES COORDINATION OF COMMUNICATIONS AND TRAINING EFFORTS OF OUR OFFICERS, TEACHERS, STUDENTS, AND PROFESSIONAL STAFF. IN AN EFFORT TO INCREASE THESE LINES OF COMMUNICATION AND COOPERATION, WE ARE PLANNING TO ADD SURVEILLANCE EQUIPMENT TO EACH OF THE DISTRICT SCHOOL BUILDINGS, AND THIS SYSTEM WILL INCLUDE LINES OF ACCESS THAT WILL BE AVAILABLE TO THE HURON TOWNSHIP POLICE DEPARTMENT. IN ADDITION, THE DISTRICT IS PLANNING TO ADD BUILDING ACCESS CONTROL SYSTEMS THAT WILL BE MADE AVAILABLE TO LAW ENFORCEMENT AND WILL MAKE THE SCHOOL BUILDINGS MORE SECURE. WE ARE ALSO PLANNING TO REDESIGN THE ENTRY WAYS TO EACH OF THE SCHOOL BUILDINGS TO INCLUDE SERVICE WINDOWS AND LOBBY AREAS WITH LOCKED BANKS OF DOORS, COMPLETE WITH BUZZER SYSTEMS AND SURVEILLANCE CAMERAS.

OUR PROPOSAL INVOLVES HIRING 2 EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT COORDINATOR-SCHOOL SAFETY PERSONNEL, DEDICATED TO OUR COUNTY-WIDE SCHOOL SAFETY ACTIVITIES. OUR APPLICATION IS BEING SUBMITTED ON BEHALF OF OUR ENTIRE COUNTY WHICH INCLUDES 25 JURISDICTIONS, 76 SCHOOL DISTRICTS/PRIVATE/CHARTERS AND 150,000 STUDENTS. DURING THE LAST 20 YEARS, WE HAVE USED A COUNTY-WIDE APPROACH TO INSTILL STABILITY, COOPERATION, AND STANDARDIZATION. THESE PERSONNEL WILL CONDUCT SCHOOL THREAT AND VULNERABILITY ASSESSMENTS, UPDATE EMERGENCY OPERATIONS PLANS, PARTICIPATE IN THE COUNTY-WIDE SCHOOL SAFETY COMMITTEE, AND CONDUCT TRAININGS, EXERCISES AND PUBLIC EDUCATION. THEY WILL USE EVIDENCE-BASED SCHOOL SAFETY PROGRAMS AND NATIONAL, STATE AND LOCAL GUIDANCE TO ENSURE THAT OUR METHODOLOGIES, TOOLS AND PLANS ARE CURRENT AND CAN BE UTILIZED ACROSS OUR COUNTY. THEY WILL WORK WITH SCHOOL PERSONNEL, PARENTS AND POLICE, FIRE, MEDICAL AND MENTAL HEALTH TO ENSURE THAT WE HAVE A WHOLE COMMUNITY APPROACH. THEY WILL TRACK AND EVALUATE OUR PROGRESS TO ENSURE THAT ALL SCHOOLS HAVE ACCESS AND KNOWLEDGE ABOUT OUR PROGRAM/SERVICES. COMMITTED PARTNER AGENCIES INCLUDE THE MACOMB INTERMEDIATE SCHOOL DISTRICT, COUNTY ASSOCIATION OF SCHOOL ADMINISTRATORS, COUNTY FIRE CHIEF’S ASSOCIATION, COUNTY MEDICAL CONTROL AUTHORITY AND COUNTY POLICE CHIEF’S ASSOCIATION. ALL OF US ARE COMMITTED TO ENSURING THAT SCHOOL SAFETY AND VIOLENCE PREVENTION REMAINS A TOP PRIORITY.

MASS CASUALTY EVENTS IN SCHOOLS CAN HAVE AN UNFORGETTABLE IMPACT THAT EFFECTS EVERY ASPECT OF SCHOOL, FAMILY AND COMMUNITY LIFE. OVER THE PAST SEVERAL DECADES, SCHOOL VIOLENCE HAS LEFT A PROFOUND AND LASTING IMPRESSION ON COMMUNITIES ACROSS THE NATION. ALTHOUGH ONLY A SMALL MINORITY OF SCHOOLS DIRECTLY EXPERIENCE THE MOST SEVERE FORMS OF VIOLENCE, LIKE SCHOOL SHOOTINGS, STUDENTS ARE OFTEN EXPOSED TO OTHER LEVELS OF VIOLENCE ON A VARYING BASIS. AFTER NUMEROUS VIOLENT INCIDENTS, SCHOOL DISTRICTS HAVE BEEN FOCUSED ON ENHANCING SECURITY AT THEIR RESPECTIVE FACILITIES. WITH THE SUPPORT OF THE COPS OFFICE, THE CITY OF FITCHBURG WILL PURCHASE MUCH NEEDED EQUIPMENT AND TECHNOLOGY TO BE INTEGRATED INTO OUR OVERALL COMPREHENSIVE SCHOOL SAFETY PLANNING EFFORTS. PURCHASED ITEMS WILL FILL SPECIFIC SECURITY GAPS AND OVERALL ASSIST THIS MUNICIPALITY IN ADDRESSING MUCH NEEDED SCHOOL SAFETY CONCERNS. THE CITY OF FITCHBURG PROPOSES TO ADDRESS SCHOOLS SAFETY CONCERNS BY PURCHASING ENTRY CONTROL LOCKING DEVICES AND BY PURCHASING A BI-DIRECTIONAL AMPLIFIER SYSTEM THAT WILL ALLOW FOR THE EXPEDITED NOTIFICATION OF LAW ENFORCEMENT DURING AN EMERGENCY. THE FITCHBURG SCHOOL DISTRICT AND THE FITCHBURG POLICE DEPARTMENT WILL CONTINUE TO WORK TOGETHER ON THIS GRANT AWARD AND WILL CONTINUE TO WORK TOGETHER WHEN RESPONDING TO SCHOOL SAFETY RELATED ISSUES.

CHESTERFIELD COUNTY IS A DIVERSE COMMUNITY COVERING 446 SQUARE MILES WITH OVER 343,500 RESIDENTS. CHESTERFIELD COUNTY, THE FIFTH LARGEST JURISDICTION BY POPULATION IN THE COMMONWEALTH, IS THE LARGEST IN THE RICHMOND METROPOLITAN STATISTICAL AREA. THE COUNTY'S SCHOOL SYSTEM, CHESTERFIELD COUNTY PUBLIC SCHOOLS (SCHOOLS) IS CURRENTLY THE FIFTH LARGEST IN VIRGINIA AND THE 68TH LARGEST IN THE NATION, SERVING APPROXIMATELY 60,000 STUDENTS.SCHOOLS HAS IMPLEMENTED SEVERAL SAFETY MEASURES TO PROTECT STUDENTS AND STAFF. ONE AREA IDENTIFIED AS A DEFICIT IN THE COMPREHENSIVE RISK ASSESSMENT IS THE SECURITY OF THE ELEMENTARY SCHOOL BUILDINGS. TWO THIRDS OF THE BUILDINGS USE TRADITIONAL KEY LOCKS. THIS METHOD IS INEFFICIENT, CREATES UNNECESSARY FIRST RESPONDER DELAYS, AND PROMOTES AN UNSAFE ENVIRONMENT. AS A MEANS OF RESOLVING THE OUTDATED DOOR SECURITY ISSUE AT THE ELEMENTARY SCHOOLS, THE SAFETY AND SECURITY MANAGER HAS IDENTIFIED THE NEED TO INSTALL ELECTRONIC ASSESS SYSTEMS IN ALL BUILDINGS. GOAL – THE GOAL OF THIS PROGRAM IS TO ENHANCE THE SAFETY AND SECURITY OF ELEMENTARY SCHOOL STUDENTS AND STAFF THROUGH LIMITING UNAUTHORIZED ACCESS TO THESE BUILDINGS.OBJECTIVE – THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROGRAM IS TO INCREASE ACCESS TO ALL PUBLIC ELEMENTARY SCHOOL BUILDINGS FOR FIRST RESPONDERS BY 95% WHILE DECREASING UNAUTHORIZED ACCESS BY 100% AS OF SEPTEMBER OF 2020.THROUGH THIS GRANT OPPORTUNITY, THE POLICE DEPARTMENT AND SCHOOLS ARE SEEKING $500,000 IN GRANT FUNDS TO BE MATCHED WITH $220,500 TO EQUIP 35 ELEMENTARY SCHOOLS WITH ELECTRONIC ASSESS SYSTEMS. THE FUNDING FROM THE SCHOOLS’ CAPITAL IMPROVEMENTS BUDGET WILL FUND THE MATCH. FUTURE FUNDS WILL BE ALLOCATED TO SUPPORT THE SYSTEM PROVIDED THROUGH THIS GRANT AWARD.

THE LEADING METHODS OF UNNATURAL DEATH IN VIRGINIA SINCE 2007 HAVE BEEN MOTOR VEHICLE COLLISIONS, GUN-RELATED DEATHS, AND THEN FATAL DRUG OVERDOSES. THESE METHODS OF DEATH INCLUDE ALL MANNERS OF DEATH: ACCIDENT, HOMICIDE, SUICIDE, AND THE UNDETERMINED. IN 2013, FATAL DRUG OVERDOSE BECAME THE LEADING METHOD OF UNNATURAL DEATH IN THE COMMONWEALTH AND THIS WORSENING TREND HAS CONTINUED DUE MAINLY TO HEROIN, ILLICIT FENTANYL, AND FENTANYL ANALOGS. THE TOTAL NUMBER OF FATAL HEROIN-RELATED OVERDOSES IN VIRGINIA HAS BEEN INCREASING SINCE 2010. FATAL HEROIN OVERDOSES OFTEN OCCUR AS THE PRIMARY DRUG CAUSING DEATH, BUT MORE RECENTLY, FENTANYL AND/OR FENTANYL ANALOGS IN ADDITION TO HEROIN HAVE CAUSED FATAL OVERDOSES. FATAL HEROIN OVERDOSES INCREASED BY 31.0% IN 2016 WHEN COMPARED TO 2015 AND AGAIN INCREASED BY 24.6% IN 2017 WHEN COMPARED TO 2016. THE TOTAL NUMBER OF FATAL FENTANYL-RELATED DRUG OVERDOSES HAS SHARPLY INCREASED SINCE 2012; WHICH COINCIDES WITH THE DRAMATIC INCREASE IN FATAL HEROIN OVERDOSES. THE NUMBER OF FATAL FENTANYL OVERDOSES IN 2016 COMPARED TO 2015 INCREASED BY 174.7%. THE TREND OF FATAL FENTANYL OVERDOSES CONTINUED TO INCREASE IN 2017 BY AN ADDITIONAL 23.4%.FENTANYL ANALOGS BEGAN APPEARING IN VIRGINIA IN 2014 AND HAVE RISEN DRAMATICALLY SINCE THE BEGINNING OF 2016. IN FATAL OVERDOSES, FENTANYL ANALOGS ARE MOST COMMONLY FOUND WITH FENTANYL AND/OR TWO DIFFERENT FENTANYL ANALOGS TOGETHER, AND/OR HEROIN OR COCAINE. FENTANYL ANALOGS ARE ILLICITLY PRODUCED, EXTREMELY POTENT, AND CAN BE BLAMED IN PART FOR THE SIGNIFICANT RISE IN FATAL OVERDOSES DUE TO OPIOIDS. FENTANYL ANALOGS ALONE (NOT INCLUDING FENTANYL) WERE THE CAUSE OF 259 FATAL OVERDOSES IN 2016, COMPARED WITH 34 IN 2015 AND 2 IN 2014. IN ALL OF 2016, IT WAS ESTIMATED THAT OVER 94% OF FATAL FENTANYL OVERDOSES WERE DUE TO THE ILLICITLY PRODUCED VERSIONS OF THE DRUG.VIRGINIA STATE POLICE IS REQUESTING GRANT FUNDS FOR INVESTIGATIVE EQUIPMENT, SUPPLIES, OVERTIME, CONTRACT PERSONNEL, AND TRAINING TO EXPAND THE DEPARTMENT AND ITS 37 MULTI-JURISDICTIONAL DRUG TASK FORCES' ABILITY TO IDENTIFY, APPREHEND, PROSECUTE, DISRUPT AND ULTIMATELY DISMANTLE THOSE DRUG TRAFFICKING ORGANIZATIONS RESPONSIBLE FOR THE IMPORTATION AND DISTRIBUTION OF HEROIN, FENTANYL AND OTHER OPIOID BASED NARCOTICS IN VIRGINIA. THE FUNDS REQUESTED IN THE GRANT APPLICATION FOR EQUIPMENT, TRAINING AND CONTRACT PERSONNEL WILL PROVIDE THE STATE POLICE AND LOCAL COUNTERPARTS WITH THE ADVANCED SKILLS, TECHNICAL CAPABILITIES AND ANALYTICAL SUPPORT NECESSARY TO FULLY EXPLOIT CELLULAR AND ELECTRONIC COMMUNICATION DEVICES UTILIZED BY DRUG TRAFFICKING ORGANIZATIONS. THESE ONGOING CRIMINAL ENTERPRISES UTILIZE MULTIPLE CELLULAR DEVICES TO EVADE AND THWART LAW ENFORCEMENT'S ABILITY TO MONITOR AND IDENTIFY THE CRIMINAL ORGANIZATION'S STRUCTURE AND MODUS OPERANDI. OFFICER SAFETY WILL BE DRAMATICALLY INCREASED WITH THE FUNDING DESIGNATED FOR HANDHELD NARCOTICS ANALYZERS FOR SAFE FIELD TESTING OF DANGEROUS SUSPECTED NARCOTICS BY LAW ENFORCEMENT PERSONNEL. GRANT FUNDING FOR ADDITIONAL REGIONAL INTELLIGENCE ANALYSTS COUPLED WITH THE REQUESTED SOFTWARE WILL PROVIDE ENHANCED INVESTIGATIVE AND ANALYTICAL TOOLS NECESSARY FOR INVESTIGATORS TO SUCCESSFULLY TARGET HEROIN / FENTANYL SOURCES OF SUPPLY. THE REQUESTED FUNDS WILL BE UTILIZED TO TARGET THE FIVE MOST IMPACTED AREAS ACROSS THE STATE FOCUSING ENFORCEMENT EFFORTS AND RESOURCES IN ITS MOST CRITICALLY NEEDED AREAS. THE OVERTIME FUNDS REQUESTED WILL ALLOW THE DEPARTMENT TO DEDICATE ADDITIONAL PERSONNEL TO HEROIN / FENTANYL RELATED INVESTIGATIONS TO ADDRESS THE EXPONENTIAL INCREASE IN OVERDOSE AND DEATH CASES IN RECENT YEARS. FEDERAL GRANT FUNDS ARE CRITICAL TO ENHANCEMENT OF THE STATE AND LOCAL LAW ENFORCEMENT INVESTIGATIVE EFFORTS SUPPORTING INTELLIGENCE LED POLICING STRATEGIES THAT ARE FORGED IN INFORMATION SHARING AND DRIVEN BY ANECDOTAL DATA AND ADVANCED ANALYTICAL SUPPORT.

TO ADDRESS TN’S EVER-INCREASING HEROIN/OPIOID EPIDEMIC, THE TENNESSEE DANGEROUS DRUGS TASK FORCE (TDDTF) HEREBY REQUESTS FUNDING OF $1,253,293.80 FROM THE FY 2018 AHTF GRANT PROGRAM. THE TDDTF CONSISTS OF LOCAL, STATE, AND FEDERAL AGENCIES REPRESENTING TN’S 95 COUNTIES. FUNDING RECEIVED THROUGH THE AHTF GRANT PROGRAM WOULD SERVE TO INCREASE TN LAW ENFORCEMENT’S (LE) CAPACITY TO INVESTIGATE ILLEGAL ACTIVITIES RELATED TO THE IMPORTATION, DISTRIBUTION, TRAFFICKING, AND DIVERSION OF HEROIN/OPIOIDS, AND ENHANCE LE EFFORTS TO THE PROTECT THE PUBLIC SAFETY AND PUBLIC HEALTH OF CITIZENS AND DRUG ENDANGERED CHILDREN. THE RESOURCES FROM THESE FUNDS WOULD BE UTILIZED WITH A MULTI-JURISDICTIONAL REACH TO LOCAL AND STATE LEA INVESTIGATING HEROIN/OPIOID OFFENSES ACROSS THE STATE.  TN’S HEROIN/OPIOID ABUSE/USE AND THE INFLUX OF FENTANYL AND OTHER SYNTHETIC OPIOIDS ARE RESPONSIBLE FOR DRUG-RELATED PROPERTY AND VIOLENT CRIME, A HIGH NUMBER OF ER VISITS, AND AN OVERDOSE DEATH INCREASE (1631 IN 2016). ALTHOUGH STATISTICS FOR 2017 ARE NOT YET AVAILABLE, INTELLIGENCE SHARED THROUGH LE, HEALTH AND TREATMENT PARTNERS INDICATES THAT THERE IS AND WILL CONTINUE TO BE AN INCREASE IN OVERDOSE DEATHS IN 2017. AS A COLLABORATIVE PARTNERSHIP OF STATE AGENCIES AND LE, THE TDDTF TEAM APPROACH HAS PROVEN TO BE A SUCCESS IN ASSISTING IN THE FIGHT AGAINST DANGEROUS DRUGS IN TN. FROM THE MANY REGULATORY AND OTHER SPECIALTIES OF THEIR RESPECTIVE JURISDICTIONS AND DISCIPLINES, THE UNIQUE ALLIANCE OF AGENCIES REPRESENTED ON THE EXECUTIVE BOARD JOIN TOGETHER UNDER THE CANOPY OF THE TDDTF CONTINUING TO WORK TOWARD SOLUTIONS IN THE STATEWIDE STRUGGLE AGAINST HEROIN/OPIOID ABUSE IN TN. FUNDING FROM THE FY 2018 AHTF GRANT PROGRAM TO THE TDDTF CAN FACILITATE THE FOLLOWING SEAMLESS CONTRIBUTIONS TO INVESTIGATIONS AND RESPONSE ON A MULTI-JURISDICTIONAL AND MULTI-DISCIPLINE TEAM APPROACH SCALE:•LE TRAINING FOR INVESTIGATING TO CRIMES INVOLVING HEROIN/OPIOIDS, •ENHANCEMENTS TO THE DI3 STATEWIDE SHARING OF STATISTICAL INFORMATION AND INTELLIGENCE,•CAPABILITIES TO RESPOND TO LOCAL HEROIN EXTRACTION LABS, •ADMINISTRATIVE AND SUPERVISORY SUPPORT OF THE TENNESSEE ALLIANCE FOR DRUG ENDANGERED CHILDREN AND PROTOCOL TRAINING FOR JURISDICTIONS ACROSS THE STATE, •OVERTIME FOR LE AND TBI FORENSIC CHEMISTS BASED ON OCDETF GUIDELINES, •10 PART TIME OR FULL TIME CONTRACT POSITIONS, •SUPPORT OF THE TDDTF PILL TAKE BACK PROGRAM AND EXPANSION OF THE PROGRAM FOR COLLECTION AND DESTRUCTION OF DRUG EVIDENCE FROM LEA, •PURCHASE OF ONE MASS SPECTROMETER FOR CONFIRMATORY TESTING OF SUSPECTED DRUG SUBSTANCES,•PURCHASE OF TWO TRUNARC NARCOTICS ANALYZERS FOR FIELD PRESUMPTIVE TESTING, •PRINTING OF EASY REFERENCE CARD PACKETS FOR LEO,•ATTENDANCE FOR 4 TBI FORENSIC CHEMISTS TO ANNUAL NATIONAL CHEMISTRY CONFERENCES TO KEEP ABREAST OF EMERGING HEROIN/OPIOID ISSUES, AND •ENHANCEMENT OF ADOBE CONNECT TO PROVIDE ONLINE TRAINING TO LE. •PURCHASE OF A HAZARDOUS CHEMICAL RESPONSE SAFETY VEHICLE TO RESPOND TO HIGH HAZARD OPIOID INVESTIGATIONS THAT INCLUDE SUSPECTED FENTANYL (SYNTHETIC AND ANALOG).BECAUSE OF THE TDDTF, TN HAS EARNED THE REPUTATION OF BEING A LEADER IN THE “MULTIJURISDICTIONAL REACH” AND “INTERDISCIPLINARY TEAM STRUCTURE” CONCEPT IN FIGHTING AGAINST DRUGS. THE TDDTF PROPOSES UTILIZATION OF THE FY 2018 AHTF GRANT FUNDING AS DESCRIBED IN THE BUDGET NARRATIVE AND ADDITIONALLY TO FURTHER INFORMATION AND INTELLIGENCE SHARING ACROSS JURISDICTIONAL LINES WHICH IS A MAJOR KEY TO SUCCESSFUL INVESTIGATIONS OF OPIOID AND HEROIN DISTRIBUTION, ABUSE AND USE.

ISP’S FOUR PRONG APPROACH TO THE OPIOID CRISIS IS DESIGNED TO CREATE SYNERGY BETWEEN COMMUNITIES AND THEIR POLICE. THE FIRST PRONG, PREVENTION, ALLOWS ISP TO INTERACT WITH THE COMMUNITY AS A PRO-ACTIVE PARTNER. THE REALITY IS PEOPLE IN OUR COMMUNITIES WILL BE EXPOSED TO HEROIN AND OPIOIDS THROUGHOUT THEIR LIVES. ISP IS COMMITTED TO LESSENING THE IMPACT OF THIS EPIDEMIC THROUGH PRO-ACTIVE APPROACHES. PUBLIC OUTREACH IS A KEY COMPONENT OF OUR INITIATIVE. PUBLIC INFORMATION OFFICERS AND TROOPERS WILL BE ENGAGED WITH CIVIC ORGANIZATIONS, SCHOOLS AND OTHER COMMUNITY GROUPS IN AN EFFORT TO EXCHANGE INFORMATION AND GARNER NEW IDEAS IN A TRANSPARENT MANNER.THE SECOND PRONG, ENFORCEMENT, ALSO ENCOURAGES OFFICERS TO INTERACT WITH THE COMMUNITY THROUGH TRAFFIC AND CRIMINAL PATROL IN HIGH RISK AREAS IN ORDER TO DEVELOP MUTUAL TRUST AND RESPECT. RESIDENTS IN THESE AREAS WILL BE ABLE TO PROVIDE ISP WITH CRITICAL INFORMATION NECESSARY TO MORE EFFECTIVELY INVESTIGATE CRIMES INVOLVING HEROIN AND OPIOIDS.THROUGH HIGHWAY, PARCEL, AND HOTEL/MOTEL INTERDICTION EFFORTS, ISP HAS BEEN ABLE TO INTERCEPT OVER 20 KILOGRAMS OF HEROIN, 3 KILOGRAMS OF FENTANYL, AND 2.5 KILOGRAMS OF OXYCONTIN IN THE FIRST 6 MONTHS OF 2018. THESE EFFORTS DIRECTLY IMPACT INDIANA COMMUNITIES BY LIMITING THE AMOUNT OF DRUGS THAT ARE AVAILABLE FOR DISTRIBUTION AND CONSUMPTION AND CAN BE BETTER EXPANDED. IF AWARDED AHTF FUNDING ISP WOULD HAVE THE ABILITY TO PURCHASE ADDITIONAL TOOLS FOR THE INTERDICTION UNITS. WITH THIS EQUIPMENT, SEARCHES INTO AREAS SUCH AS TIRES, GAS TANKS, AND POTENTIAL HIDDEN COMPARTMENTS COULD BE COMPLETED IN THE LEAST INTRUSIVE MANNER POSSIBLE. THIS WOULD HELP KEEP CITIZEN COMPLAINTS TO A MINIMUM. IT WOULD ALSO SERVE AS A WAY TO BETTER SUPPORT PROBABLE CAUSE FOR THE DETECTION OF CRIMINAL VIOLATIONS IN SUBSEQUENT COURT PROCEEDINGS.CURRENTLY, ISP ONLY HAS THE ABILITY TO COMPENSATE OFFICERS FOR MISSION CRITICAL ACTIVITIES. ISP DOES NOT HAVE THE CAPABILITY OF FUNDING PROACTIVE INITIATIVES ABOVE AND BEYOND NORMAL PATROL HOURS. AHTF WOULD ALLOW ISP COMMANDERS MORE FLEXIBILITY IN MOBILIZING ASSETS PROACTIVELY.THE THIRD PRONG, TREATMENT, IS A CRITICAL COMPONENT OF OUR OPIOID RESPONSE. OUR PRIMARY GOAL IN THIS AREA IS TO POSITION OURSELVES IN THE COMMUNITIES IN WAYS THAT ENABLE US TO BE A CONDUIT FOR TREATMENT OPTIONS. WE HOPE TO FACILITATE THIS BY ARMING EACH AND EVERY MEMBER OF OUR DEPARTMENT WITH AN EXHAUSTIVE LIST OF EVERY AVAILABLE TREATMENT RESOURCE IN INDIANA. THOUGH THIS SHOULD HAVE LITTLE TO NO FISCAL IMPACT TO ISP, IT IS ONE OF THE MOST NECESSARY ASPECTS OF OUR OVERARCHING GOAL TO PARTNER WITH COMMUNITY STAKEHOLDERS. THIS FOSTERS RELATIONSHIPS AND TRUST BETWEEN THE COMMUNITIES AND ISP.THE FOURTH PRONG OF OUR INITIATIVE, DATA COLLECTION, SHOULD ALSO BE ACCOMPLISHED WITH MINIMAL FINANCIAL BURDEN. THE DEVELOPMENT OF MEANINGFUL PARTNERSHIPS WITH OTHER STATE AGENCIES HAS IMPROVED THE ACCURACY OF DATA COLLECTION AND COLLATION. THIS IS AN INVALUABLE TOOL BETTER ENABLING ISP COMMANDERS TO STRATEGICALLY ALLOCATE RESOURCES WHERE THEY ARE THE MOST NEEDED. NEAR REAL TIME STATISTICS ALLOWS SUPERVISORS TO ANALYZE PRODUCTIVITY AND QUICKLY RE-EVALUATE ACTION PLANS.FINALLY, ISP HAS RECEIVED SEVERAL REQUESTS FROM LOCAL DEPARTMENTS TO RESPOND TO SCENES CONTAINING SUSPECTED FENTANYL OR OTHER SYNTHETIC OPIOIDS. THIS HAS PROMPTED ISP TO BEGIN DEVELOPMENT OF PROTOCOL FOR THE RESPONSE TO AND PROCESSING OF THIS TYPE OF HAZARDOUS SCENE. TO DATE, ISP HAS UTILIZED TROOPERS TRAINED IN CLANDESTINE LABORATORY PROCESSING; HOWEVER, THEY ARE TRAINED AND EQUIPPED PRIMARILY THROUGH FUNDING SOURCES MORE SPECIFICALLY ALLOCATED FOR CLANDESTINE METHAMPHETAMINE LABS. FUNDING FOR OPIOID INVESTIGATIVE WORK IS CRITICAL AS IT WILL ALLOW ISP TO BETTER TRAIN AND EQUIP A REASONABLY SIZED CADRE OF PERSONNEL TO ADDRESS THESE SCENES IN THE SAFEST MANNER POSSIBLE.ALTHOUGH ISP’S OPIOID RESPONSE INITIATIVE IS UNDERWAY, ADDITIONAL FUNDING WILL BE NECESSARY IF MAXIMUM SUCCESS IS TO BE ACHIEVED.

THE ROLE OF POLICE IS EVOLVING TO ENCOMPASS BROADER AREAS OF INFLUENCE TO THEIR COMMUNITY. THE IMPACT AN OFFICER CAN HAVE ON A COMMUNITY GOES FAR BEYOND ARREST AND PROSECUTION OF CRIMINALS. THE FOCUS HAS BECOME MORE ON CHANGE LEADERSHIP, CHANGE MANAGEMENT, PUBLIC TRUST, COMPETENCE, PROBLEM SOLVING, ANALYSIS, AND COLLABORATION AMONG COMMUNITY GROUPS AND OTHER POLICE AGENCIES. IN SOME RECRUIT TRAINING PROGRAMS THERE IS A BRIEF SELF-AWARENESS AND INTERPERSONAL-RELATIONS FOCUS.  HAVE SPECIFIC EDUCATION AND COMPETENCY-BASED TRAINING IN SELF-MANAGEMENT, SOCIAL AND EMOTIONAL INTELLIGENCE SKILLS, AND TEAM AND ORGANIZATION DEVELOPMENT SKILLS THAT ARE NECESSARY FOR SUCCESS IN THE VERY COMPLEX JOB OF POLICE LEADERSHIP AT ANY RANK.SUPPORTING THE COMMUNITY POLICING PRINCIPLE OF INCREASED EMPOWERMENT AT ALL ORGANIZATIONAL LEVELS, OUR PROPOSED PROJECT: EVERY OFFICER IS A LEADER WILL TRAIN AND DEVELOP CREDIBLE LEADERS TO EMBODY THE NOBLE CAUSE OF SERVING JUSTICE. THIS PROJECT WILL SUPPORT LINE OFFICERS IN THE DEVELOPMENT AND MASTERY OF SIXTY SKILLS IN FIVE AREAS OF COMPETENCE: SELF-MANAGEMENT, INTERPERSONAL COMMUNICATION AND CONFLICT MANAGEMENT, PROBLEM AND OPPORTUNITY MANAGEMENT, TEAM AND ORGANIZATION DEVELOPMENT, AND VERSATILITY SKILLS. THE INNOVATIVE TRAINING PROJECT INCLUDES DIRECT DELIVERY TO LINE LAW ENFORCEMENT OFFICERS AND EXECUTIVES, AND A TRAIN-THE-TRAINER COMPONENT FOR SUSTAINABILITY AFTER THE PROJECT.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS PROJECT: “PARTNERSHIPS IN COMMUNITY POLICING: REGIONAL TRAINING WITH A NATIONAL IMPACT” IS TO SUPPORT THE DEVELOPMENT OF A NETWORK OF REGIONAL TRAINING HUBS THAT CAN SERVE AS TRAINING HOSTS AND TEST-BEDS OF TRAINING INNOVATION. THIS PROJECT SHALL BE DEVELOPED IN COLLABORATION WITH THE COPS OFFICE TO JOINTLY IDENTIFY TRAINING INNOVATIONS TO BE TESTED AND APPROPRIATE TRAINING HOSTS/PARTNERS TO IMPLEMENT SELECTED TRAININGS. IADLEST WILL WORK WITH THE COPS OFFICE TO DEVELOP A RESEARCH AND EVALUATION APPROACH TO TEST THE EFFECTIVENESS OF LAW ENFORCEMENT TRAINING BY INCREASING APPLICATION OF TECHNOLOGY IN LAW ENFORCEMENT AND EXPLORATION OF A POLICING ACTION LAB TO STUDY WHAT REALLY WORKS IN LAW ENFORCEMENT TRAINING. IADLEST WILL IDENTIFY THE BEST FACILITY AND LOCATION FOR A SPECIFIC TRAINING. REGIONAL LAB APPROACHES ALLOW FLEXIBILITY IN WHERE TRAINING IS LOCATED AND WHAT TRAINERS TO BRING INTO THE PROCESS. THIS DIFFUSION MODEL WILL INCREASE THE NUMBER OF TRAININGS WITHOUT TYING THEM TO A SPECIFIC TRAINING FACILITY. A REGIONAL APPROACH ALLOWS IADLEST TO USE EXISTING FACILITIES, ESTABLISHED AND CREDENTIALED TRAINERS WHILE BUILDING THE CAPACITY OF THEIR REGIONAL AND LOCAL PARTNERS. THIS PROCESS LOCALIZES TRAINING AND DEFIES TRAINING APPROACHES THAT SUGGEST ONE SIZE FITS ALL.

MSU TAKES A FOUR-PRONGED APPROACH TO METH INVESTIGATIONS: CREATING PARTNERSHIPS, EDUCATION, ENFORCEMENT, AND LEGISLATION. EACH PRONG IS LISTED IN THE ORDER OF IMPORTANCE. WE UNDERSTAND THAT ENFORCEMENT ACTION IS STRENGTHENED WHEN COMMUNITY AND PROFESSIONAL PARTNERSHIPS ARE CREATED AND COMMUNITIES ARE EDUCATED ON THE DYNAMICS OF SPECIFIC CRIMES, SUCH AS THE CLANDESTINE MANUFACTURE OF METHAMPHETAMINE. THOSE COMMUNITY PARTNERS WHO HAVE BEEN EDUCATED THEN ASSIST THE INDIANA STATE POLICE AND OTHER POLICE AGENCIES WITH ENFORCEMENT EFFORTS BY PROVIDING INFORMATION ON CRIME TRENDS, SUSPICIOUS ACTIVITY AND SUSPECT INFORMATION. THIS IS ESPECIALLY TRUE WITH THE MANUFACTURE OF METHAMPHETAMINE BECAUSE OF THE DANGERS IT POSES DUE TO FIRES, EXPLOSIONS AND CONTAMINATION. FEEDBACK FROM THE COMMUNITY AND TRACKING DATA ASSISTS WITH LEGISLATIVE EFFORTS TO CURB METH LABS. THIS HAS BEEN THE ISP’S STRATEGIC PLAN SINCE THE FORMATION OF A FULLTIME TEAM OF INVESTIGATORS FOCUSED ON METHAMPHETAMINE ISSUES OVER A DOZEN YEARS AGO. THE FRUIT SEEN TODAY IS A RESULT OF THE APPROACH’S EFFICACY AND A STATEMENT OF IMPORTANCE REGARDING INSURING ITS SUSTAINABILITY.THE SUCCESS OF THE ISP MSU CAN BE SEEN IN THE STATISTICAL INFORMATION PROVIDED IN THE APPENDICES. WE BELIEVE OUR EFFORTS IN EDUCATION, PUBLIC OUTREACH, AND THE FORGING OF INTERAGENCY PARTNERSHIPS HAVE LED TO THE INCREASED AWARENESS AND SUBSEQUENT PROPER REPORTING OF METH LAB SCENES. THE PARTNERSHIPS CREATED AMONG LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCIES AND RETAILERS SELLING THE PRODUCTS USED TO MAKE METH HELP WITH INFORMATION AND INTELLIGENCE SHARING. THESE PARTNERSHIPS HELP DRIVE THE NUMBERS OF LAB SEIZURES BECAUSE VALID, ACTIONABLE INFORMATION IS SHARED AMONG STAKEHOLDERS.DUE TO THE HIGH VOLUME OF METH LAB CALLOUTS AND CRIME SCENES PROCESSED, NEW SAFETY VEHICLES TO PULL THE SAFETY TRAILERS ARE NEEDED ALONG WITH CONSOLES AND COMPUTER STANDS FOR EACH TRUCK. SOME OF THE CURRENT TRUCKS ARE TEN YEARS OLD WITH HIGH MILEAGE. THESE TRUCKS WILL NOT HAVE AN EFFECT ON METH LAB SEIZURES, BUT THE PURCHASE WILL HAVE AN IMPACT ON THE SAFETY AND WELL-BEING OF OUR PERSONNEL. IN ADDITION, THERE ARE NEW TECHNOLOGIES AVAILABLE THAT ASSIST PUBLIC SAFETY WITH IDENTIFYING UNKNOWN CHEMICALS. BECAUSE MANY OF THE CHEMICALS UTILIZED TO MANUFACTURE METH FOUND AT CLAN LAB CRIME SCENES ARE NOT IN THEIR ORIGINAL CONTAINERS, FIELD TESTING NEEDS TO BE COMPLETED TO ENSURE PROSECUTION OF DEFENDANTS AND SAFETY OF TEAM MEMBERS. PROVIDING HANDHELD REMOTE SENSING INSTRUMENTS WILL ENABLE CLAN LAB CERTIFIED OFFICERS ACROSS THE STATE TO MORE ACCURATELY FIELD TEST POTENTIALLY HARMFUL SUBSTANCES THAT CANNOT BE SUBMITTED TO THE LABORATORY FOR ANALYSIS.THE TRAINING THAT WILL BE PROVIDED THROUGH THIS GRANT WILL ASSIST WITH EDUCATING ALL CLAN LAB CERTIFIED POLICE PERSONNEL THROUGHOUT THE STATE WHO CAN THEN ASSIST COMMUNITIES IN UNDERSTANDING THE TRENDS AND DANGERS ASSOCIATED WITH THE LOCAL MANUFACTURE OF CONTROLLED SUBSTANCES. WELL EDUCATED PERSONNEL MAKES FOR SAFER SCENE PROCESSING WHICH IN TURN BY EXTENSION IMPROVES THE SAFETY OF COMMUNITIES. THE TRAINING WILL ALSO EDUCATE ALL CLAN LAB MEMBERS ON THE NEWEST TRENDS OF CLAN LAB INVESTIGATIONS AND IDENTIFYING DANGEROUS DRUG SCENES WHEN THEY ARE ENCOUNTERED.MUCH OF THE EQUIPMENT USED AT CLAN LAB SCENES IN INDIANA WAS PURCHASED WHEN LAB RESPONSES WERE MULTIPLE PER DAY. THIS EQUIPMENT IS OLD, WORN OUT, AND IN NEED OF REPLACEMENT. THE MOST IMPORTANT NEED OF EQUIPMENT FOR THE CLAN LAB TEAM IS TO REPLACE THE PHOSPHINE AND AIR MONITORING DEVICES. THESE DEVICES NOTIFY TEAM MEMBERS WHEN THERE IS A DANGEROUS LEVEL OF TOXIC AIR AND SAVE LIVES.CONTINUATION OF OVERTIME PAYMENT FROM THE COPS CAMP FY2016 TO THIS GRANT WILL CONTINUE TO PRODUCE SUCCESSFUL PARTNERSHIPS, INCREASED SAFETY, AND POSITIVE PROGRAM OUTCOMES.

THE TENNESSEE DANGEROUS DRUGS TASK FORCE (TDDTF) IS REQUESTING 2018 CAMP FUNDING FOR $789,266 IN SUPPORT OF EFFORTS TO ADDRESS THE STATE OF TNS GROWING METHAMPHETAMINE EPIDEMIC. METH-RELATED CRIMES ARE A PUBLIC SAFETY ISSUE AFFECTING CITIZENS AND DRUG ENDANGERED CHILDREN IN TENNESSEE (TN) IN ALL GEOGRAPHICAL LOCATION. TN REMAINS AMONG THE HIGHEST NATIONALLY IN LAB SEIZURES AND THE TDDTF IS THE PRINCIPAL RESOURCE IN TN FOR METH-RELATED LAW ENFORCEMENT (LE) SUPPORT/TRAINING, PUBLIC EDUCATION, AND INTELLIGENCE SHARING. THE SURGE IN AVAILABILITY, DISTRIBUTION, ADDICTION, AND ABUSE OF METH IN TN IS AN EPIDEMIC CRISIS FOR THE PUBLIC SAFETY AND HEALTH OF OUR CITIZENS. THE TDDTF AND ITS COLLABORATIVE PARTNERS CONTINUE TO STRIVE FOR THE PROTECTION OF THE CITIZENS AND DRUG ENDANGERED CHILDREN OF TN FROM THE ONGOING AND PREVALENT METH-RELATED STRUGGLES WHICH ARE GREATER THAN ANY TIME IN OUR PAST.  UTILIZING A MULTIDISCIPLINE AND MULTIJURISDICTIONAL STATEWIDE TEAM STRUCTURE, THE TDDTF PROVIDES RESOURCES AND INTELLIGENCE/INFORMATION SHARING TO LEA METH-RELATED INVESTIGATIONS. THE SUCCESSES OF THE TEAM APPROACH INCLUDE COLLABORATIVE PARTNERSHIP WITH STATE AGENCIES, ENVIRONMENTAL/CONSERVATION, CHILDREN’S SERVICES, HEALTHCARE, TREATMENT, FIRST RESPONDERS, SCHOOLS, DRUG COALITIONS, AND COMMUNITY LEADERS JOINING TOGETHER IN THIS STRUGGLE.  THE TDDTF OFFERS LE TRAINING IN METH-RELATED INCIDENTS INCLUDING REPORTING, RESPONSE, TRACKING/RECEIVING INTELLIGENCE ON DTO’S AND OFFENDERS THROUGH DI3 DATABASE, AND PROPER USE OF THIS DATA AND GATHERED EVIDENCE FOR SUCCESSFUL METH INVESTIGATIONS.  SINCE ITS INCEPTION IN 1999, THE TDDTF HAS REFINED ITS TRAINING AND INTELLIGENCE FOCUS TO ADDRESS THE CHANGING NEEDS RELATED TO METHAMPHETAMINE INVESTIGATIONS. FUNDS RECEIVED FROM THE CAMP WOULD ENABLE CONTINUED AND ENHANCED EDUCATION OF THE PUBLIC ON METH, INCLUDING DETECTING MANUFACTURE AND USE. IN 2015, THE MISSION OF THE TDDTF WAS EXPANDED TO INCLUDE ALL SCHEDULED DRUGS USING THE ANTI-METH TECHNIQUES ALREADY IN PLACE, I.E. COLLABORATIVE PARTNERSHIPS, MULTI-DISCIPLINE EXECUTIVE BOARD, DI3 INTELLIGENCE DATABASE, STATEWIDE LEA, HEALTH AND MENTAL HEALTH/SUBSTANCE ABUSE AGENCIES, CHILDREN’S SERVICES, ENVIRONMENTAL/CONSERVATION, COMMUNITY EDUCATION, DRUG COALITIONS, JUDICIAL DRUG TASK FORCES, AND TN NATIONAL GUARD COUNTERDRUG. THE EXPANSION OF THE FORMER ANTI-METH ORGANIZATION WAS A LOGICAL PROGRESSION WITH THE EXISTING ORGANIZATIONAL STRUCTURE.   WHEN DEA/COPS CLEANUP CEASED IN 2011, THE TDDTF INITIATED THE TN AUTHORIZED CENTRAL STORAGE (ACS) PROGRAM. DUE TO THE ACS, EXPENDITURES BY DEA IN TN ARE NOW BELOW $103 PER LAB RESULTING IN A MULTI-MILLION DOLLAR SAVINGS PLUS REDUCING THE AVERAGE OVERTIME EXPENSE. ALTHOUGH A STATE GRANT PROVIDES ACS CONTAINER AND SUPERVISOR FUNDING, NONE OF THOSE FUNDS MAY BE UTILIZED FOR TDDTF OPERATIONS. THE TDDTF INCIDENT RESPONSE VEHICLES AND TRAINED RESPONDERS ASSIST LE IN PACKAGING AND TRANSPORTING HAZARDOUS WASTE FROM EXTRACTION AND METH LABS TO ONE OF THE 12 ACS CONTAINERS STRATEGICALLY LOCATED ACROSS THE STATE. THE NEED FOR EXTRACTION LAB RESPONSE IS BEING IDENTIFIED AS MEXICAN DTO’S ARE THE MOST COMMON WAYS OF GETTING METH IN TN. PROVIDING RESPONDERS WITH THE MOST UP-TO-DATE TRAINING AND EQUIPMENT WILL ALLOW THEM TO GROW WITH EVOLVING TRENDS AND TO REMAIN DILIGENT WHEN RESPONDING TO ANY METH INCIDENT.

CIVILIAN OVERSIGHT IS INCREASINGLY AN INSTITUTIONALIZED PART OF POLICING IN THE U.S. CURRENTLY, THERE ARE MORE THAN 200 CIVILIAN OVERSIGHT ENTITIES, BROADLY DEFINED, WITH ALMOST ALL LARGE CITIES HAVING SOME FORM OF CIVILIAN OVERSIGHT. A RECENT NACOLE SURVEY FOUND THAT ROUGHLY 55 PERCENT OF RESPONDING AGENCIES INDICATED THAT THEY HAD BEEN IN EXISTENCE FOR 16 OR MORE YEARS. THESE PATTERNS, WHEN TAKEN AS A WHOLE, INDICATE A FIELD THAT IS APPROACHING MATURITY. AN INCREASE IN ORGANIZATIONAL COMPLEXITY MEANS THAT LOCAL JURISDICTIONS HAVE A MUCH BROADER RANGE OF OPTIONS WHEN CONSIDERING THE CHARACTERISTICS OF THE OVERSIGHT MECHANISM THEY WOULD LIKE TO IMPLEMENT. YET THERE ARE STILL TREMENDOUS GAPS IN WHAT WE KNOW ABOUT THE SUBTLE DIFFERENCES BETWEEN THE MODELS, AND HOW THESE DIFFERENCES IMPACT THE FUNCTIONS OR EFFECTIVENESS OF OVERSIGHT. UNTIL NOW, HOWEVER, MUCH OF THE RESEARCH ON CIVILIAN OVERSIGHT HAS BEEN BASED LARGELY ON CASE STUDIES OR ANECDOTAL ACCOUNTS OF INDIVIDUAL AGENCY PRACTICES. FEW STUDIES HAVE BEEN DONE ABOUT THE STATE OF CIVILIAN OVERSIGHT IN THE 21ST CENTURY. ALMOST NONE HAVE COMBINED THE TWO APPROACHES. THIS PROJECT WILL ADDRESS THIS GAP BY COMBINING AN ANALYSIS OF NATIONAL-LEVEL DATA FROM THE RECENTLY COMPLETED NACOLE SURVEY WITH COMPREHENSIVE SITE VISITS TO NINE DIFFERENT OVERSIGHT AGENCIES. THIS ROBUST AND UNIQUE STUDY METHODOLOGY WILL ILLUMINATE IMPORTANT DIFFERENCES BETWEEN MODELS, AND MAY PROVIDE ESSENTIAL INSIGHT INTO WHAT IMPACT, IF ANY, THESE DIFFERENCES HAVE ON INDICATORS SUCH AS CITIZEN COMPLAINTS, POLICE USES OF FORCE, OR EVEN PUBLIC TRUST AND POLICE-COMMUNITY RELATIONS.CREATING MEANINGFUL AND RESPONSIVE OVERSIGHT TAKES TIME, PLANNING, AND GUIDANCE FROM EXPERTS WITH DIRECT EXPERIENCE IN THESE MATTERS. THIS PROJECT WILL MEET THIS NEED BY CREATING A GUIDEBOOK: A STEP-BY-STEP GUIDE TO IMPLEMENTING A COMPREHENSIVE CIVILIAN OVERSIGHT PROGRAM, DEVELOPED BY CIVILIAN OVERSIGHT AND POLICING EXPERTS. THIS GUIDE WILL SERVE AS A BLUEPRINT FOR CITIES, COMMUNITIES, LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCIES AND OTHER KEY STAKEHOLDERS LOOKING TO DEVELOP A NEW CIVILIAN OVERSIGHT PROCESS OR IMPLEMENT BEST PRACTICES. THE GUIDE WILL ADDRESS EVERY PHASE OF THE PROCESS AND WILL PRESENT INFORMATION AND EXAMPLES OF DIFFERENT DECISIONS THAT NEED TO BE MADE AFTER AN OVERSIGHT OFFICE HAS BEEN SET UP., INCLUDING HIRING QUALIFIED STAFF OR VOLUNTEERS, ESTABLISHING POLICIES AND PROCEDURES, GATHERING AND ANALYZING DATA, WRITING REPORTS, CONDUCTING COMMUNITY OUTREACH, AND KEY CHALLENGES AND OPPORTUNITIES.THIS PROJECT WILL USE QUALITATIVE DATA (FROM THE SITE VISITS) AND QUANTITATIVE DATA (FROM BOTH THE SITE VISITS AND SURVEY) TO ESTABLISH CLEAR STANDARDS DEVELOPED BY NACOLE AND THE POLICE FOUNDATION ON BEHALF OF AND WITH THE SUPPORT OF THE COPS OFFICE. IN YEAR ONE OF THE PROJECT, WE PROPOSE TO USE COPS OFFICE GRANT FUNDS TO CONDUCT AT LEAST SIX OF THE NINE TOTAL SITE VISITS, AND TO BEGIN TO GATHER QUANTITATIVE DATA FROM EACH. IN YEAR TWO, WE PROPOSE TO USE THE REMAINDER OF THE GRANT FUNDS TO COMPLETE THE THREE REMAINING SITE VISITS, AND FINALIZE THE OVERVIEW REPORT AND GUIDEBOOK, AND BUILD THE INTERACTIVE ONLINE TOOLKIT. THE PROJECT WILL BUILD UPON AND EXPAND COMMUNITY POLICING PRINCIPLES BY PROMOTING THE DEVELOPMENT OF EFFECTIVE CIVILIAN OVERSIGHT AND BEST PRACTICES. OVERSIGHT FOSTERS ACCOUNTABILITY THROUGH INDEPENDENT INVESTIGATIONS OR AUDITING OF POLICE MISCONDUCT COMPLAINTS, AND ALSO CAN IDENTIFY NEEDED CHANGES IN POLICE PRACTICES AND TRAINING, PROVIDE A MEANINGFUL VOICE OR FORUM FOR THE PUBLIC, AND FORM A CRUCIAL BRIDGE BETWEEN THE PUBLIC AND THE POLICE. JUST AS IMPORTANTLY, OVERSIGHT ENCOURAGES ENHANCED TRANSPARENCY. INCREASED TRANSPARENCY, TRUST, AND COMMUNICATION BETWEEN THE POLICE AND THE PUBLIC, FACILITATED THROUGH EFFECTIVE OVERSIGHT, SUPPORTS GREATER COOPERATION BETWEEN THE POLICE AND THE PUBLIC IN ACHIEVING THE ULTIMATE GOAL OF DECREASED CRIME AND INCREASED PUBLIC SAFETY. THESE ARE KEY ELEMENTS OF EFFECTIVE COMMUNITY POLICING.

THIS IS A PROPOSAL TO DEVELOP A GUIDEBOOK TO HELP LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCIES WORK THROUGH THE MANY DIFFICULT QUESTIONS SURROUNDING THE COLLECTION, ANALYSIS, AND REPORTING OF TRAFFIC AND PEDESTRIAN STOP DATA. AS THE PRESIDENT’S TASK FORCE ON 21ST CENTURY POLICING MADE CLEAR, COLLECTING SUCH DATA IS ESSENTIAL TO PROMOTING TRANSPARENCY AND ACCOUNTABILITY, AND TO IDENTIFYING AND ADDRESSING INSTANCES OF POLICE BIAS WHERE THEY ARISE. AT THE SAME TIME, COLLECTING STOP DATA POSES A NUMBER OF CHALLENGES, FROM ESTABLISHING UNIFORM STANDARDS ON THE TYPES OF ENCOUNTERS THAT OUGHT TO BE REPORTED, TO DEVELOPING THE APPROPRIATE BENCHMARKS AGAINST WHICH TO COMPARE DEMOGRAPHIC VARIATION, TO PROVIDING THE CONTEXT NECESSARY TO INTERPRET THE RESULTS PROPERLY.THE CALIFORNIA LEGISLATURE RECENTLY PASSED A BILL REQUIRING ALL OF LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCIES IN THE STATE TO COLLECT DEMOGRAPHIC AND OTHER DATA ON ALL STOPS, AND HAS TASKED THE CALIFORNIA ATTORNEY GENERAL’S (CAAG) OFFICE WITH DEVELOPING GUIDELINES AND TECHNICAL SPECIFICATIONS TO GUIDE LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCIES IN DOING SO. BEGINNING TO COLLECT STOP DATA IS AN ENORMOUS UNDERTAKING THAT MAY HAVE PROFOUND IMPLICATIONS BOTH FOR THE PUBLIC AND FOR OFFICERS ON THE FRONT LINES—AND THEREFORE IT IS IMPERATIVE TO GET THE IMPLEMENTATION RIGHT.WE PROPOSE TO PARTNER WITH THE CENTER FOR POLICING EQUITY AT THE UNIVERSITY OF CALIFORNIA LOS ANGELES AND THE POLICING PROJECT AT NEW YORK UNIVERSITY SCHOOL OF LAW (“RESEARCH PARTNERS”) TO DEVELOP A SET OF BEST PRACTICES FOR THE COLLECTION, ANALYSIS, AND REPORTING OF STOP DATA—AND ULTIMATELY TO DEVELOP A GUIDEBOOK FOR USE BY LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCIES BOTH IN CALIFORNIA AND NATIONWIDE. OUR GUIDEBOOK WILL BUILD ON EXISTING RESEARCH AND RESOURCES IN TWO IMPORTANT WAYS. FIRST, IT WILL IMPROVE UPON EXISTING GUIDELINES FOR ANALYZING STOP DATA BY GIVING DEPARTMENTS THE TOOLS NECESSARY TO NOT ONLY IDENTIFY INSTANCES OF BIAS WHERE IT EXISTS, BUT ALSO DETERMINE WHETHER BIAS STEMS FROM DEPARTMENT POLICY, INDIVIDUAL OFFICER TRAINING OR BIASES, OR SOME COMBINATION OF BOTH. MORE IMPORTANTLY, IT WILL OFFER MUCH-NEEDED GUIDANCE ON DATA COLLECTION, INTEGRATION, AND REPORTING, WHICH ARE TOPICS THAT EXISTING RESOURCES ADDRESS ONLY PRELIMINARILY OR IN PASSING. IN PARTICULAR, THE GUIDEBOOK WILL OFFER GUIDANCE ON HOW BEST TO DEFINE A STOP AND TRAIN OFFICERS ON THE DEFINITION; HOW TO CHOOSE AMONG EXISTING TECHNOLOGIES TO SUPPORT DATA COLLECTION EFFORTS; AND HOW TO INTEGRATE STOP DATA INTO EXISTING RECORD MANAGEMENT AND EARLY WARNING SYSTEMS; AND HOW TO REPORT DATA TO THE PUBLIC IN INFORMATIVE AND ACCESSIBLE WAYS.
CULTURAL HUMILITY IN DIVERSE COMMUNITIES: INCREASING CAPACITY FOR ENGAGEMENT AND PROBLEM SOLVING & WORLD CAFES

CHICAGO'S MICROGRANT INITIATIVE FOR LAW ENFORCEMENT PROJECT: - - -

THE INDIANAPOLIS METRO POLICE DEPARTMENT (IMPD) 2016 CPD COPS GRANT APPLICATION PERTAINS TO THE TOPIC AREA: MICRO- GRANT INITIATIVE FOR LAW ENFORCEMENT: OPEN TOPIC AREA: THE PRESIDENT’S TASK FORCE ON 21ST CENTURY POLICING- 6TH PILLAR (SAFETY AND WELLNESS).THE IMPD IS COMPRISED OF APPROXIMATELY 1600 SWORN POLICE OFFICERS SERVING AN AREA OF ALMOST ONE MILLION CITIZENS. AFTER A SERIES OF PUBLICIZED OFFICER EVENTS IN INDIANAPOLIS AND AROUND THE COUNTRY THAT SERVED TO NEGATIVELY REFLECT ON LAW ENFORCEMENT AND IMPEDE RELATIONSHIPS WITH THE COMMUNITY, IMPD EMBARKED UPON A GROUND-BREAKING OFFICER WELLNESS AND RESILIENCY PROGRAM TO COMBAT EMPLOYEE CRISIS USING INNOVATIVE STRATEGIES AND BEST PRACTICES. THE PROBLEM-SOLVING PROGRAM IDENTIFIED AGENCY AND COMMUNITY STAKEHOLDERS AND USED EDUCATION AND CRISIS SUPPORT RESOURCES FOR EARLY INTERVENTION RATHER THAN WAITING FOR CRISIS TO OCCUR. THE GOAL WAS FOR OFFICERS TO MAINTAIN HEALTH THROUGHOUT THEIR CAREER POSTULATING THAT HEALTHY OFFICERS REFLECT A HEALTHY AGENCY, WHICH REFLECTS POSITIVE HEALTHY POLICE-COMMUNITY RELATIONSHIPS. FOR PURPOSES OF THE MICRO-GRANT THE IMPD PROPOSES REPLICATING THE IMPD WELLNESS PROGRAM (THROUGH CPD FUNDING) BY OFFERING 10 REGIONAL TRAINING CLASSES ACROSS THE US OVER A PERIOD OF ONE YEAR AT NO COST TO LOCAL, STATE AND FEDERAL LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCIES IN AN EFFORT TO RAISE WELLNESS AWARENESS, PROVIDE EDUCATION AND ESTABLISH NATIONAL BEST PRACTICES. INFORMATION ON HEALTHY PRACTICES AND AVAILABLE RESOURCES WILL BE PROVIDED ON TOPICS OF MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH, ADDICTIVE ISSUES, PHYSICAL HEALTH, STRESS AND TRAUMA, SUICIDE, AND RELATIONSHIP, FAMILY AND FINANCIAL DISTRESS; ALL CORNERSTONES OF THE INDIANAPOLIS WELLNESS MODEL. PART AND PARCEL TO THE TRAINING, A CONFIDENTIAL SURVEY ON THE LEVELS OF OFFICER DISTRESS IN KEY CRISIS AREAS WILL BE COMPLETED BY OFFICERS ATTENDING TRAINING. THIS APPLIED RESEARCH, REPORTED BACK TO COPS UPON COMPLETION OF THE MICRO-GRANT, WILL PROVIDE ACADEMIC DATA NECESSARY TO INCREASE AWARENESS OF LAW ENFORCEMENT WELLNESS ISSUES AS INTRODUCED IN THE PRESIDENT’S TASK FORCE REPORT. THE IMPD OFFICER WELLNESS MODEL HAS BEEN RECOGNIZED AS INNOVATIVE AND GROUNDBREAKING THUS JUSTIFYING USE AS A NATIONAL TRAINING MODEL. IN 2015, IMPD RECEIVED THE DOJ/BJA/NLEOMF DESTINATION ZERO VALOR AWARD FOR OFFICER WELLNESS. IN APRIL 2016, US ATTORNEY GENERAL LORETTA LYNCH, WHILE ON A TOUR ACROSS THE US PROMOTING THE PRESIDENT’S TASK FORCE, STATED “THE INDIANAPOLIS POLICE WELLNESS PROGRAM SHOULD BE THE MODEL FOR LAW ENFORCEMENT WELLNESS ACROSS THE UNITED STATES.” IN MAY 2015, IMPD PROVIDED TESTIMONY ON LAW ENFORCEMENT WELLNESS AS A PANELIST AT THE CONGRESSIONAL LAW ENFORCEMENT CAUCUS IN WASHINGTON DC. SUPPORTERS AND STAKEHOLDERS IN THE IMPD CPD MICRO-GRANT APPLICATION INCLUDE THE FBI NATIONAL ACADEMY ASSOCIATES, ACADIA HEALTHCARE PROVIDERS, THE CONGRESSIONAL LAW ENFORCEMENT CAUCUS, THE US ATTORNEY'S OFFICE (INDIANAPOLIS) AND INDIANAPOLIS AREA POLICE-COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIPS.

MSU TAKES A FOUR-PRONGED APPROACH TO METH INVESTIGATIONS: CREATING PARTNERSHIPS, EDUCATION, ENFORCEMENT AND LEGISLATION. EACH PRONG IS LISTED IN THE ORDER OF IMPORTANCE. WE UNDERSTAND THAT ENFORCEMENT ACTION IS STRENGTHENED WHEN COMMUNITY AND PROFESSIONAL PARTNERSHIPS ARE CREATED AND COMMUNITIES ARE EDUCATED ON THE DYNAMICS OF SPECIFIC CRIMES, SUCH AS THE CLANDESTINE MANUFACTURE OF METHAMPHETAMINE. THOSE COMMUNITY PARTNERS WHO HAVE BEEN EDUCATED THEN ASSIST THE INDIANA STATE POLICE AND OTHER POLICE AGENCIES WITH ENFORCEMENT EFFORTS BY PROVIDING INFORMATION ON CRIME TRENDS, SUSPICIOUS ACTIVITY AND SUSPECT INFORMATION. THIS IS ESPECIALLY TRUE WITH THE MANUFACTURE OF METHAMPHETAMINE BECAUSE OF THE DANGERS IT POSES DUE TO FIRES, EXPLOSIONS AND CONTAMINATION. FEEDBACK FROM THE COMMUNITY AND TRACKING DATA ASSISTS WITH LEGISLATIVE EFFORTS TO CURB METH LABS.THE SUCCESS OF THE ISP MSU CAN BE SEEN IN THE STATISTICAL INFORMATION PROVIDED IN THE APPENDICES. THE RISE IN METH LAB SEIZURES MAY IN PART BE DUE TO THE ADDICTIVE NATURE OF THE DRUG AND EASY ACCESS TO THE PRECURSOR AND REAGENT CHEMICALS. WE BELIEVE OUR EFFORTS IN EDUCATION, PUBLIC OUTREACH, AND THE FORGING OF INTERAGENCY PARTNERSHIPS HAVE LED TO THE INCREASED AWARENESS AND SUBSEQUENT PROPER REPORTING OF METH LAB SCENES. THE PARTNERSHIPS CREATED AMONG LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCIES AND RETAILERS SELLING THE PRODUCTS USED TO MAKE METH HELP WITH INFORMATION AND INTELLIGENCE SHARING. THESE PARTNERSHIPS HELP DRIVE THE HIGH NUMBERS OF LAB SEIZURES BECAUSE VALID, ACTIONABLE INFORMATION IS SHARED AMONG STAKEHOLDERS.DUE TO THE HIGH VOLUME OF METH LAB CALLOUTS AND CRIME SCENES PROCESSED, NEW SAFETY VEHICLES TO PULL THE SAFETY TRAILERS ARE NEEDED ALONG WITH CONSOLES AND COMPUTER STANDS FOR EACH TRUCK. SOME OF THE CURRENT TRUCKS ARE TEN YEARS OLD WITH HIGH MILEAGE. THESE TRUCKS WILL NOT HAVE AN EFFECT ON METH LAB SEIZURES, BUT THE PURCHASE WILL HAVE AN IMPACT ON THE SAFETY AND WELL-BEING OF OUR PERSONNEL. IN ADDITION, THERE ARE NEW TECHNOLOGIES AVAILABLE THAT ASSIST PUBLIC SAFETY WITH IDENTIFYING UNKNOWN CHEMICALS. BECAUSE MANY OF THE CHEMICALS UTILIZED TO MANUFACTURE METH FOUND AT CLAN LAB CRIME SCENES ARE NOT IN THEIR ORIGINAL CONTAINERS, FIELD TESTING NEEDS TO BE COMPLETED TO ENSURE PROSECUTION OF DEFENDANTS AND SAFETY OF TEAM MEMBERS. PROVIDING TRUNARC INSTRUMENTS WILL ENABLE CLAN LAB CERTIFIED OFFICERS ACROSS THE STATE TO MORE ACCURATELY FIELD TEST POTENTIALLY HARMFUL SUBSTANCES THAT CANNOT BE SUBMITTED TO THE LABORATORY FOR ANALYSIS.THE TRAINING THAT WILL BE PROVIDED THROUGH THIS GRANT WILL ASSIST WITH EDUCATING OTHER CLAN LAB CERTIFIED POLICE PERSONNEL THROUGHOUT THE STATE WHO CAN THEN ASSIST COMMUNITIES IN UNDERSTANDING THE TRENDS AND DANGERS ASSOCIATED WITH THE LOCAL MANUFACTURE OF CONTROLLED SUBSTANCES. WELL EDUCATED PERSONNEL MAKES FOR SAFER SCENE PROCESSING WHICH IN TURN BY EXTENSION IMPROVES THE SAFETY OF COMMUNITIES.THE LARGEST IMPACT ON PUBLIC SAFETY FROM THIS GRANT WILL BE THE PAYMENT OF ALL OVERTIME EARNED BY ISP MSU PERSONNEL. THE ISP HAS APPROXIMATELY 10% OF ITS SWORN PERSONNEL AND FOUR CIVILIANS CERTIFIED TO PROCESS METH LAB CRIME SCENES. PAYMENT WILL BE MADE OF THE OVERTIME EARNED BY ISP MSU PERSONNEL WHO ARE CALLED OUT AFTER HOURS TO PROCESS THESE SCENES FOR NEARLY EVERY POLICE AGENCY IN THE STATE. FROM 2009 TO 2013, THE ISP LOST AN AVERAGE OF 4,500 HOURS OF PRODUCTIVITY PER YEAR DUE TO THE BANKING OF COMPENSATORY TIME WHEN OVERTIME WAS EARNED BY TEAM MEMBERS BUT COULD NOT BE PAID. AVERAGING THE DAILY HOURS WORKED, THAT WAS A LOSS OF OVER 560 WORK DAYS OF PRODUCTIVITY FOR TRAFFIC ENFORCEMENT, COMMUNITY POLICE WORK, CRIMINAL INVESTIGATIONS, EVIDENCE ANALYSIS AND SUPPORTING OTHER POLICE AGENCIES WITH METH LAB INVESTIGATIONS EACH YEAR. CONTINUATION OF OVERTIME PAYMENT FROM THE COPS CAMP FY2014 TO THIS GRANT WILL CONTINUE TO PRODUCE SUCCESSFUL PARTNERSHIPS, INCREASED SAFETY, AND POSITIVE PROGRAM OUTCOMES.

THE TENNESSEE DANGEROUS DRUG TASK FORCE (TDDTF), FORMERLY THE TENNESSEE METHAMPHETAMINE AND PHARMACEUTICAL TASK FORCE, SUBMITS THIS PROPOSAL FOR FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $940,918 FROM THE 2015 ANTI-HEROIN TASK FORCE (AHTF) PROGRAM. THIS FUNDING WOULD BE UTILIZED BY THE TDDTF TO ADVANCE PUBLIC SAFETY AND PROTECTION OF AFFECTED DRUG ENDANGERED CHILDREN. IT IS A FURTHER GOAL TO EDUCATE THE PUBLIC TO PREVENT ADDICTION AND ASSOCIATED FACTORS.THE TDDTF UTILIZES AN INTERDISCIPLINARY TEAM STRUCTURE FOCUSING ON PROVIDING RESOURCES AND INTELLIGENCE SHARING IN SUPPORT OF LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCIES INVOLVED IN INVESTIGATIONS OF THE UNLAWFUL DISTRIBUTION OF OPIOIDS, INCLUDING HEROIN AND PRESCRIPTION PAINKILLERS, IN TENNESSEE. THE PROVEN SUCCESS OF THE TDDTF TEAM APPROACH INCLUDES ALL LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCIES IN TENNESSEE ALONG WITH A COLLABORATIVE PARTNERSHIP WITH NUMEROUS STATE DEPARTMENTS AND OTHER AGENCIES. THE MULTI-DISCIPLINE AGENCIES JOIN TOGETHER UNDER THE UMBRELLA OF THE TDDTF IN THE FIGHT AGAINST THE UNLAWFUL TRAFFICKING/DISTRIBUTION OF OPIOIDS IN TENNESSEE.THROUGH THE TDDTF, LAW ENFORCEMENT WILL RECEIVE TRAINING AND GUIDANCE FOR INVESTIGATIONS AND RESPONDING TO CRIME SCENES INVOLVING THE UNLAWFUL TRAFFICKING/DISTRIBUTION OF OPIOIDS. THESE INVESTIGATIVE PROCESSES INCLUDE GATHERING EVIDENCE AND SHARING INTELLIGENCE WITH MULTIJURISDICTIONAL LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCIES ACROSS THE STATE. ADDITIONALLY, AS THE MANAGING AGENCY OF THE TENNESSEE ALLIANCE FOR DRUG ENDANGERED CHILDREN (TADEC), THE TDDTF ENDEAVORS TO UTILIZE THE RESOURCES OF THE TADEC AND THE NATIONAL ALLIANCE FOR DRUG ENDANGERED CHILDREN TO BE PREEMPTIVE ON THE PROTECTION OF TENNESSEE’S DRUG ENDANGERED CHILDREN. A FURTHER ELEMENT OF THE TDDTF’S INVOLVEMENT IN TADEC IS ENGAGING THE MULTIJURISDICTIONAL AGENCIES OF EACH OF TENNESSEE’S JUDICIAL DISTRICTS IN FORMAL ADOPTION OF TADEC PROTOCOLS.SINCE ITS INCEPTION IN 1999, THE TDDTF HAS CONSTANTLY REFINED ITS TRAINING AND FOCUS. THE RESOURCES UTILIZED TO OPERATE THIS HIGHLY SUCCESSFUL TASK FORCE ARE NOW BEING DEPLOYED IN A STATEWIDE MULTIJURISDICTIONAL AND MULTIDISCIPLINARY ENDEAVOR AGAINST ILLICIT HEROIN AND OPIOIDS. IN 2010, THE MISSION OF THE TDDTF WAS EXPANDED TO INCLUDE DIVERSION OF PHARMACEUTICALS AND HAS RECENTLY BEEN EXPANDED TO INCLUDE ALL DANGEROUS DRUGS, INCLUDING HEROIN.DUE TO THE TYPE OF INFORMATION REQUIRED FOR SUCCESS OF ANTI-HEROIN AND PRESCRIPTION OPIOIDS INVESTIGATIONS, AN ABUNDANCE OF TRAINING IS NEEDED FOR LEO. BECAUSE OF THE MULTIJURISDICTIONAL REACH OF THE TDDTF, DEVELOPMENT OF STATEWIDE STANDARDIZED TRAINING FOR LEO TO ENSURE LINKING AND SHARING OF INTELLIGENCE ON ANTI-OPIOID INVESTIGATIONS IS ESSENTIAL. A MAJOR EFFORT MUST BE MADE ESPECIALLY IN THE FORUMS WITH MEDICAL PROFESSIONALS AND SERVICE PROVIDERS. THE TDDTF MULTIDISCIPLINE TEAM STRUCTURE LENDS ITSELF TO EDUCATING AGENCIES ON CROSSING THE LINES FROM PUBLIC HEALTH TO PUBLIC SAFETY AS WE WORK TOGETHER IN THIS ANTI-OPIOID STRUGGLE.

THE NEW JERSEY STATE POLICE HAS BEEN THE LEADER ON THE ANTI-GANG EFFORT IN THE STATE OF NEW JERSEY FOR NEARLY TWO DECADES. THIS CHARGE HAS BEEN LED ACROSS MANY FRONTS, FROM ENFORCEMENT AND TRAINING, TO INTERVENTION AND PREVENTION. MAINTAINING THIS ROLE HAS BEEN WROUGHT WITH CHALLENGES. THE LOSS OF TASK FORCE PERSONNEL TO DWINDLING LOCAL AND COUNTY RESOURCES, THE SHIFT IN THE GANG ENVIRONMENT, THE LACK OF AVAILABLE TRAINING AND THE LOSS OF COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT HAVE ALL CONTRIBUTED TO AN ENVIRONMENT WHERE GANGS HAVE BEEN ABLE TO CONDUCT BUSINESS AS USUAL. OUR PROPOSAL WILL PUT GANGS OUT OF BUSINESS.THE NEW JERSEY STATE POLICE SEEKS TO REINVIGORATE ITS PLACE AS THE STATE’S LEADER IN A RECONSTITUTED AND VIBRANT EFFORT TO REVAMP ITS CURRENT TASK FORCE STRUCTURE. THIS EFFORT, TO BE CALLED THE NEW JERSEY ANTI-GANG TASK FORCE (NJAGTF) WILL ADD NEW LOCAL, COUNTY AND STATE TASK FORCE OFFICERS TO THE ENFORCEMENT EFFORT, WHILE ENHANCING EXISTING PARTNERSHIPS WITH ENFORCEMENT AND PROSECUTORIAL ENTITIES TO INCREASE THE EFFECTIVENESS OF INVESTIGATIONS AND PROSECUTIONS. THE NJAGTF WILL ALSO COLLABORATE WITH A NUMBER OF DESIGNATED PARTNERS TO PROVIDE TRAINING TO TASK FORCE MEMBERS, TO THE GREATER LAW ENFORCEMENT COMMUNITY AND TO THOSE COMMUNITIES IMPACTED BY GANGS. LASTLY, THE NJAGTF WILL, THROUGH COMMITTED INTERVENTION AND PREVENTION PARTNERS, DEVELOP A COALITION WHOSE RELATIONSHIPS WILL ALLOW THE RESULTS OF TODAY TO EXTEND WELL BEYOND THE TERMINATION OF THE GRANT.THE NJAGTF WILL BE INTELLIGENCE LED, STRATEGICALLY FOCUSING RESOURCES BASED ON INTELLIGENCE ANALYSIS AND INFORMATION SHARING IN ORDER TO EFFECTIVELY BUILD UPON AN EVER INCREASING INVESTIGATIVE FOOTPRINT. BY LEVERAGING THOSE PARTNERSHIPS AND DESIGNATED COLLABORATORS ON THIS PROPOSAL, THE TASK FORCE WILL BE ABLE TO MAXIMIZE ITS IMPACT AT THE MOST GRANULAR LEVELS IN AFFECTED COMMUNITIES. AN ARREST SIMPLY REMOVES A GANG MEMBER FROM THEIR ENVIRONMENT AND NOT NECESSARILY FROM THE COMMUNITY THEY IMPACT. THE COLLECTIVE EFFORT OF THE NJAGTF WILL GO BEYOND MERE HANDCUFFS. IT WILL BE A PROGRAMMATIC APPROACH AIMED AT BUILDING, ASSESSING AND SUSTAINING AN ALL-ENCOMPASSING PROGRAM TO ERADICATE GANGS FROM OUR COMMUNITIES.

ENGAGING COLLEGE STUDENTS IN 21ST CENTURY LAW ENFORCEMENTTHE RONALD W. WALTERS LEADERSHIP AND PUBLIC POLICY CENTER OF HOWARD UNIVERSITY WILL USE COPS GRANT FUNDING TO ADVANCE THE IMPLEMENTATION OF COMMUNITY POLICING BY ENGAGING COLLEGE STUDENTS IN ISSUES RELATED TO RACIAL DIVERSITY AND COMMUNITY MISTRUST OF LAW ENFORCEMENT.  THE WALTERS CENTER’S PROPOSED PROJECT IS ALIGNED WITH THE RECOMMENDATIONS FROM THE PRESIDENT’S TASK FORCE ON 21ST CENTURY. IT IS DESIGNED TO SUPPORT THE IMPLEMENTATION OF RECOMMENDATIONS DEALING WITH THE CREATION OF A DIVERSE LAW ENFORCEMENT WORKFORCE. THE PROPOSED PROJECT WILL ADVANCE THE FOLLOWING GOALS: DEVELOPMENT OF INNOVATIVE COMMUNITY POLICING STRATEGIES AND DEVELOPMENT OF BEST PRACTICES THAT ARE NATIONAL IN SCOPE. WHEN IMPLEMENTED, THIS PROJECT WILL GENERATE ADDITIONAL KNOWLEDGE ABOUT HOW TO RECRUIT RACIALLY DIVERSE MILLENNIALS, ESPECIALLY COLLEGE STUDENTS, FOR LAW ENFORCEMENT AND HOW TO ENGAGE THEM IN WORKING WITH LAW ENFORCEMENT TO BRING ABOUT POSITIVE CHANGE FOR THEIR COMMUNITIES. THIS PROJECT IS CENTERED ON 21ST CENTURY POLICING AND THE ROLE OF AFRICAN AMERICAN MILLENNIALS IN THE PROBLEM-SOLVING PROCESS. COLLEGE STUDENTS WILL PARTICIPATE IN FOCUS GROUPS DESIGNED TO GENERATE INFORMATION ON RECRUITING OFFICERS THAT ARE DIVERSE IN THEIR BACKGROUNDS AND MORE SERVICE-ORIENTED IN THEIR APPROACHES TO LAW ENFORCEMENT. DATA ON POLICE RECRUITMENT AND SELECTION WILL BE COLLECTED AND ANALYZED TO HELP LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCIES IMPROVE THEIR RECRUITMENT AND SELECTION METHODS AND PRACTICES, ESPECIALLY AS IT RELATES TO RACIAL DIVERSITY.

THE GOAL OF THE COPS MICROGRANT COORDINATOR IS TO COORDINATE AND SUPPORT THE TESTING AND SHARING OF INNOVATIVE COMMUNITY POLICING STRATEGIES AND PROMISING PRACTICES. CNA CURRENTLY SERVES AS THE MICROGRANT COORDINATOR AND IS HONORED TO RESPOND TO THIS DIRECTED PROPOSAL TO RENEW ITS ROLE FOR FY15. AS TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE PROVIDER TO MULTIPLE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF JUSTICE (DOJ) PROGRAMS FOCUSED ON EVALUATING EVIDENCE-BASED PRACTICES, BUILDING COMMUNITY COLLABORATIONS, AND TRANSFORMING ORGANIZATIONS FOR MORE THAN 50 LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCIES NATIONWIDE, AND WE ARE FULLY EQUIPPED TO CONTINUE THIS ROLE FOR THE NEXT TWO YEARS. CNA’S EXISTING KNOWLEDGE, CAPACITIES, AND RESOURCES, ALLOW US TO SUPPORT THE DESIRED EXPANSION OF THIS PROGRAM BY GOING BEYOND TRADITIONAL MECHANISMS FOR DOCUMENTING PROMISING PRACTICES AND USING OUR PROVEN STRATEGIES TO EFFECTIVELY IDENTIFY, TRANSLATE, AND DISSEMINATE PRACTICES INTO APPLICABLE AND ACCESSIBLE RESOURCES FOR THE BROADER COMMUNITY POLICING AUDIENCE (E.G., LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCIES, POLICYMAKERS, RESEARCHERS, AND COMMUNITY STAKEHOLDERS).IN PARTICULAR, CNA—ALONGSIDE THE COPS OFFICE—WILL MAKE SIGNIFICANT CONTRIBUTIONS TO THE LAW ENFORCEMENT FIELD BY DEVELOPING KNOWLEDGE, INCREASING AWARENESS, INCREASING ABILITIES, INCREASING PRACTICE, AND INSTITUTIONALIZING PRACTICES IN COMMUNITY-ORIENTED POLICING STRATEGIES FOR ISSUES HEIGHTED IN THE PRESIDENT’S TASK FORCE ON 21ST CENTURY POLICING—INCLUDING POLICE TRUST AND LEGITIMACY, THE ROLE OF TECHNOLOGY AND SOCIAL MEDIA IN COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT, AND OFFICER WELLNESS AND SAFETY. WE WILL FOCUS ON TWO OBJECTIVES CRITICAL TO THE SUCCESS OF THE MICROGRANT COORDINATOR ROLE.FIRST, WE WILL PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO CONTRIBUTE TO THE SUCCESS OF THE MICROGRANT PROJECTS. THROUGH REGULAR CONTACT WITH MICROGRANT SITES, WE WILL NOT ONLY TO DOCUMENT PROJECT PROGRESS AND PROMISING PRACTICES, BUT WILL ALSO IDENTIFY CHALLENGES THAT MAY REQUIRE ADDITIONAL TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE (E.G., MAKING USEFUL SUGGESTIONS, POINTING THEM TO HELPFUL RESOURCES, AND CONNECTING THEM WITH EACH OTHER TO FACILITATE PEER-TO-PEER LEARNING, WHEN APPROPRIATE).SECOND, WE WILL DOCUMENT PROJECT ACTIVITIES, DEVELOP BRANDING FOR THE MICROGRANT INITIATIVE, CREATE A NEW COPS OFFICE PUBLICATION BASED ON PROMISING PRACTICES, AND DISSEMINATE RESOURCES NATIONALLY. WE WILL DEVELOP EXECUTIVE OVERVIEWS TO PROVIDE POLICYMAKERS, DECISION-MAKERS AND OTHER INTERESTED STAKEHOLDERS WITH A QUICK SYNOPSIS OF THE INITIATIVE AND PROMISING PRACTICES THAT MICROGRANT STIES HAVE TO SHARE (E.G., HIGHLIGHTING PROBLEM, GOALS AND OBJECTIVES, APPROACH, COLLABORATIVE PARTNERSHIPS, BENEFITS, AND DESIRED MEASURABLE OUTCOMES). WE WILL ALSO PRODUCE A FINAL REPORT AT THE END OF THE INITIATIVE DESCRIBING COMMON THEMES AND PRACTICES OF ALL MICROGRANT PROJECTS, INCLUDING CASE STUDY EXAMPLES. FINALLY, WE WILL SUPPORT THE COPS OFFICE MICROGRANT WEBPAGE BY DEVELOPING AND DISSEMINATING APPROPRIATE CONTENT WITH MICROGRANT BRANDING.TO ENSURE THAT THE MICROGRANT INITIATIVE REMAINS VIABLE AND A CONTINUED SUCCESS, CNA WILL PROVIDE EXPERT STAFF MEMBERS WHO HAVE EXPERIENCE IN MEETING THE NEEDS REQUIRED OF THE MICROGRANT COORDINATOR ROLE AND WHO HAVE EXTENSIVE KNOWLEDGE IN COMMUNITY POLICING STRATEGIES. WITH CNA’S PROVEN RECORD IN CONDUCTING COMPLEX OPERATIONAL ANALYSIS FOR OVER 70 YEARS AND SUPPORTING THE EVALUATION AND SHARING OF EVIDENCE-BASED POLICING STRATEGIES NATIONWIDE, WE ARE UNIQUELY QUALIFIED TO LEAD THIS EFFORT FOR THE COPS OFFICE.

THE WVSP WILL FIRST AND FOREMOST PROVIDE EQUIPMENT TO EACH TECHNICIAN TO SAFELY SAMPLE AND DISMANTLE CLANDESTINE LABORATORIES. IN ADDITION, THE WVSP WILL PURCHASE RESPONSE VEHICLES AND STRATEGICALLY ASSIGN THOSE VEHICLES THROUGHOUT THE STATE TO ALLOW TECHNICIANS TO TRAVEL TO RESPONSE VEHICLES AND THEN RESPOND TO THE SCENE OF A CLANDESTINE LABORATORY. WITHIN THOSE VEHICLES WILL BE ALL THERMO PRO SUITS, GLOVES, BOOTS, GAS MASKS, SCBA'S, AIR MONITORING DEVICES, AIR MOVING FANS, SAMPLING EQUIPMENT, BUCKETS, COMPUTERS FOR ONSITE REPORTING, AND DECONTAMINATION STATIONS FOR OFFICERS, CHILDREN, AND SUSPECTS. THE WVSP WILL PROVIDE FUNDING TO OFFICER'S INVESTIGATING THE MANUFACTURING AND DISTRIBUTION OF METHAMPHETAMINE. THE WVSP WILL PROVIDE COMMUNITY AWARENESS CLASSES THROUGHOUT THE STATE TO COMMUNITIES TO RAISE AWARENESS OF THE HAZARDS AND KNOWLEDGE OF WHAT TO LOOK FOR AND HOW TO ANONYMOUSLY REPORT SUSPICIOUS ACTIVITIES ASSOCIATED WITH MANUFACTURING OF METHAMPHETAMINE. THE WVSP WILL PROVIDE ADVANCED AWARENESS CLASSES TO FIRE AND EMS THROUGHOUT THE STATE, WHICH WILL PROVIDE UNDERSTANDING AND THE HAZARDS OF RESPONDING TO CLANDESTINE LABORATORIES THAT HAVE CAUGHT ON FIRE AND TO FIRST RESPONDERS DEALING WITH CLANDESTINE COOKS OF THEIR UNPREDICTABLE BEHAVIOR AND THE HAZARDS ASSOCIATED WITH THE TRANSPORT OF THOSE TYPE OF PATIENTS (CONTAMINATION ETC.). BY PROVIDING AWARENESS TO COMMUNITIES, THE WVSP WILL UTILIZE THE TIP LINE TO FOLLOW UP ON INVESTIGATIVE TIPS PROVIDED BY THE PUBLIC.

THE PURPOSE OF THE EMERGING ISSUES PROJECT IS TO OBTAIN DIVERSE PERSPECTIVES ON CRITICAL ISSUES IN POLICING FROM TOP EXPERTS IN THE FIELD, AND THEN TO USE THIS INFORMATION TO PRODUCE ACTIONABLE, USEFUL GUIDANCE FOR POLICE EXECUTIVES, INCLUDING PROMISING PRACTICES, POLICY GUIDELINES, AND POINTS OF CONSENSUS. PERF WILL CONVENE TWO FORUMS OVER THE COURSE OF THIS TWO-YEAR AWARD. FOR EACH OF THE TWO FORUMS, PERF WILL PRODUCE PRACTITIONER-FRIENDLY BRIEFS THAT WILL CAPTURE THE CHALLENGES AND SUCCESSFUL APPROACHES DISCUSSED WITHIN EACH MEETING, SUPPLEMENTED WITH ADDITIONAL RESEARCH TO PRESENT A COMPREHENSIVE PICTURE OF THE SUBJECT DISCUSSED.

THE POLICE FOUNDATION PROPOSES IMPLEMENTING AN EXECUTIVE SESSION ON POLICING. THIS EXECUTIVE SESSION WILL BRING POLICE PRACTITIONERS AND ACADEMICS TOGETHER TO SEARCH FOR ANSWERS TO THE CRITICAL ISSUES FACING LAW ENFORCEMENT TODAY. IT WILL INVOLVE A SUSTAINED CONVERSATION AMONG A CORE GROUP OF PROFESSIONALS TO PRODUCE KNOWLEDGE AND TRANSFORM THE FIELD THROUGH DISCUSSIONS, PUBLICATIONS, AND EDUCATION. THE PROPOSED SCOPE OF WORK FOR THIS EXECUTIVE SESSION IS CENTERED AROUND TWO PRIMARY DELIVERABLES TO BE COMPLETED IN THE 24-MONTH PROJECT PERIOD: (1) THE PLANNING AND IMPLEMENTATION OF THREE CONVENINGS WITH THOUGHT LEADERS IN LAW ENFORCEMENT ON CRITICAL ISSUES THAT ARE IMPACTING THE FIELD; AND (2) THE DEVELOPMENT OF RESOURCES FOR THE LAW ENFORCEMENT COMMUNITY HIGHLIGHTING PROMISING PRACTICES IN ADDRESSING THOSE CRITICAL ISSUES.

THE VIRGINIA CENTER FOR POLICING INNOVATION (VCPI), IN PARTNERSHIP WITH CIT INTERNATIONAL, INC., WILL SUPPORT THE 2022 COMMUNITY POLICING DEVELOPMENT PROGRAM  THROUGH THE CONTINUATION OF CRISIS INTERVENTION TEAMS ADAPTIVE SYSTEM OF SUPPORTS FOR IMPLEMENTATION AND SPECIALIZED TRAINING (CIT ASSIST). LEVERAGING THE NATIONAL TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE (TTA) PROGRAM EXPERTISE OF VCPI AND THE SUBJECT MATTER EXPERTISE OF CIT INTERNATIONAL, THE PREEMINENT AUTHORITY ON THE CRISIS INTERVENTION TEAM (CIT) MODEL, CIT ASSIST CONTINUATION IS A NATIONAL INITIATIVE DESIGNED TO INCREASE THE CAPACITY OF LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCIES NATIONWIDE TO EFFECTIVELY CREATE OR ENHANCE CRISIS INTERVENTION TEAMS (CITS). CIT ASSIST IS A COMPREHENSIVE, STRUCTURED SYSTEM OF SUPPORTS THAT INCLUDES WEB-BASED TRAINING, TECHNOLOGY-ENHANCED CIT IMPLEMENTATION GUIDANCE, TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE, AND MORE. CIT ASSIST INCLUDES ALL OF THE ELEMENTS REQUIRED TO PROVIDE DIRECT SUPPORT AND RESOURCES TO THE CIT COHORT MEMBERS (AN ANTICIPATED, ADDITIONAL 35 AGENCIES IN THE 2022 COHORT) AND TO EFFECT A POSITIVE NATIONAL IMPACT IN CIT IMPLEMENTATION AND RESPONSIVENESS.

THIS PROJECT WILL PROVIDE TRAINING THAT MEETS THE GOALS OF THE PROTECTING OUR LIVES BY INITIATING COPS EXPANSION (POLICE) ACT UNDER THE COPS PASS PROGRAM.  ALERRT (ADVANCED LAW ENFORCEMENT RAPID RESPONSE TRAINING) AT TEXAS STATE UNIVERSITY, WILL PROVIDE A NATIONAL, INNOVATIVE, ORIGINAL, CROSS-DISCIPLINARY ACTIVE SHOOTER TRAINING REGIMEN GEARED TOWARD LAW ENFORCEMENT, FIRE, EMS, AND CIVILIANS TO BOLSTER PUBLIC SAFETY AND PREPAREDNESS DURING AN ACTIVE SHOOTER/ATTACK EVENT. ALERRT HAS SUBSTANTIAL EXPERIENCE DEVELOPING AND DELIVERING SUCH COURSES NATIONWIDE UTILIZING A COST-EFFECTIVE DELIVERY METHOD. ALERTT WILL DELIVER 235 HANDS-ON TRAINING CLASSES AND SUPPORT AN ADDITIONAL 7200 HOURS OF INDIRECT TRAININGS THAT WILL TRAIN UP TO 16,755 FIRST RESPONDERS ACROSS THE UNITED STATES IN INTEGRATED RESPONSE TO ACTIVE SHOOTER EVENTS DURING THE LIFE OF THE GRANT.  THESE CLASSES ARE ALSO DESIGNED TO BOLSTER POLICE ENGAGEMENT WITH THEIR COMMUNITIES TO BETTER PREPARE FOR DISASTER RESPONSE.  WE WILL UTILIZE OUR PROVEN TRAIN-THE-TRAINER METHODOLOGY TO DEVELOP THE CAPACITY OF THE AGENCIES TO SELF-SUSTAIN THE KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS THAT THEY DEVELOP. ALL TRAINING WILL BE DELIVERED AT NO COST TO THE TRAINEES AND THEIR AGENCIES.

THE NEW JERSEY STATE ASSOCIATION OF CHIEFS OF POLICE (NJSACOP) SEEKS FUNDING UNDER THE FY22 CPD ACCREDITATION SOLICITATION, SUBCATEGORY ENHANCING EXISTING LAW ENFORCEMENT ACCREDITATION ENTITIES TO SUPPORT THE NJSACOP-LAW ENFORCEMENT ACCREDITATION PROGRAM (LEAP) EXPANSION PROJECT.  NJSACOP-LEAP EXPANSION PROJECT WILL INCREASE THE NUMBER OF STATE ACCREDITED LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCIES IN NEW JERSEY BY TARGETING UNDERSERVED RURAL AND SMALLER LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCIES.

THE NORTH CAROLINA LAW ENFORCEMENT ACCREDITATION (NCLEA) WILL PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND ASSESSMENTS RESULTING IN THE SUCCESSFUL STATE ACCREDITATION OF MORE THAN 30 NEW AGENCIES. NCLEA WILL FOCUS ON SMALL/RURAL AGENCIES WITH SUPPORT FOR APPROXIMATELY 4 HOURS A WEEK DURING THE 24 MONTH ACCREDITATION PROCESS.

THE TENNESSEE ASSOCIATION OF CHIEFS OF POLICE (TACP) AND PARTNERS WILL USE FUNDING TO IMPLEMENT A STRATEGY TO SUPPORT ACCREDITATION VIA TRAINING, TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE, ASSESSMENTS AND FUNDS TO DEFRAY THE COSTS NORMALLY EXPENDED BY LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCIES.

THE SOUTH CAROLINA LAW ENFORCEMENT TRAINING COUNCIL IS RESPONDING TO THE NEW LAW H2050 SIGNED BY GOVERNOR HENRY MCMASTERS SIGNED H3050 INTO LAW THAT REQUIRES SCLEA TO ESTABLISH REQUIRED MINIMUM STANDARDS FOR ALL LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCIES. TO MEET THE NEW REQUIREMENTS, SCLEA WILL USE FUNDS FROM THIS GRANT  SCLEA TO HIRE A PROGRAM MANAGER AND AN ASSESSOR, AS WELL AS PURCHASE RESOURCES TO ASSIST WITH IMPLEMENTATION OF A NEW ENGAGEMENT AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE STRATEGY.

THE MICHIGAN ASSOCIATION OF CHIEFS OF POLICE WILL HIRE AN ADMINISTRATIVE STAFF PERSON TO MEET THE MLEAC 2022-2025 STRATEGIC PLAN GOALS.  THE MLEAC WILL INCREASE ENGAGEMENT WITH SMALL/RURAL COMMUNITIES TO SUPPORT ACCREDITATION VIA TRAINING, TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE, AND FUNDS FOR PROCESS EXPENDITURES.

THE ILLINOIS LAW ENFORCEMENT ACCREDITATION PROGRAM (ILEAP) WILL FOCUS STAFF SUPPORT TO ASSIST SMALL AND RURAL AGENCIES DURING THE ACCREDITATION PROCESS.  ILEAP WILL PROVIDE TRAINING, TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE, REMOTE ASSESSMENTS, AND CREATE PARTNERSHIPS ACROSS THE STATE WITH RISK MANAGEMENT POOLS TO REDUCE LIABILITY FOR LEA.

THE ARIZONA LAW ENFORCEMENT ACCREDITATION PROGRAM (ALEAP) WILL HIRE A FULL-TIME ACCREDITATION SPECIALIST TO SUPPORT THE PROGRAM MANAGER.  THE NEW ACCREDITATION SPECIALIST WILL ALSO DEVELOP A GEOGRAPHIC ENGAGEMENT STRATEGY TO ENGAGE SMALL, RURAL AND TRIBAL DEPARTMENTS ACROSS THE STATE WITH AN OVERALL INCREASE OF 15% NEW ACCREDITED AGENCIES OVER THE NEXT 24 MONTHS.

THE NATIONAL FRATERNAL ORDER OF POLICE LEMHWA TTA PROJECT SUPPORT THE DELIVERY OF  POWER IN PEERS NATIONAL TRAINING PROGRAM. POWER IN PEERS IS A MODERN STANDARDIZED CURRICULUM IN LAW ENFORCEMENT PEER SUPPORT.  DEVELOPED BY THE NATIONAL FRATERNAL ORDER OF POLICE AS PART OF A COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT WITH THE COPS OFFICE OF THE US DEPARTMENT OF JUSTICE, THE POWER IN PEERS CURRICULUM PROVIDES A NATIONALLY STANDARDIZED MODEL OF LAW ENFORCEMENT PEER SUPPORT TRAINING AND SERVICES MADE AVAILABLE TO ALL MEMBERS OF THE PROFESSION, IN BOTH ACTIVE AND RETIRED STATUS.

WAYNE STATE UNIVERSITY IN DETROIT, MICHIGAN WILL PROVIDE COMPREHENSIVE AND EVIDENCE-BASED DE-ESCALATION TRAINING FOR A DIVERSE GROUP OF LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCIES AND PROFESSIONALS IN THE FIVE-STATE MIDWESTERN UNITED STATES REGION INCLUDING MICHIGAN, OHIO, INDIANA, ILLINOIS, AND WISCONSIN. NDTC WILL SUPPORT THE WORK OF THE WSU DE-ESCALATION CENTER BY PROVIDING TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE, TRAINING AND OUTREACH, STANDARDIZED TRAINING AND ASSESSMENT TOOLS AND MATERIALS.

THIS IS TO ESTABLISH A REGIONAL DE-ESCALATION TRAINING CENTER AT THE LAW ENFORCEMENT MANAGEMENT INSTITUTE OF TEXAS (LEMIT) AT SAM HOUSTON STATE UNIVERSITY (SHSU) TO DELIVER CERTIFIED DE-ESCALATION CURRICULUM TO LAW ENFORCEMENT OFFICERS WITHIN AN IDENTIFIED REGION. THE PROPOSED CENTER WILL COLLABORATE WITH OTHER REGIONAL DE-ESCALATION TRAINING CENTERS AND THE NATIONAL TRAINING COORDINATOR AT ST. PETERSBURG COLLEGE (FL) TO ENSURE TRAINING IS CONSISTENT AND HAS BEEN CERTIFIED.

THE UNIVERSITY OF NEW HAVEN IN WEST HAVEN, CONNECTICUT AND ITS NORTHEAST REGIONAL DE-ESCALATION TRAINING CENTER OF THE NATIONAL DE-ESCALATION TRAINING CENTER (NDTC), WILL TRAIN LAW ENFORCEMENT IN EIGHT OF ELEVEN STATES IN THE NORTHEAST REGION IN DE-ESCALATION TECHNIQUES EFFECTIVELY IN TWO MODALITIES, IN-PERSON TO OFFICERS AND IN-PERSON TO TRAIN-THE-TRAINERS.

THE PRIMARY GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO PROVIDE OBJECTIVE, INDEPENDENT, AND PRACTICE-RELEVANT KNOWLEDGE AND LESSONS TO PRACTITIONERS, RESEARCHERS, AND POLICY MAKERS ABOUT THE NATURE, CHANGES, CHALLENGES, AND SOLUTIONS RELATIVE TO POLICE RECRUITMENT AND SELECTION. MICHIGAN STATE UNIVERSITY WILL DEVELOP 12 PRIMARY PRODUCTS UNDER THIS AWARD: 5 REPORTS DETAILING THE RECRUITMENT AND SELECTION CATALOG AND CORRESPONDING ASSESSMENT OF STRATEGIES; 2 REPORTS ON BUILDING AND MAINTAINING RECRUITMENT PROGRAMS, 1 RECRUITMENT AND SELECTION TOOLKIT REPORT FOR CHP AWARDEES AND 4 BRIEFS HIGHLIGHTING KEY DISCUSSIONS, RESOURCES, CASE STUDIES, INNOVATIONS, AND LESSONS. THESE INCLUDE:


	COPS BOLO ON STRATEGIES
	COPS BOLO ON BUILDING RECRUITMENT PROGRAMS
	COPS GUIDEBOOK ON RECRUITMENT STRATEGIES
	COPS ESSENTIALS FOR LEADERS ON RECRUITMENT STRATEGIES
	COPS GUIDEBOOK ON SELECTION STRATEGIES
	COPS ESSENTIALS FOR LEADERS ON SELECTION STRATEGIES
	COPS RECRUITMENT AND SELECTION TOOLKIT
	COPS ESSENTIALS FOR LEADERS ON BUILDING RECRUITMENT PROGRAMS
	FOUR COPS COMMUNITY POLICING DISPATCH ARTICLES ON COMMUNITY OF
	PRACTICE LESSONS
	COPS REVIEW/PRODUCTION OF PUBLICATIONS
	DEVELOP OTHER PRACTITIONER AND ACADEMIC PUBLICATIONS

THE NATIONAL CRIMINAL JUSTICE TRAINING CENTER OF FOX VALLEY TECHNICAL COLLEGE (NCJTC) WILL DEVELOP A COMPREHENSIVE AND INTERACTIVE ONLINE COURSE BASED ON ADULT LEARNING PRINCIPLES TO CONTAIN UP TO TWO ROBUST, INTERACTIVE TRAINING MODULES. THESE WILL REPLACE THE CURRENT PL 280 RESOURCE ON THE COPS TRAINING PORTAL.  NCJTC WILL MARKET THE COURSE TO ITS EXTENSIVE CONTACTS IN LAW ENFORCEMENT. NCJTC WILL ALSO CREATE AND ISSUE A CERTIFICATE FOR THE COURSE UPON SUCCESSFUL COMPLETION BY THE LEARNER.

THE NATIONAL CRIMINAL JUSTICE TRAINING CENTER OF FOX VALLEY TECHNICAL COLLEGE (NCJTC) WILL DEVELOP AND DELIVER CURRICULUM ON TRIBAL CULTURAL AWARENESS TRAINING TO TRIBAL AND NON-TRIBAL LAW ENFORCEMENT PROFESSIONALS THROUGH A VIRTUAL PILOT AND TWO IN-PERSON TRIBAL REGIONS/AREAS. NCJTC WILL ALSO DEVELOP AND DELIVER SUPPLEMENTAL MATERIALS ON TRIBAL CULTURE FOR THE SPECIFIC AREAS WHERE THE TRAININGS WILL OCCUR. THE CORE CURRICULUM PACKAGE WILL INCLUDE CUSTOMIZABLE SUPPLEMENTAL MATERIALS THAT WILL BE ACCESSIBLE/AVAILABLE FOR ALL JURISDICTIONS.

IN RESPONSE TO THE COPS 2022 CPD INVITATIONAL SOLICITATION, THE VIRGINIA CENTER FOR POLICING INNOVATION (VCPI) WILL DEVELOP AND DELIVER COPS PORTAL: PORTAL ADMINISTRATION, GROWTH, AND ENGAGEMENT (PAGE). PAGE IS A NATIONAL TRAINING DELIVERY INITIATIVE DESIGNED TO ENHANCE THE CAPACITY OF LAW ENFORCEMENT TO IMPLEMENT EFFECTIVE COMMUNITY POLICING STRATEGIES THROUGH THE ADMINISTRATION AND EXPANSION OF THE COPS OFFICE TRAINING PORTAL. PROGRAM DESIGN AND STRATEGY SUPPORT THREE MAIN FOCUS AREAS OF THE PORTAL: CONTINUED ADMINISTRATION AND MAINTENANCE, DESIGN OF TWO PORTAL ENHANCEMENTS, AND A TARGETED NATIONAL COPS OFFICE TRAINING PORTAL AWARENESS EFFORT. ADDITIONALLY, VCPI WILL REVISE PATHWAYS TO RESILIENCY, A WEB-BASED COURSE BASED ON COPS OFFICE-DIRECTED REVISIONS.

THE IACP LEMHWA IMPLEMENTATION TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND RESOURCES PROGRAM WILL CREATE A SECURE COMMUNITY OF PRACTICE MICROSITE FOR THE LEMHWA SITES, PROVIDE A RESOURCE LIBRARY WITHIN THE COMMUNITY OF PRACTICE, FACILITATE MONTHLY LIVE VIRTUAL SESSIONS OF THE LEMHWA COMMUNITY OF PRACTICE, RESPOND TO INDIVIDUAL TA REQUESTS FROM LEMHWA SITES AND FOLLOW UP WITH RESOURCES AND CONSULTATION AS NEEDED. IN ADDITION, IACP WILL HOST A LEMHWA TRAINING AND NETWORKING FORUM FOR LEMHWA SITES AT THE ANNUAL IACP OSW SYMPOSIUM, INCLUDE A PEER SUPPORT IMPLEMENTATION WORKSHOP IN THE OSW SYMPOSIUM, AND FINALLY DEVELOP RESOURCES THAT CAN BE DISTRIBUTED NATIONALLY TO SUPPORT IMPLEMENTATION OF MENTAL HEALTH AND WELLNESS PROGRAMS TO FURTHER INSTITUTIONALIZE PRACTICES, AND INCREASE LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCY SKILLS AND ABILITIES TO ADDRESS THESE CHALLENGES.

POLICE AGENCIES IN THE UNITED STATES ARE CONFRONTING NEW CHALLENGES; AS A RESULT, THEY REQUIRE A FRESH, EVIDENCE-BASED, AND OBJECTIVE APPROACH TO SUPPORT THEIR REFORM AND TRANSFORMATION EFFORTS. THE COLLABORATIVE REFORM INITIATIVE (CRI) INITIATED BY THE OFFICE OF COMMUNITY ORIENTED POLICING SERVICES (COPS) IN 2011 IS ONE OF THE MOST COMPREHENSIVE AND STRATEGICALLY DESIGNED INITIATIVES AIMED AT ACHIEVING THIS NEEDED ADVANCEMENT IN AMERICAN POLICING. CNA, IN PARTNERSHIP WITH THE INSTITUTE FOR INTERGOVERNMENTAL RESEARCH (IIR), PROPOSES TO IMPLEMENT THE ORGANIZATIONAL ASSESSMENTS COMPONENT OF THE COPS CRI. WE WILL DEPLOY A HIGHLY FLEXIBLE AND AGILE PROJECT LEADERSHIP STRUCTURE TO MANAGE THE PROGRAM, WORKING ALONGSIDE DEDICATED SITE TEAMS TO LEAD THEIR ASSIGNED SITE THROUGH A CONTINUOUS AND RIGOROUS SIX-STEP APPROACH FOR ORGANIZATION ASSESSMENT AND ENGAGEMENT. CAPACITY BUILDING, COMMUNITY AND STAKEHOLDER ENGAGEMENT, AND SUSTAINABILITY WILL BE CORE FOCUSES OF THESE ENGAGEMENTS, WHICH WILL FACILITATE IMMEDIATE TRANSITION TO IMPLEMENTATION SUPPORT AS RECOMMENDATIONS ARE IDENTIFIED. THROUGHOUT THE PROGRAM, WE WILL MONITOR SITE PROGRESS THROUGH PERFORMANCE MEASUREMENT AND OTHER STANDARDIZED PROCEDURES, AS WELL AS PRODUCE LESSONS USEFUL FOR THE BROADER FIELD OF LAW ENFORCEMENT.

THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF JUSTICE, OFFICE OF COMMUNITY ORIENTED POLICING SERVICES (COPS OFFICE) HAS COMMITTED TO THE CRITICAL RESPONSE PROGRAM, AN EFFORT TO PROVIDE TARGETED, TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCIES EXPERIENCING HIGH-PROFILE EVENTS, MAJOR INCIDENTS, OR SENSITIVE ISSUES OF VARYING NEED. THIS PROJECT WILL FOCUS ON THE FIVE CORE GOALS OF THE COLLABORATIVE REFORM INITIATIVE: (1) BUILDING TRUST BETWEEN LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCIES AND THE COMMUNITIES THEY SERVE; (2) IMPROVING FAIRNESS, EFFECTIVENESS, AND EFFICIENCY IN AGENCY OPERATIONS; (3) ENHANCING OFFICER SAFETY AND WELLNESS; (4) PROMOTING PROMISING PRACTICES ESTABLISHED THROUGH THE COPS OFFICE; AND (5) BUILDING CAPACITY WITHIN AGENCIES FOR ORGANIZATIONAL LEARNING AND SELF-IMPROVEMENT.

 

FOR THE CRITICAL RESPONSE PROJECT, JENSEN HUGHES AND ITS DEEP TEAM OF EXPERTS IN LAW ENFORCEMENT OPERATIONS, COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT, OFFICER SAFETY AND WELLNESS, USE OF FORCE, CRISIS AND EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT AND RESPONSE, AND THREAT AND TRAUMA SUPPORT WILL PROVIDE PARTICIPATING LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCIES WITH HIGHLY CUSTOMIZABLE SUPPORT ACROSS THREE CORE AREAS. THESE ARE (1) IMMEDIATE DELIVERIES OF TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE, SUCH AS FACILITATING PEER-TO-PEER DISCUSSIONS, INFORMATION EXCHANGES, COMMUNITY OUTREACH AND ENGAGEMENT EFFORTS, AND TRAINING DELIVERY FACILITATIONS; (2) DATA ANALYSES, SUCH AS TRAFFIC STOP AND ARREST DISPARITY REVIEWS OR INTERNAL DISCIPLINE DISPARITY REVIEWS; AND (3) AFTER-ACTION REVIEWS, INCLUDING REVIEWS OF AGENCY RESPONSES TO ACTIVE SHOOTER EVENTS SUCH AS THE MAY 2022 TRAGEDY IN UVALDE, TEXAS.

 

VITAL PARTNERS IN THIS PROJECT WILL INCLUDE AGENCY COMMAND STAFF AND RANK-AND-FILE MEMBERS; COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS AND LEADERS; COMMUNITY MEMBERS DIRECTLY AND INDIRECTLY AFFECTED; LOCAL ADMINISTRATIVE AND POLITICAL REPRESENTATIVES; AND, WHEN APPROPRIATE, OTHER LOCAL AGENCIES SUCH AS FIRE DEPARTMENTS AND EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT OFFICES. JENSEN HUGHES WILL CONDUCT EXTENSIVE OUTREACH TO POLICE OFFICERS AND COMMUNITY MEMBERS ALIKE TO SHARE THEIR UNIQUE PERSPECTIVES AND EXPERIENCES.

THE INTERNATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF CHIEFS OF POLICE (IACP) IS PLEASED TO SUBMIT THIS PROPOSAL TO COLLABORATE WITH THE OFFICE OF COMMUNITY ORIENTED POLICING SERVICES (COPS) TO CONTINUE THE WORK OF THE COLLABORATIVE REFORM INITIATIVE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE CENTER (CRI-TAC). THIS PROGRAM REMAINS READY TO ASSIST LOCAL, COUNTY, STATE, TRIBAL, TERRITORIAL, AND CAMPUS LAW ENFORCEMENT ORGANIZATIONS THROUGHOUT THE UNITED STATES. IACP AND CRI-TAC HAVE SUCCESSFULLY CREATED AND MAINTAINED PARTNER RELATIONSHIPS WITH NINE LAW ENFORCEMENT ORGANIZATIONS TO ENSURE THE MOST COMPREHENSIVE AND TAILORED SOLUTIONS ARE AVAILABLE FOR REQUESTING AGENCIES, IN A “BY THE FIELD, FOR THE FIELD” MODEL. PROGRAM ACTIVITIES WILL SUPPORT THE OVERARCHING GOALS OF THE COLLABORATIVE REFORM INITIATIVE OF BUILDING TRUST BETWEEN POLICE AND THE COMMUNITIES THEY SERVE; IMPROVING FAIRNESS, EFFECTIVENESS, AND EFFICIENCY IN AGENCY OPERATIONS; ENHANCING OFFICER SAFETY AND WELLNESS; BUILDING CAPACITY WITH AGENCIES FOR ORGANIZATIONAL LEARNING AND SELF-IMPROVEMENT; AND PROMOTING PROMISING PRACTICES ESTABLISHED THROUGH COPS OFFICE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAMS NATIONWIDE.

THE CRI-TAC WAS DEVELOPED TO ASSIST LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCIES AND THE COMMUNITIES THEY SERVE BY PROVIDING ACCESS TO EXCEPTIONAL RESOURCES, CONSULTATION, AND TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES. THE PROGRAM’S OPERATIONAL STRUCTURE BUILDS UPON EXISTING IACP AND PARTNER RESOURCES, SO THAT RESPONSE TO LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCIES IS RAPID, AND FEDERAL AND NON-FEDERAL RESOURCES ARE LEVERAGED EFFECTIVELY AND EFFICIENTLY. TO REMAIN QUALITY-DRIVEN, EVIDENCE-BASED, ACCESSIBLE, AND MEMORABLE, CRI-TAC WILL SUSTAIN PARTNERSHIPS WITH LEADING LAW ENFORCEMENT ASSOCIATIONS; MANAGE AND IDENTIFY NATIONALLY RESPECTED LAW ENFORCEMENT AND PUBLIC SAFETY SUBJECT MATTER EXPERTS; PRODUCE DOCUMENTS SUMMARIZING PROMISING OR BEST PRACTICE GUIDANCE AND CONSIDERATIONS; CONDUCT OUTREACH AND MARKETING TO PROMOTE TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE (TTA) SERVICES; AND ASSESS AND ANALYZE THE EFFECTIVENESS OF SERVICES.

LAW ENFORCEMENT IS A DYNAMIC AND TRANSITIONAL PROFESSION IN WHICH IT IS OF VITAL IMPORTANCE TO SUPPORT PROCESS IMPROVEMENT WHILE REMAINING FLEXIBLE AND OPEN TO ADVANCEMENT. AGENCIES THROUGHOUT THE COUNTRY HAVE BEEN CHALLENGED TO FIND NEW AND PROGRESSIVE WAYS TO PROACTIVELY POLICE AND CONNECT WITH THE COMMUNITIES THEY SERVE. MANY OPERATE WITH LIMITED RESOURCES, PERSONNEL, OR FUNDING, AND THE CHALLENGE TO PERFORM MORE EFFICIENTLY IS ONLY INCREASING. TO HELP COMBAT LACK OF RESOURCES AND OTHER BARRIERS, CRI-TAC WORKS TO SUPPORT AGENCIES AND PROVIDE THEM WITH THE TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE THEY REQUIRE TO BUILD TRUST WITH THE COMMUNITIES THEY SERVE. IACP AND ITS PARTNERS WILL WORK WITH COPS TO CONTINUE THE PROVISION OF COMPREHENSIVE TA, INFORMED BY CUTTING-EDGE INNOVATION AND EVIDENCE-BASED AND PROMISING PRACTICES, THAT EMBRACES A COLLABORATIVE, SUPPORTIVE APPROACH TO SERVING LAW ENFORCEMENT AND THEIR RESPECTIVET. TOGETHER THROUGH OUR COLLECTIVE EXPERIENCE, SUBJECT MATTER EXPERTISE, AND UNMATCHED REACH IN THE FIELD, WE WILL CONTINUE TO SUPPORT THE NEEDS OF THE OFFICE OF COMMUNITY ORIENTED POLICING SERVICES’ COLLABORATIVE REFORM INITIATIVE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE CENTER AS ONE ELEMENT OF THE COLLABORATIVE REFORM INITIATIVE.

FUNDING WILL BE USED TO EXPAND THE ABILITY OF THE EXISTING BLUE ALERT PROGRAM ADMINISTERED BY THE COPS OFFICE TO COLLECT AND ANALYZE INCIDENTS IN WHICH LAW ENFORCEMENT OFFICERS ARE SHOT IN THE LINE OF DUTY.  THE NATIONAL FRATERNAL ORDER OF POLICE FOUNDATION WILL CONTINUE TO COLLECT AND ANALYZE DATA ON REPORTED SHOOTINGS OF LAW ENFORCEMENT OFFICERS NATIONWIDE AND PROVIDE THIS INFORMATION TO THE OFFICE OF COMMUNITY ORIENTED POLICING SERVICES (COPS) IN AN EFFORT TO BETTER UNDERSTAND HOW, WHEN, WHERE AND WHY THESE SHOOTING OCCUR. THIS DATA WILL BE COMPILED IN AN EFFORT TO DEVELOP POLICING STRATEGIES AND TRAINING TO REDUCE THE NUMBER OF OFFICERS WHO ARE SHOT IN THE LINE OF DUTY.

THE PURPOSE OF THE COPS OFFICE SCHOOL VIOLENCE PREVENTION PROGRAM (SVPP) IS TO IMPROVE SECURITY AT SCHOOLS AND ON SCHOOL GROUNDS THROUGH SCHOOL SAFETY PROGRAMS AND TECHNOLOGY. FUNDING UNDER THIS AWARD PROGRAM WILL BE USED BY THE SCHOOL JURISDICTION TO IMPLEMENT EVIDENCE-BASED PROGRAMS TO IMPROVE SCHOOL SECURITY AND PROMOTE A POSITIVE LEARNING ENVIRONMENT FOR ALL STUDENTS.

THE FY 2022 COPS OFFICE TECHNOLOGY AND EQUIPMENT PROGRAM (TEP) INVITATIONAL SOLICITATION IS AN INVITATION-ONLY GRANT PROGRAM DESIGNED TO DEVELOP AND ACQUIRE EFFECTIVE EQUIPMENT, TECHNOLOGIES, AND INTEROPERABLE COMMUNICATIONS THAT ASSIST IN RESPONDING TO AND PREVENTING CRIME.

THE OBJECTIVE IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING FOR PROJECTS WHICH IMPROVE POLICE EFFECTIVENESS AND THE FLOW OF INFORMATION AMONG LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCIES, LOCAL GOVERNMENT SERVICE PROVIDERS, AND THE COMMUNITIES THEY SERVE. FUNDING SHALL BE USED FOR THE PROJECTS, AND IN THE AMOUNTS, SPECIFIED UNDER THE HEADING “COMMUNITY ORIENTED POLICING SERVICES, TECHNOLOGY AND EQUIPMENT COMMUNITY PROJECTS/ COPS LAW ENFORCEMENT TECHNOLOGY AND EQUIPMENT” IN THE JOINT EXPLANATORY STATEMENT – DIVISION B, WHICH IS INCORPORATED BY REFERENCE INTO PUBLIC LAW 117-103.

FUNDING SHALL BE USED FOR THE PROJECTS, AND IN THE AMOUNTS, SPECIFIED UNDER THE HEADING “COMMUNITY ORIENTED POLICING SERVICES, TECHNOLOGY AND EQUIPMENT COMMUNITY PROJECTS/ COPS LAW ENFORCEMENT TECHNOLOGY AND EQUIPMENT” IN THE JOINT EXPLANATORY STATEMENT – DIVISION B, WHICH IS INCORPORATED BY REFERENCE INTO PUBLIC LAW 117-103.
