THIS AWARD WILL PURCHASE AND INSTALL THE  APEX OFFICER TRAINING SYSTEM SIMULATOR AND A ACCESSORIES AND SUPPORT TRAINING SIMULATOR. THERE WILL BE A “TRAIN THE TRAINER” COURSE, WHICH INCLUDES TRAINING FOR TRAINERS/INSTRUCTORS THAT ARE INVOLVED WITH EACH DIVISION AND WITH THE DETENTION CENTER TRAINING STAFF.

THE OSWEGO COUNTY SHERIFF’S OFFICE SEEKS TO PURCHASE A TRAINING SIMULATOR AND ITS REQUIRED ACCESSORIES FROM VIRTRA, SPECIFICALLY THE V-180 LAW ENFORCEMENT TRAINING SIMULATOR, FOR THE OSWEGO COUNTY REGIONAL POLICE ACADEMY. THE PURCHASE OF THE TRAINING SIMULATOR WILL ENHANCE THE POLICE ACADEMY’S EXISTING DE-ESCALATION TRAINING BY PROVIDING THE ACADEMY WITH SCIENCE-BASED AND EXPERT-CREATED CURRICULUM ON SITUATIONS INVOLVING DE-ESCALATION, IMPLICIT-BIAS, AND DUTY TO INTERVENE TRAINING.

THIS AWARD SUPPORTS THE PURCHASE OF A VR/AR SYSTEM TO ENHANCE CURRENT TRAINING EFFORTS TO SUPPLY OUR OFFICERS WITH REFRESHER TRAINING AFTER BEING INVOLVED IN FIELD INCIDENTS. THE VR/AR TECHNOLOGY WILL INTEGRATE INTO THEIR TRAINING TO ALLOW INSTRUCTORS TO ENCOURAGE NOT ONLY DE-ESCALATION TECHNIQUES TO THEIR FULLEST, BUT TO ENCOURAGE THEM TO EMPLOY THE TENETS OF PROCEDURAL JUSTICE AND THE DUTY TO INTERVENE IN THEIR SIMULATED INTERACTIONS.

THE WHITE COUNTY SHERIFF’S OFFICE IN TENNESSEE IS REQUESTING HELP FOR FUNDING EQUIPMENT NEEDED FOR DE-ESCALATION TRAINING. THE AXON ENTERPRISE VR, WHICH REPRESENTS THE FUTURE OF PUBLIC SAFETY TRAINING, WILL ULTIMATELY MAKE BOTH COMMUNITIES AND OFFICERS SAFER.

THIS AWARD IS TO INTRODUCE CONTEMPORARY AND REALISTIC TRAINING UTILIZING THE VIRTRA VIRTUAL REALITY SYSTEM, TO ENHANCE TRAINING BY PROCURING EXPANDED SOFTWARE AND SUPPLEMENTAL COMPONENTS AND SOFTWARE UPGRADES TO PERMIT INSTRUCTORS TO SUPERIMPOSE ACTUAL CITY LOCATIONS INTO THE VIDEO IN ORDER TO CREATE A MORE REALISTIC EXPERIENCE.  INSTALLING RECORDING AND MONITORING DEVICES WILL ALLOW FOR AN IMMEDIATE CRITIQUE FOLLOWING THE SCENARIO AND ALLOW THE OFFICER TO WATCH HIS/HER ACTIONS.

ACTIVITIES SUPPORTED BY THIS AWARD INCLUDE; 1) SENDING CERTIFIED HPD LAW ENFORCEMENT INSTRUCTORS TO NATIONALLY CERTIFIED TRAIN-THE-TRAINER COURSES RELATED TO DE-ESCALATION AND IMPLICIT BIAS; 2) THOSE INSTRUCTORS  ADMINISTER THE SAME TRAINING TO ALL SWORN HPD OFFICERS. 3) ALL OFFICERS WILL BE REQUIRED TO PARTICIPATE IN THIS TRAINING AS WELL AS A 4-HOUR ON-DEMAND COURSE REGARDING DUTY TO INTERVENE AND 4) UPDATING POLICIES AND IMPLEMENTING PRACTICES IN ACCORDANCE WITH BEST PRACTICES.

IT IS THE GOAL OF THE ROSEVILLE POLICE DEPARTMENT TO USE GRANT FUNDING TO CREATE, ENHANCE AND SUSTAIN A COMPREHENSIVE DE-ESCALATION TRAINING PROGRAM BY OBTAINING A VIRTUAL REALITY SYSTEM FOR USE IN FORCE OPTIONS, TACTICAL COMMUNICATION, DUTY TO INTERVENE AND DE-ESCALATION SKILLS TRAINING. IF THE ROSEVILLE POLICE DEPARTMENT OBTAINED A VR SYSTEM, WE WOULD BE ABLE TO PROVIDE EXCELLENT TRAINING AND A CULTURE OF SKILLED DE-ESCALATION FOR OUR OFFICERS AND THE VARIETY OF LAW ENFORCEMENT ENTITIES AND HHS WORKERS THAT WE SERVE WITH.

THIS AWARD WILL PURCHASE AN APEX OFFICER INTERACTIVE CRISIS INTERVENTION, DE-ESCALATION, AND USE OF FORCE TRAINING SIMULATOR AND INTEGRATE ITS USE INTO THE YEARLY TRAINING CYCLE.  THE DEPARTMENT WILL USE RESOURCES SUCH AS THOSE REGIONAL COPS APPROVED DE-ESCALATION TRAINING CENTERS AND RELATED PUBLICATIONS MENTIONED IN THE SOLICITATION INSTRUCTIONS FOR THIS GRANT TO DEVELOP OUR INSTRUCTORS' KNOWLEDGE AND TEACHING SKILLS IN THE AREAS OF CRISIS INTERVENTION, DE-ESCALATION, DUTY TO INTERVENE, AND PROPER USE OF FORCE APPLICATIONS.

THIS PROJECT WILL FUND OVERTIME FOR ADDITIONAL TRAINING OF OUR OFFICERS, SUPPORT THE PURCHASE OF A LAW ENFORCEMENT BASED VIRTUAL REALITY SYSTEM OUR TRAINERS CAN TRAVEL WITH. FUNDING FOR OUR TRAINERS TO ATTEND TRAIN THE TRAINER SEMINARS, TRAINING WORKSHOPS, AND TEAM BUILDING EVENTS.  THIS GRANT WILL SUPPORT FUNDING FOR OUTSIDE INSTRUCTORS TO PROVIDE CONSULTATION AND TRAINING (TRAIN THE TRAINER).
THIS AWARD SUPPORTS THE PURCHASE THE APEX OFFICER – PRO TRAINING SIMULATOR AND IT'S ACCOMPANYING HARDWARE WHICH WILL BE WILL BE THE FIRST IN KANSAS.

THIS AWARD WILL SUPPORT A PORTABLE TURN-KEY VIRTUAL REALITY DE-ESCALATION, DECISION-MAKING, AND USE OF FORCE TRAINING SYSTEM. THIS FUNDING WILL ALSO PROVIDE A SUBSCRIPTION TO POLICE ONE ACADEMY WHICH OFFERS OVER 1,500 WEB-BASED TRAINING COURSES AND VIDEOS ON DE-ESCALATION, IMPLICIT BIAS, COMMUNITY POLICING, EMOTIONALLY DISTURBED PERSONS, IADLEST NATIONAL CERTIFICATION PROGRAMS COURSES, AND MANY OTHERS. THEY WILL REQUIRE (4) HOURS OF ONLINE TRAINING PER MONTH PER OFFICER OVER THE TWO-YEAR GRANT FUNDING PERIOD.

THIS AWARD WILL SUPPORT VIRTUAL REALITY DE-ESCALATION, DECISION-MAKING, AND USE OF FORCE TRAINING SYSTEM, APEX OFFICER VR SIMULATOR TO PROVIDE THE NECESSARY TECHNOLOGY THAT MHPD REQUIRES FOR REALISTIC DE-ESCALATION, DECISION-MAKING, AND COMMUNICATION TRAINING EXERCISES/SCENARIOS/MODULES.

THE AWARD IS TO PURCHASE THE VIR TRA 300 SIMULATOR EQUIPMENT, AND TRAIN AN INSTRUCTOR WHO WILL ALSO TEACH TO RECOGNIZE HOOKS AND TRIGGERS AS A METHOD TO ENHANCE UNDERSTANDING, CREATE EMPATHY, AND LEAD TO DE-ESCALATION.  THIS VIR TRA 300 SIMULATOR AND THE TRAINING FOR THE USE OF FORCE TRAINING TO CERTIFY THE OFFICERS TO PROVIDE THE TRAINING FOR THE HAMPSHIRE POLICE DEPARTMENT, LOCAL LAW ENFORCEMENT AND THE SCHOOL DISTRICT.

THIS PROJECT WILL SUPPORT NATIONALLY CERTIFIED DE-ESCALATION TRAINING FOR IT'S OFFICERS WITH THE PURCHASE OF TRAINING MATERIAL PROVIDED THROUGH VIRTRA.  THE CURRICULUM AND EQUIPMENT THAT WOULD BE PURCHASED WITH THESE GRANT FUNDS ARE DESIGNED TO TEACH, TRAIN, TEST, AND SUSTAIN OFFICERS WITH CRUCIAL, POTENTIALLY LIFE-SAVING SKILLS WHILE ALSO INCREASING THEIR COGNITIVE ABILITIES.

THIS AWARD WILL ENABLE ALL SWORN ANAHEIM POLICE OFFICERS, DETENTION FACILITY EMPLOYEES, AND COMMUNICATIONS PERSONNEL, APPROXIMATELY FOUR-HUNDRED AND EIGHTY EMPLOYEES, TO ATTEND A CALIFORNIA POST-CERTIFIED SIXTEEN-HOUR TRAINING COURSE TITLED “PRACTICAL DE-ESCALATION AND TACTICAL CONDUCT.”

THIS AWARD WILL USE IN-HOUSE INSTRUCTORS, TO DEVELOP AND DELIVER AN EVIDENCE-BASED DE-ESCALATION AND DUTY TO INTERVENE TRAINING PROGRAM WHICH WILL BE OFFERED TO PSP PERSONNEL, OFFICERS, AND COMMUNITY MEMBERS THROUGHOUT THE COMMONWEALTH. THIS AWARD WILL SUPPORT A LARGE LIBRARY OF HIGH-FIDELITY TRAINING CONTENT ALLOWING FOR VARIED FORCE MITIGATION AND DE-ESCALATION OUTCOMES AND WHICH INCLUDE SCENARIOS INVOLVING MENTAL HEALTH EMERGENCIES.

THIS AWARD WILL ENHANCE DE-ESCALATION TRAINING AND PROVIDE THE FOLLOWING DELIVERABLES; 1) DEVELOPMENT OF AN EVIDENCE-BASED, EFFECTIVE, ROBUST DE-ESCALATION TRAINING PROGRAM; 2) SUCCESSFUL DEPLOYMENT OF TACTICAL JUDGEMENT SYSTEM; 3)  A STRONG SET OF POLICIES AND ONGOING TRAINING SCHEDULE; 4)  AN INTENSIVE, THOROUGH, AND ON-GOING PROGRAM EVALUATION; 5) AVAILABILITY OF TRAINING FOR OUTSIDE AGENCIES; 6) ANNUAL REPORT OF NUMBER OF OFFICERS TRAINED, THROUGH BOTH INTERNAL TRAINING AND TRAINING OFFERINGS TO OUTSIDE AGENCIES; AND 7)ACCESSIBILITY AND DEMONSTRATIONS OF EQUIPMENT TO THE COMMUNITY, THROUGH CITIZENS’ ACADEMIES AND OTHER PUBLIC EVENTS.

THIS AWARD WILL SUPPORT LEARNING ABOUT THE VARIOUS ASPECTS OF DE-ESCALATION WITH THOROUGH KNOWLEDGE OF THE SUBJECT, THE OFFICER INTERACTING WITH THE SUBJECT MUST BE AWARE OF THE RIGHT TIME TO INTERVENE AND THE RIGHT TIME TO APPLY CONSTRAINTS BASED ON THE SUBJECT’S BEHAVIOR. THE GOAL IS IMPROVING THE WAY POLICE OFFICERS COMMUNICATE WITH SUBJECTS MAY HELP TO REDUCE ASSAULTS ON POLICE OFFICERS.

HIS AWARD WILL PROVIDE OUR OFFICERS WITH SPECIFIC TRAINING TO HELP THE AGENCY DEVELOP THE SKILLS NEEDED TO INTERACT WITH SUBJECTS WHO ARE STRUGGLING IN A HEIGHTENED STATE OF MIND AND PURCHASE THE APEX X2 VIRTUAL REALITY VR TRAINING PROGRAM AND TRAINING.

THIS AWARD WILL INCREASE THE CAPACITY OF OUR TRAINING PROGRAM DE-ESCALATION, IMPLICIT BIAS AND DUTY TO INTERVENE TECHNIQUES. THROUGH THIS TWO-YEAR PROJECT, 213 SWORN OFFICERS WILL RECEIVE HIGH-QUALITY, RESEARCH-BASED TRAINING AND THREE MIRAMAR PD INSTRUCTORS WILL RECEIVE INSTRUCTOR-LEVEL TRAINING. THE PROJECT GOAL IS TO MAKE DE-ESCALATION A FOCAL PART OF MIRAMAR PD’S TRAINING PROGRAM AND PIVOTAL PART OF OUR AGENCY’S APPROACH TO POLICING.

THIS AWARD WILL BE IMPLEMENTING THE NEW ACTIVE BYSTANDERSHIP FOR LAW ENFORCEMENT (ABLE) TRAINING FOR ALL INCUMBENT OFFICERS AND ENHANCING EXISTING TRAINING WITH A FOCUS ON THE BASIC ACADEMY RECRUITS. IN ADDITION, IT SUPPORTS THE PURCHASE THE APEX OFFICER WHICH WILL ALLOW OFFICERS TO WORK ON A VARIETY OF SKILLS IN A SAFE AND CONTROLLED ENVIRONMENT INCLUDING DE-ESCALATION TECHNIQUES, COMMUNICATION, ACTIVE LISTENING, USE OF FORCE PROCEDURES, CRISIS INTERVENTION TRAINING, DECISION-MAKING AND JUDGMENT, DUTY TO INTERVENE, AND PROBLEM-SOLVING.

THIS AWARD WILL BE USED TO PURCHASE VR EQUIPMENT AND TRAINING SYSTEM TO ENHANCE THEIR CURRENT ACADEMY AND IN-SERVICE TRAINING PROGRAMS TO ALLOW ALL OFFICERS TO SAFELY AND EFFECTIVELY TRAIN IN REALITY BASED TRAINING SCENARIOS SUCH AS DE-ESCALATION, FAIR AND IMPARTIAL POLICING AND EFFECTIVE COMMUNICATION. THIS PROJECT WILL ALLOW OFFICERS TO EXPERIENCE A VARIETY OF STIMULUS IN A VIRTUAL FORMAT THAT, ALLOWS OFFICERS TO MAKE MISTAKES, PRACTICE A SCENARIOS MULTIPLE TIMES, AND RE-ENFORCE THE CORRECT DE-ESCALATION TACTICS.

THIS AWARD WITH PROCURE THE APEX OFFICER VR SYSTEM FOR  DE-ESCALATION/FORCE REDUCTION TRAINING TO PROVIDES INTERACTIVE TESTING AND ASSESSMENT AND IMMERSIVE HANDS-ON SCENARIO-BASED EXERCISES WITH DETAILED DEBRIEFING AND AFTER-ACTION REVIEW. THE APEX OFFICER SYSTEM WILL BE AN ADDITIONAL TOOL TO TRAIN OFFICERS CONSISTENTLY AND SAFELY IN THE AREAS OF DECISION MAKING AND THREAT RECOGNITION.

THE GOAL OF THE PROPOSED PROJECT IS TO ESTABLISH/DEVELOP A COMPREHENSIVE DE-ESCALATION TRAINING PROGRAM. A VIRTUAL REALITY/AUGMENTED REALITY (VR/AR) TECHNOLOGY SYSTEM WILL BE ACQUIRED AS PART OF THE PROGRAM, TO SUPPORT AND BOLSTER DE-ESCALATION TRAINING EFFORTS, WHILE PROMOTING CONTINUAL LEARNING AND MAINTENANCE OF SKILLS.

THE CAMPTON HILLS POLICE DEPARTMENT IS CURRENTLY SEEKING FUNDING TO PURCHASE THE VIRTRA OR TI TRAINING SIMULATORS TO PROVIDE DE-ESCALATION TRAINING FOR ITS OFFICERS. SCENARIO TRAINING IS THE MOST EFFECTIVE AND PRACTICAL WAY TO TEACH AND EVALUATE KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS THAT OFFICERS WILL BE REQUIRED TO USE.

THIS AWARD SUPPORTS A LEAD AGENCY FOR THE PROGRAM THAT WILL WORK WITH OTHER PARTNER AGENCIES IN SETTING UP AND SCHEDULING THE TRAINING(S). EACH PARTNER AGENCY WILL SEND INSTRUCTORS TO THE CLASSROOM INSTRUCTORS TRAIN-THE-TRAINERS, SO THERE WILL BE FOUR INSTRUCTORS TRAINED TO TEACH THE DE-ESCALATION TRAINING AND WILL CONDUCT ANNUAL REFRESHER CLASSROOM DE-ESCALATION TRAININGS AND WILL ALLOW THE FLEXIBILITY OF TRAINING NEW OFFICERS AS THEY COME ON-BOARD AT THEIR AGENCY.
THE KILLEEN POLICE DEPARTMENT WILL HOST FOUR (4) 2-DAY TOP-TIER DE-ESCALATION TRAINING SESSIONS FOR OUR DEPARTMENT AND SURROUNDING LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCIES.

THIS AWARD WILL PURCHASE OF A PORTABLE VIRTUAL REALITY POLICE TRAINING SIMULATOR FROM VIRTRA WHICH WILL ALLOW THE POLICE DEPARTMENT TO CONDUCT A COMPREHENSIVE TRAINING PLAN WITH THE OVERALL GOAL OF TEACHING OFFICERS TO DE-ESCALATE SITUATIONS INVOLVING PEOPLE IN CRISIS. THE TRAINING SIMULATOR WILL ALLOW US TO TRAIN OFFICERS IN LOW-LIGHT SITUATIONS, DE-ESCALATION TECHNIQUES, MARKSMANSHIP AND THE USE OF ALL FORCE OPTIONS IN A CONTROLLED MANNER.

THIS AWARD WILL BE USED TO PURCHASE A VIRTRA V-180 TRAINING SYSTEM AND, THE ACCESSORIES, THE TRAINING NEEDED TO GIVE THE OFFICERS A HANDS-ON OPPORTUNITY TO USE AND PRACTICE THE DE-ESCALATION TECHNIQUES THEY WERE TRAINED IN. WE WILL OFFER MONTHLY TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES FOR INTERNAL AND EXTERNAL PERSONNEL TO BUILD AND MAINTAIN SWORN OFFICER'S DE-ESCALATION SKILLS AND PROFICIENCY.

THIS PROJECT WILL FUND THREE COURSES THAT WILL ASSIST WITH TEAM BUILDING, COMMUNICATION, CONFLICT RESOLUTION, DE-ESCALATION, GROWING AS LEADERS, AND BRINGING IN THE COMMUNITY STAKEHOLDERS TO BE INVOLVED WITH SOME OF THE TRAINING.

THIS DE-ESCALATION TRAINING PROJECT AIMS TO DECREASE DIVISION BETWEEN THE POLICE AND THEIR COMMUNITIES, WHILE EQUIPPING OFFICERS WITH THE SKILLS NEEDED TO DE-ESCALATE A CRISIS SITUATION. SEVENTEEN PARTNER LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCIES AND THEIR COMMUNITIES WHO WILL DIRECTLY BENEFIT FROM DE-ESCALATION TRAINING SUPPORTED BY THIS AWARD. THESE SEVENTEEN COMMUNITIES ARE EACH SERVED BY SMALL AND REGIONAL POLICE DEPARTMENTS AND LIE WITHIN YORK COUNTY, PENNSYLVANIA.

THIS AWARD WILL SUPPORT THE PURCHASE OF A SCENARIO-BASED TRAINING SYSTEM AND CURRICULUM TO ENHANCE AND EXPAND OUR TRAINING PROGRAM FOR NEW AND EXPERIENCED OFFICERS TO SUPPORT THE MAINTENANCE OF THEIR DE-ESCALATION, IMPLICIT BIAS, AND DUTY TO INTERVENE SKILL PROFICIENCY. THIS PROJECT WILL DIRECTLY ENHANCE THEIR INTERNAL CAPACITY TO DELIVER TRAININGS YEAR-ROUND, ON SHORT NOTICE, AND REGARDLESS OF THE BUDGET SHORTFALLS THAT CAN NEGATIVELY IMPACT OFF-SITE TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES.

THIS PROJECT WILL INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES; 1)WORK WITH A TRAINED COMMUNITY ORIENTED POLICE STRATEGIST/CONSULTANT TO IMPLEMENT A DEPARTMENT-WIDE DE-ESCALATION TRAINING PROGRAM; 2) REVIEW EXISTING DEPARTMENT POLICIES AND PROCEDURES REGARDING DE-ESCALATION AND USE OF FORCE AND UPDATE, AMEND, AND/OR REFINE EXISTING PROTOCOLS AND; 3) BRING AWARENESS TO THIS CAMPAIGN AND TO THE EXTENT POSSIBLE INTEGRATE THE LOCAL COMMUNITY IN THE PROGRAM.

THIS AWARD WILL PROVIDE A COMBINATION OF ACTIVE BYSTANDERSHIP FOR LAW ENFORCEMENT (ABLE) TRAINING AND INTEGRATING COMMUNICATIONS, ASSESSMENT, AND TACTICS (ICAT) DE-ESCALATION TRAINING. FUNDS WILL BE USED TO PROVIDE OVERTIME PAY FOR OFFICERS PARTICIPATING IN THE ABLE AND ICAT TRAIN-THE-TRAINER PROGRAMS AND SUBSEQUENT INTERNAL ABLE/ICAT TRAINING SESSIONS, AS WELL AS DEVELOP INTERNAL MARKETING MATERIALS TO CONTRIBUTE TO A CULTURE OF DE-ESCALATION.

THIS AWARD WILL SUPPORT OBTAINING A VIRTRA TRAINING SIMULATOR SO THAT OFFICERS WILL HAVE THE MOST REALISTIC TRAINING AND CURRICULUM DESIGNED FOR DE-ESCALATION, IMPLICIT BIAS, DUTY TO INTERVENE, USE OF FORCE, AND TO ENSURE THAT OUR OFFICERS AND MEMBERS OF THE COMMUNITY REMAIN SAFE. APD HOPES TO SHARE THIS TRAINING SIMULATOR AND CURRICULUM WITH OTHER LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCIES NEAR OUR COMMUNITY SO THAT NOT ONLY IS OUR COMMUNITY BENEFITING FROM THIS SUPERIOR TRAINING.

THIS PROJECT SUPPORTS THE PURCHASE OF A VIRTRA 100 LE VIRTUAL INTERACTIVE TRAINING SYSTEM FROM VIRTRA, INC TO TRAIN OFFICERS ON HOW TO RESPOND TO A WIDE VARIETY OF SITUATIONS WITH AN EMPHASIS ON DE-ESCALATION AND INCLUDES SCENARIOS INVOLVING INDIVIDUALS FROM EVERY SEGMENT OF THE POPULATION INCLUDING PEOPLE WITH AUTISM AND PEOPLE WITH MENTAL HEALTH ISSUES. THIS AWARD WILL ALSO FUND AN OFFICERS ATTEND THE FEMA "TRAIN THE TRAINER" COURSE TITLED "INTEGRATING COMMUNICATIONS, ASSESSMENT AND TACTICS (ICAT)".

THIS AWARD WILL SUPPORT THE APEX OFFICER TRAINING SIMULATOR TO FURTHER THEIR EDUCATION WITH TRAINING AND RESOURCES FOR OUR OFFICERS AND THE COMMUNITY WE SERVE. THE INITIAL AND ONGOING ANNUAL TRAINING WILL ONLY ENHANCE THE WAY OUR OFFICERS INTERACT WITH AND COMMUNICATE WITH THE COMMUNITY WE SERVE AND PROTECT, AS WELL AS KEEP THE OFFICERS’ SKILLS AT A HIGHER LEVEL.
THE CAMPBELL COUNTY SHERIFF’S OFFICE (CCSO) IS SEEKING FUNDING TO PURCHASE A VIRTRA V-100 TRAINING SIMULATOR WITH ACCOMPANYING TRAINING CURRICULUM TO SUPPORT DE-ESCALATION TRAINING EFFORTS.

THE CITY OF BELLEVILLE SEEKS FUNDING TO PROVIDE TRAINING TO ALL OFFICERS WITHIN THE DEPARTMENT ON FOUR SCENARIOS GOVERNING USE OF FORCE THROUGH THE USE OF A VR SYSTEM.

THE PHILOSOPHY OF THE SPALDING COUNTY SHERIFF’S OFFICE IS SEEKING ACCREDITATION WITH THE COMMISSION ON ACCREDITATION FOR LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCIES (CALEA) AND WILL USE GRANT FUNDS TO PURCHASE THE COMPUTERS, A SCANNER AND TRAINING TO ASSIST WITH THEIR ACCREDITATION EFFORTS.

FORREST COUNTY SHERIFF'S OFFICE WILL USE GRANT FUNDING WILL OFFSET THE COSTS OF ITEMS AND EQUIPMENT REQUIRED TO MEET ACCREDITATION STANDARDS, SO FCSO CAN ACHIEVE ACCREDITATION SOONER.  MUST HAVE MATERIALS NEEDED BY THE FCSO FOR ACCREDITATION INCLUDE: INSTANT PLAYBACK EQUIPMENT FOR THE COMMUNICATIONS CENTER’S RADIO CONSOLES, BACK-UP POWER SUPPLIES FOR DISPATCH, LOCKABLE FILING CABINETS, WASP INVENTORY CONTROL SYSTEM TO DOCUMENT EVIDENCE, REFLECTIVE TRAFFIC VESTS, ELECTRONIC CITATION GENERATION AND PROCESSING SYSTEM, VIRTUAL ACADEMY, GUARDIAN TRACKING, AND CRIME SCENE TAPE AND EQUIPMENT.

THE SUMMERVILLE POLICE DEPARTMENT WILL USE FUNDS AWARDED THROUGH THE COPS GRANT, SUMMERVILLE POLICE CAN ESTABLISH A CLEAR TIMELINE ON HOW TO BECOME INTERNATIONALLY ACCREDITED WITHIN THE NEXT FIVE (5) YEARS.  THE TWO (2) YEAR GRANT CYCLE WILL ENABLE US TO BEGIN THE INITIAL ACCREDITATION PROCESS BY ENROLLING AND BEGINNING THE SELF-ASSESSMENT PHASE OF THIS PROCESS.  THE CHIEF OF POLICE, AS WELL AS HIS STAFF, WILL BE RESPONSIBLE TO REVIEWING AND REVISING CURRENT POLICIES AND PROCEDURES TO BRING THEM WITHIN THE CALEA STANDARDS PRIOR TO AN ON-SITE ASSESSMENT IN THREE (3) YEARS.  THE INITIAL ACCREDITATION FEE OF $11,450.00 WILL ALLOW FOR THE DEPARTMENT TO BEGIN THE LENGTHY PROCESS OF ENROLLMENT AND REVIEWING AND REVISING CURRENT POLICIES AND PROCEDURES.  ONCE THE ACCREDITATION PROCESS IS COMPLETE WITHIN THE NEXT FIVE (5) YEARS, IT IS EXPECTED THAT THE BENEFITS TO BOTH STAFF AND THE COMMUNITY WILL BE TANGIBLE AND EVIDENT BY THE INTERACTIONS FROM BOTH PARTIES.  THE CITIZENS WILL HAVE A CLEAR VISION OF WHAT THE LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCY'S MISSION AND EXPECTATIONS ARE, WHILE THE LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCY WILL HAVE GREATER ACCOUNTABILITY WITHIN AND A STRONGER DEFENSE AGAINST CIVIL LAWSUITS AND LIABILITY INSURANCE.

THE ALLEN PARK POLICE DEPARTMENT IS PARTNERING WITH THE MICHIGAN ASSOCIATION OF CHIEFS OF POLICE (MACP) TO OBTAIN ACCREDITATION. THE GRANT WILL FUND PERSONNEL, TECHNOLOGY AND RESOURCES NEEDED TO EFFECTIVELY COMPLETE THE SELF-ASSESSMENT PROCESS WITH THE GOAL OF ACHIEVING ACCREDITATION.

THE NIAGARA FRONTIER TRANSPORTATION AUTHORITY POLICE DEPARTMENT WILL SEEK LAW ENFORCEMENT ACCREDITATION THROUGH THE NEW YORK STATE DIVISION OF CRIMINAL JUSTICE SERVICES (DCJS). FUNDING WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT POLICY DEVELOPMENT TO OBTAIN ACCREDITATION.

THE DAYTON VIRGINIA POLICE DEPARTMENT WILL USE GRANT FUNDS TO AID THE DEPARTMENT WITH OBTAINING VIRGINIA STATE ACCREDITATION THROUGH VIRGINIA LAW ENFORCEMENT PROFESSIONAL STANDARDS COMMISSION (VLEPSC). THE DEPARTMENT WILL UTILIZE FUNDS TO HIRE AN ACCREDITATION MANAGER.  THE ACCREDITATION MANAGER WILL WORK ALONGSIDE THE CHIEF OF POLICE TO COLLECT PROOFS OF COMPLIANCE, AND UPDATE POLICIES AND PROCEDURES AS NEEDED TO MEET ACCREDITATION STANDARDS. FUNDS WILL ALSO BE USED TO PURCHASE OFFICE SUPPLIES NEEDED TO AID IN THE ACCREDITATION PROCESS. ONCE PROOFS OF COMPLIANCE HAVE BEEN COLLECTED, THE DEPARTMENT WILL SCHEDULE A MOCK ASSESSMENT BY ASSESSORS CERTIFIED THROUGH THE VIRGINIA LAW ENFORCEMENT ACCREDITATION COALITION.(VALEAC) VALEAC IS THE ACCREDITATION BODY THAT OVER SEES VLEPSC.  THE DEPARTMENT WILL ADDRESS AND RESOLVE ANY ISSUES THAT ARISE FROM THE MOCK ASSESSMENT. THE DEPARTMENT WILL THEN OFFICIALLY HAVE AN ACCREDITATION ASSESSMENT.  ONCE THE DEPARTMENT RECEIVES ACCREDITATION, THE DEPARTMENT WILL COLLECT PROOFS OF COMPLIANCE OVER A 3 YEAR PERIOD WHERE THE DEPARTMENT WILL NEED TO BE RE-ACCREDITED.

THE LA VISTA POLICE DEPARTMENT WILL USE GRANT FUNDING TO ACHIEVE NATIONAL ACCREDITATION OF THE POLICE DEPARTMENT THROUGH THE COMMISSION ON ACCREDITATION FOR LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCIES (CALEA). WE BELIEVE THE BENEFITS OF ACCREDITATION (INCLUDING INCREASED COMMUNITY ADVOCACY, STAUNCH SUPPORT FROM GOVERNMENT OFFICIALS, STRONGER DEFENSE AGAINST CIVIL LAWSUITS, REDUCED RISK AND LIABILITY EXPOSURE, AND GREATER ACCOUNTABILITY WITHIN THE AGENCY) ARE WORTH THE TIME AND EFFORT TO ADVANCE OUR AGENCY.  THE GRANT FUNDING AVAILABLE WOULD GIVE THE POLICE DEPARTMENT FUNDING AND RESOURCES TO ACHIEVE NATIONAL ACCREDITATION.

MILLERSVILLE UNIVERSITY POLICE DEPARTMENT WILL USE GRANT FUNDS TO  ACHIEVE ACCREDITATION THROUGH THE PENNSYLVANIA CHIEFS OF POLICE ASSOCIATION (PCPA) TO ASSURE ADOPTION OF THE STANDARDS AND POLICIES AS ALIGNED WITH COMMUNITY AND UNIVERSITY EXPECTATIONS OF A PROFESSIONAL POLICE DEPARTMENT THAT ENGAGES POSITIVELY WITH OUR CAMPUS COMMUNITY.

THE LINDENWOLD POLICE DEPARTMENT HAS BEGUN THE PROCESS OF BECOMING ACCREDITED THROUGH THE NEW JERSEY ASSOCIATION OF CHIEFS OF POLICE (NJSACOP). WE HAVE CONTRACTED WITH THE RODGERS GROUP, LLC TO PROVIDE ASSISTANCE WITH THE PROCESS. THE INITIAL COST WAS $39,900.00 WITH THE BOROUGH ALREADY PAYING $20,000.00. THE DEPARTMENT WILL USE GRANT FUNDS TO COVER THE REMAINING COSTS TO FINISH THE ACCREDITATION PROCESS. ACCREDITATION WILL ENSURE THAT THE DEPARTMENT IS OPERATING WITH THE MOST CURRENT RULES, REGULATIONS, POLICIES AND PROCEDURES AND WILL ALSO ENSURE THAT WE ARE USING THOSE PROCESSES. SUCCESSFULLY COMPLETING THE ACCREDITATION PROCESS WILL ALSO ENSURE THAT THE DEPARTMENT CAN APPLY FOR ADDITIONAL DEPARTMENT OF JUSTICE GRANTS IN THE FUTURE.

THROUGH THIS PROJECT, THE BUCKS COUNTY DISTRICT ATTORNEY'S OFFICE DETECTIVES PLAN TO BEGIN THE PROCESS OF BECOMING AN ACCREDITED LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCY. THE ACCREDITATION SOUGHT WILL BE THROUGH THE PENNSYLVANIA LAW ENFORCEMENT ACCREDITATION COMMISSION (PLEAC) INTRODUCED BY THE PENNSYLVANIA CHIEFS OF POLICE ASSOCIATION. THE PENNSYLVANIA CHIEFS OF POLICE ASSOCIATION DESCRIBES ACCREDITATION AS A PROGRESSIVE AND TIME-PROVEN WAY OF HELPING INSTITUTIONS EVALUATE AND IMPROVE THEIR OVERALL PERFORMANCE. THE CORNERSTONE OF THIS STRATEGY LIES IN THE PROMULGATION OF STANDARDS CONTAINING A CLEAR STATEMENT OF PROFESSIONAL OBJECTIVES. PARTICIPATING ADMINISTRATORS THEN CONDUCT A THOROUGH ANALYSIS TO DETERMINE HOW EXISTING OPERATIONS CAN BE ADAPTED TO MEET THESE OBJECTIVES. WHEN THE PROCEDURES ARE IN PLACE, A TEAM OF INDEPENDENT PROFESSIONALS IS ASSIGNED TO VERIFY THAT ALL APPLICABLE STANDARDS HAVE BEEN SUCCESSFULLY IMPLEMENTED. THE PROCESS CULMINATES WITH A DECISION BY AN AUTHORITATIVE BODY THAT THE INSTITUTION IS WORTHY OF ACCREDITATION. OUT OF THE 131 PENNSYLVANIA LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCIES CURRENTLY MAINTAINING ACCREDITED STATUS, WE WOULD BE THE ONLY COUNTY DETECTIVE AGENCY IN THE STATE. THE BUCKS COUNTY DETECTIVES WILL USE GRANT FUNDS TO OBTAIN THE SERVICES OF LAW ENFORCEMENT ACCREDITATION SERVICES, LLC TO ACCOMPLISH THIS GOAL.

THE CITY OF DALLAS POLICE DEPARTMENT (DPD) WILL USE FUNDING TO PURSUE THE LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCY BEST PRACTICES ACCREDITATION THROUGH THE TEXAS POLICE CHIEFS ASSOCIATION FOUNDATION (TPCAF). THIS ACCREDITATION IS A VOLUNTARY PROCESS WHERE OUR DEPARTMENT WILL PROVE COMPLIANCE WITH 168 TEXAS LAW ENFORCEMENT BEST PRACTICES. IN ORDER TO ACHIEVE THIS GOAL, FUNDS WILL BE USED TO HIRE 2 STAFF MEMBERS DEDICATED TO THIS SPECIFIC ACCREDITATION PROGRAM, UNDER THE UMBRELLA OF THE DPD PLANNING UNIT. THIS STAFF WILL IDENTIFY THE REQUIRED DATA, AND COLLECT THAT DATA TO SHOW WE ARE MEETING CURRENT STANDARDS WHERE APPLICABLE, AND TO IDENTIFY GAPS IN OUR CURRENT POLICIES AND PROCEDURES WHERE MORE WORK IS NEEDED TO MEET THE STANDARD.

THE COLONIAL BEACH POLICE DEPARTMENT (CBPD) IS SEEKING VIRGINIA STATE ACCREDITATION.  THE AGENCY WILL HIRE AN ACCREDITATION MANAGER WHO WILL BE CHARGED WITH FACILITATING CBPD’S PURSUIT OF STATE ACCREDITATION AND IMPLEMENTING STRONG INTERNAL ORGANIZATIONAL CONTROLS TO ENSURE ACCREDITATION.

THE LANSDOWNE BOROUGH POLICE DEPARTMENT IS DEDICATED TO ACHIEVING ACCREDITED STATUS THROUGH THE PENNSYLVANIA CHIEFS OF POLICE ASSOCIATION’S PENNSYLVANIA LAW ENFORCEMENT ACCREDITATION (PLEAC) PROGRAM. TO ACHIEVE THIS GOAL, THE  DEPARTMENT WILL USE GRANT FUNDING TO OBTAIN THE SERVICES OF ASPIRANT CONSULTING GROUP (ACG). ACG PROVIDES A COST-EFFECTIVE WAY TO ACHIEVE ACCREDITED STATUS; CONSULTING SERVICES ARE LESS THAN A THIRD OF THE COST TO DO IT WITH EXISTING DEPARTMENT STAFF. ADDITIONALLY, THE EXPERIENCED AND CREDENTIALED PROFESSIONALS AT ACG HAVE AN ESTABLISHED AND VERIFIABLE RECORD OF SUCCESS. IT IS OUR BELIEF THAT THIS APPROACH TO ACHIEVING ACCREDITATION IS IN THE BEST INTEREST OF THE DEPARTMENT AND OUR COMMUNITY.

THE CITY OF SPRINGFIELD, OREGON POLICE DEPARTMENT ACCREDITATION PROJECT WILL EMPHASIZE THE COMMITMENT THE SPRINGFIELD POLICE DEPARTMENT HAS PLACED ON CONTINUAL EVALUATION OF PROCESSES AND OPPORTUNITIES TO IMPROVE AND MEET THE COMMUNITY’S EXPECTATIONS OF THEIR POLICE DEPARTMENT.  SPD ENTERED INTO AN AGREEMENT WITH OREGON ACCREDITATION ALLIANCE (OAA) IN MAY 2022 FOR THE PURPOSE OF BECOMING ACCREDITED. INITIAL AND ONGOING FUNDING FOR THE AGREEMENT WITH OAA HAS BEEN IDENTIFIED. HOWEVER, INITIAL PLANNING FOR THE ACCREDITATION PROJECT HAS DETERMINED ADDITIONAL STAFFING VIA A CONTRACTED PROJECT MANAGER WOULD BEST SUPPORT THE PROJECT AND PROJECT TIMELINE. GRANT FUNDING WILL PROVIDE A COMPUTER AND OTHER SUPPLIES FOR THE CONTRACTED PROJECT MANAGER, AS WELL AS SUPPORT FOR UNANTICIPATED TRAINING NEEDS IDENTIFIED DURING THE ACCREDITATION PROCESS. WITH SUPPORT OF GRANT FUNDING AND A CONTRACTED PROJECT MANAGER, THE CITY OF SPRINGFIELD ANTICIPATES THE ACCREDITATION PROCESS COULD BE COMPLETE WITHIN 18 MONTHS OF AWARD.

THE LAKE COUNTY SHERIFF’S OFFICE IS SEEKING ACCREDITATION THROUGH MICHIGAN LAW ENFORCEMENT ACCREDITATION COMMISSION (MLEAC). ACCREDITATION REPRESENTS A SIGNIFICANT PROFESSIONAL ACHIEVEMENT AND ACCREDITED DEPARTMENTS ARE CONCEPTUALLY AND OPERATIONALLY MORE EFFECTIVE. ACCREDITATION ACKNOWLEDGES THE IMPLEMENTATION OF BEST PRACTICES AND SOUND WRITTEN DIRECTIVES, INCREASES THE EFFICIENCY IN DELIVERING LAW ENFORCEMENT AND MAINTAINS A HIGHER STANDARD OF PROFESSIONAL LAW ENFORCEMENT PRACTICES

THE NEW HOLLAND POLICE DEPARTMENT (NHPD) IS A SMALL, RURAL POLICE DEPARTMENT LOCATED IN SOUTH-CENTRAL PENNSYLVANIA WITH THE OVERALL GOAL TO BECOME AN ACCREDITED DEPARTMENT. NHPD WILL ALSO MAINTAIN ACCREDITATION.

THE PEARL RIVER VALLEY WATER SUPPLY DISTRICT / RESERVOIR POLICE DEPARTMENT IS SEEKING FUNDING TO APPLY FOR ACCREDITATION THROUGH THE MISSISSIPPI LAW ENFORCEMENT ACCREDITATION COMMISSION (MSLEAC). THE PURPOSE IS TO ESTABLISH PROFESSIONAL STANDARDS IN OUR AGENCY BASED ON THE GUIDELINES SET BY MSLEAC. THE GOAL IS TO STREGTHEN CRIME PREVENTION, FORMALIZE ESSENTIAL MANAGEMENT PROCEDURES, ESTABLISH NONDISCRIMINATORY PRACTICES AND BOOST CONFIDENCE IN OUR AGENCY. WITH GRANT FUNDS THE RESERVOIR POLICE DEPARTMENT LOOK TO USE FUNDING TO AQUIRE A RELIABLE SOFTWARE PROGRAM TO MANAGE POLICIES, PROVIDE TESTING ON POLICIES AND RECORDS ON OFFICER PROGRESS AS IT RELATES TO ACCREDITATION. THE FUNDING WOULD ALSO HELP SUPPLEMENT FUNDING TO ACQUIRE EQUIPMENT AND SUPPLIES NEEDED TO GO THROUGH THE ACCREDITATION PROCESS SUCH AS COMPUTER, PRINTER, AND OVERTIME FOR OFFICER(S) WORKING ON THE ACCREDITATION PROCESS. THERE WILL BE TWO OFFICERS ASSIGNED TO WORK ON ACCREDITATION AS NEEDED. FUNDING WOULD BE ALLOCATED FOR OVERTIME PURPOSE ONLY AS IT RELATES TO OFFICERS WORKING ON ACCREDITATION WHEN TIME ALLOWS IF NOT ABLE TO SO WHILE ON REGULARLY SCHEDULED DATES. TRAVEL FUNDS WILL BE ALLOCATED FOR SCHEDULED VISITS BY REPRESENTATIVES OF MSLEAC TO MONITOR ACCREDITATION WHERE THE AGENCY IS RESPONSIBLE FOR TRAVEL AND LODGING ACCOMMODATIONS.

THE MOON TOWNSHIP POLICE DEPARTMENT IS SEEKING ACCREDITATION THROUGH THE PENNSYLVANIA LAW ENFORCEMENT ACCREDITATION COMMISSION (PLEAC).  THE AGENCY WILL UPDATE THE POLICIES AND PROCEDURES VIA A NEW SOFTWARE SYSTEM

THE NEW YORK POLICE DEPARTMENT, PATROL BOROUGH MANHATTAN NORTH (PBMN) IS UNDERTAKING FOUR INITIATIVES THAT WILL PARTNER PBMN WITH COMMUNITY AND LOCAL NONPROFIT ORGANIZATIONS TOWARDS COMMUNITY VIOLENCE INTERVENTION. THE FOUR INITIATIVES WILL CONSIST OF: “GET OFF THE BLOCK”, A PROGRAM EXPOSING CHILDREN AND YOUNG ADULTS TO OPPORTUNITIES OFFERED IN NYC, A BASKETBALL LEAGUE, A VOLLEYBALL LEAGUE AND MENTORING.

THE BROWARD COUNTY 'ME AND BSO: A SCHOOL-LAW ENFORCEMENT PARTNERSHIP PROJECT' PILOT WILL SERVE THREE ELEMENTARY SCHOOLS AND ONE MIDDLE SCHOOL IN A HISTORICALLY UNDERSERVED COMMUNITY. THE PROJECT IS DESIGNED TO SWORN AND NON-SWORN EMPLOYEES ENGAGE WITH STUDENTS IN ACTIVITIES AND EVENTS BY REINFORCING LESSONS LEARNED IN THE CLASSROOM.

TEMPE POLICE DEPARTMENT (TPD) WILL IMPLEMENT A COMMUNITY INTEGRATION AND TRANSFORMATION (CIT) PROGRAM IN PARTNERSHIP WITH FULFILLMENT IN TRAINING (FIT) TO BUILD TRUST AND LEGITIMACY WITH THE COMMUNITY.  THE PROJECT WILL FOCUS ON UNDERSERVED AND DISENFRANCHISED POPULATIONS THROUGH PHYSICAL FITNESS PROGRAMS AND ENGAGEMENT BETWEEN TEMPE POLICE DEPARTMENT AND PROGRAM PARTICIPANTS.

THE HIGHLAND PARK ILLINOIS POLICE DEPARTMENT IS UNDERTAKING A PILOT PROGRAM TO SUPPORT POLICE-YOUTH RELATIONSHIPS. THE PILOT WILL BUILD TRUST, INTRODUCE YOUTH TO PUBLIC SERVICE CAREER PATH, ENCOURAGE COMMUNITY INVOLVEMENT IN PUBLIC SAFETY EFFORTS, AND GROW CONNECTIONS AND PARTNERSHIPS BETWEEN LAW ENFORCEMENT AND COMMUNITY GROUPS.

CHESTERFIELD COUNTY POLICE DEPARTMENT (CCPD); THE VIRGINIA STATE POLICE (VSP), AND THE VIRGINIA ASSOCIATION OF CHIEFS OF POLICE (VACP) WILL DEVELOP THE  INFORMATION DNA (IDNA) PROJECT, A FIRST-OF-ITS-KIND MODERN APPLICATION AND TECHNOLOGY APPROACH THAT ALLOWS THE POLICE AND THE PUBLIC TO WORK TOGETHER TO SOLVE CRIME. THE PROJECT WILL UTILIZE MOBILE APPLICATIONS AND INFORMATION SHARING WITH THE PUBLIC.

THE JACKSON POLICE DEPARTMENT AND A RESEARCHER FROM THE STATE OF MISSISSIPPI’S FLAGSHIP RESEARCH UNIVERSITY WILL ASSESS THE EFFECTIVENESS OF AN EVIDENCE-BASED, BEST PRACTICES-INFORMED RECRUITMENT AND RETENTION PLAN USING A MIXED METHODOLOGICAL FRAMEWORK INVOLVING BOTH QUANTITATIVE AND QUALITATIVE METHODS AND A ROBUST HUMAN RESOURCES SOFTWARE PLATFORM.

THE ROSWELL POLICE DEPARTMENT WILL DEVELOP A SEPARATE HISPANIC CITIZENS’ POLICE ACADEMY TO ATTRACT GREATER PARTICIPATION BY HISPANIC RESIDENTS. THIS SPECIFIC AUDIENCE WILL HAVE THE OPPORTUNITY TO PARTICIPATE IN TWO 5-WEEK PROGRAMS WITHIN THEIR BACK YARD. IN PARTNERSHIP WITH LOCAL STAKEHOLDERS, THE ROSWELL POLICE DEPARTMENT WILL BUILD LONG-LASTING RELATIONSHIPS WITH LATINO COMMUNITY LEADERS WHO CAN LATER SERVE AS AMBASSADORS FOR THE AGENCY.

THE SEATTLE POLICE 'BEFORE THE BADGE (BTB)' IS A PRE-LAW ENFORCEMENT ACADEMY TRAINING PROGRAM THAT IS PART OF THE SEATTLE POLICE DEPARTMENT’S (SPD) SPD360 RELATIONAL POLICING INITIATIVE. BTB IS A MULTI-WEEK PROGRAM DESIGNED TO PROVIDE PRE-ACADEMY RECRUITS WITH FOUNDATIONAL KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND RELATIONSHIPS TO SUCCEED AS PARTNERS IN THE COMMUNITY AND LEADERS IN THIS DEPARTMENT.

THE SUFFOLK COUNTY PROJECT WILL SUPPORT ACTIVITIES FOR UNDERSERVED COMMUNITY YOUTH WITH A PRIMARY FOCUS ON ENGAGING HOMELESS YOUTH. THE AGENCY YOUTH ENGAGEMENT PROGRAM WILL COORDINATE SPECIAL ACTIVITIES FOR HOMELESS YOUTH LIVING IN LOCAL SHELTERS;  ENGAGE YOUTH WHO ARE AT-RISK (HOMELESS, UNACCOMPANIED MINORS, ETC.); AND HIGH SCHOOL YOUTH SEEKING TO PARTICIPATE IN THE SCPDS EXPLORERS PROGRAM BUT LACK FINANCIAL MEANS.

THE KENTUCKY OFFICE OF THE ATTORNEY GENERAL (KYOAG), IN CONJUNCTION WITH THE NATIONAL CENTER FOR MISSING AND EXPLOITED CHILDREN (NCMEC), WILL ADDRESS THE TRAGEDY OF MISSING AND/OR ENDANGERED RUNAWAYS, MANY OF WHOM ARE FOSTER CHILDREN FROM UNDERSERVED POPULATIONS.  THE OFFICE SHALL LAUNCH A STATEWIDE MULTI-MEDIA, MULTI-PLATFORM AWARENESS CAMPAIGN FOR EDUCATION AND PREVENTION.

PITTSBURGH BUREAU OF POLICE MICROGRANT PROGRAM'S GOAL IS TO TRANSFORM THE WAY THAT RECRUITS VIEW THE PEOPLE THEY ARREST AND THE NEIGHBORHOODS THEY PATROL, USING THE PRISM OF PRISON TO ALTER THEIR COGNITIVE LENSES, WHILE TRANSFORMING HOW INCARCERATED MEN LOOK AT THE POLICE. THE CURRICULUM MAINTAINS A RIGOROUS PUBLIC SAFETY FOCUS WITH AN EMPHASIS ON RESTORATIVE JUSTICE, WHILE FUNCTIONING AS A SPACE WHERE THE TWO GROUPS CAN COME TO SEE EACH OTHER – AND THEMSELVES – AS PEOPLE WITH VESTED INTERESTS IN THEIR SHARED COMMUNITIES. THE DEPARTMENT WILL USE GRANT FUNDING TO SUPPORT THE FURTHER DEVELOPMENT AND EXPANSION OF THIS INNOVATIVE CURRICULUM FOR POLICE TRAINING. POLICE TRAINING INSIDE-OUT CAN SERVE AS AN IMPORTANT STEP IN FACILITATING THE COMMUNITY POLICING COMPONENT OF COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIPS AND HAS APPLICATION BEYOND THE ACADEMY WITH VETERAN OFFICERS AS GRADUATE/UNDERGRADUATE COURSES OR IN-SERVICE TRAININGS. WHAT WE ARE PROPOSING, BEGINS WITH A PARTNERSHIP BETWEEN POLICE, UNIVERSITIES AND PRISONS, BUT QUICKLY EVOLVES INTO POWERFUL ALLIANCES BETWEEN OFFICERS AND INCARCERATED MEN OR WOMEN. ONCE A CRITICAL MASS OF INDIVIDUALS WHO CAN SEE PAST THESE DIVERGENT SOCIAL STATUSES EMERGES, THERE IS A POTENTIAL FOR TRANSFORMATION IN THE RELATIONSHIPS AND INTERACTIONS BETWEEN POLICE AND COMMUNITIES MOST PLAGUED BY CRIME AND DISORDER.  AT THAT POINT, WE WILL BE ABLE TO FURTHER EXPAND OUR PARTNERSHIP TO INCLUDE PITTSBURGH’S OFFICE OF COMMUNITY HEALTH AND SAFETY AS WELL AS OUR GROUP VIOLENCE INITIATIVE, FORMING WORKING GROUPS THAT INCLUDE INCARCERATED/RETURNING CITIZENS DEVOTED TO STEMMING THE TIDE OF VIOLENCE IN OUR CITY.

ST. PETERSBURG POLICE DEPARTMENT (SPPD) IS CONDUCTING A MULTI-FACETED COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT PROJECT WITH CITY OF ST. PETERSBURG PARKS AND RECREATION DEPARTMENT, YOUTH SPORTS LEAGUES IN THE CITY AND THE ST. PETERSBURG POLICE ATHLETIC LEAGUE (PAL) INVOLVING TUTORING SERVICES PROVIDED BY UNIVERSITY OF SOUTH FLORIDA EDUCATION STUDENTS.

THE NEW HAVEN POLICE DEPARTMENT (NHPD) WILL IMPLEMENT AN OFFICER RECRUITMENT AND RETENTION PROGRAM BY ENHANCING EXISTING STRATEGIES AND CREATING EVIDENCE-BASED NEW APPROACHES. OFFICER REFERRAL SYSTEMS, USE OF A MARKETING AND SOCIAL MEDIA TEAM; RECRUITMENT EVENTS AND A RECRUITMENT WEBSITE; AND PROVIDE PREPARATION TRAINING FOR THE APPLICATION PHYSICAL AGILITY, ORAL AND WRITTEN EXAMS.

WITH FY2022 COPS COMMUNITY POLICING MICROGRANT FUNDING, BSO WILL EXPAND ITS CAPACITY TO ASSIST THIS UNDERSERVED POPULATION THROUGH ENHANCED TRAINING AND INCREASED OUTREACH PRESENCE AS PART OF OUR COMMUNITY-POLICING EFFORTS. MORE TRAINED OFFICERS AT BSO (AND OTHER MUNICIPAL LE AGENCIES) IN HOMELESS DIVERSION TECHNIQUES AND CONDUCTING NEEDS ASSESSMENTS WILL FULFILL A CRITICAL PUBLIC SAFETY NEED OF ENHANCED DIVERSION OF HOMELESS INDIVIDUALS TO SOCIAL SERVICES INSTEAD OF ARREST (AS APPLICABLE). UTILIZING GRANT-FUNDED OVERTIME IN THE EARLY MORNINGS, LATE EVENINGS, AND WEEKENDS, OFFICERS WILL HAVE MORE OPPORTUNITIES TO ENGAGE AND TRUST-BUILD WITH THE HOMELESS AND CAN INCREASE THEIR DIRECT ASSISTANCE AND REFERRALS FOR THIS POPULATION TO ACCESS AVAILABLE SERVICES SUCH AS HOUSING AND JOB ASSISTANCE, HEALTHCARE, MENTAL HEALTH COUNSELING, AND DRUG REHABILITATION. DIVERTING INDIVIDUALS EXPERIENCING HOMELESSNESS REDUCES THE INCIDENCES OF HOMELESSNESS (I.E., CALLS FOR SERVICE) AND ALLOWS LE RESOURCES TO BE MORE EFFICIENTLY UTILIZED. IT ALSO ADDRESSES QUALITY OF LIFE ISSUES, REDUCES COMPLAINTS FROM BUSINESSES/CUSTOMERS, AND INCREASES THE OVERALL SAFETY OF ALL RESIDENTS.

GRANT FUNDING WILL ALSO PROVIDE BSO WITH THE OPPORTUNITY TO SEND HOT DEPUTIES, PROGRAM STAFF, AND/OR SUPERVISORS TO FOUR (4) ANNUAL CONFERENCES ON HOMELESS AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH ISSUES. PROGRAM STAFF CAN BENEFIT FROM CONFERENCE WORKSHOPS ON CURRENT ISSUES AND UPDATE TRAINING CERTIFICATIONS. ATTENDEES WILL SHARE BEST PRACTICES AND LESSONS LEARNED INCLUDING EFFECTIVE PRACTICES AND STRATEGIES RELATED TO MENTAL HEALTH AND MOTIVATIONAL INTERVIEWING. ATTENDING CONFERENCES WITH SIMILAR AGENCIES WILL ALSO CREATE BENEFICIAL NETWORKING OPPORTUNITIES.

THE SALT LAKE CITY POLICE DEPARTMENT WILL DEVELOP AN EVALUATION OF THE PROMISING YOUTH PROJECT. THIS EVALUATION WILL PROVIDE FOUR MAJOR SERVICES: EVALUATION OF PROGRAM FIDELITY, EVALUATION OF PROGRAM OUTCOMES, TRAINING AND TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE, AND DEVELOPMENT OF A FINAL REPORT.

THE ARLINGTON POLICE DEPARTMENT (APD) WILL EXPAND RECRUITMENT EFFORTS BY CONDUCTING OUT-OF-STATE IN-PERSON INTERVIEWS, EXPANDING THE DEPARTMENT’S MARKETING CAMPAIGN TO REACH A MORE DIVERSE POOL OF CANDIDATES; AND ATTENDANCE AT THE 2023 POLICE RECRUITMENT AND RETENTION SUMMIT.

THE MASSACHUSETTS STATE POLICE RECRUITMENT AND DIVERSITY OFFICE PROJECT WILL EXPAND ALREADY ESTABLISHED PROGRAMS AND PILOT ADDITIONAL PROJECTS THAT WOULD ENGAGE YOUTH BETWEEN THE AGES 13-18 THROUGHOUT THE COMMONWEALTH TO CONSIDER EMPLOYMENT IN LAW ENFORCEMENT.

THE SAYREVILLE POLICE DEPARTMENT, IN PARTNERSHIP WITH BORDERING SOUTH AMBOY AND SOUTH RIVER POLICE DEPARTMENTS WILL USE FUNDING TO OBTAIN COPS COMMUNITY POLICING DEVELOPMENT FUNDING TO HIRE FOUR (4) SOCIAL WORKERS WHO WILL STAFF THE THREE NEIGHBORING DEPARTMENTS ON A ROTATING BASIS TO CONNECT INDIVIDUALS IN CRISIS WITH SERVICES BEFORE ESCALATION AND AID LOCAL OFFICERS WITH CREATING CONNECTIONS WITH THE COMMUNITY.  THIS INITIATIVE’S SUCCESSES AND FAILURES WILL ALSO SERVE AS A PILOT PROGRAM ON WHICH THE MIDDLESEX COUNTY PROSECUTOR’S OFFICE WILL MODEL ITS FUTURE PROPOSED CRISIS INTERVENTION PROGRAM.

THE MADISON POLICE DEPARTMENT (MPD) SEEKS TO BUILD LEGITIMACY AND TRUST BY EXPANDING THE DEPARTMENT’S CURRENT COMMUNITY POLICING CAPACITY THROUGH A FORMAL, COLLABORATIVE PARTNERSHIP WITH THE MADISON COMMUNITY POLICING FOUNDATION (MCPF); THE PURPOSE OF THIS CPD MICROGRANT PROPOSAL IS TWO-FOLD:


	TO REPLICATE AND EXPAND THE MPD’S SUCCESSFUL MULTIRACIAL POLICE ADVISORY GROUP PROJECT (E.G., “BRIDGE BUILDERS”) WHICH WAS FUNDED BY A COPS OFFICE CPD MICROGRANT IN 2016.  THAT PROJECT WAS SUPPORTED AND EVALUATED BY STAFF FROM THE UNIVERSITY OF WISCONSIN WITH A POST PROJECT ARTICLE PUBLISHED BY IACP IN POLICE CHIEF MAGAZINE (JULY 2019).  WHILE THE PROJECT OVERALL WAS VERY SUCCESSFUL IN ACHIEVING PROJECT GOALS, LOCAL RESOURCES AND DEPARTMENT STAFFING SIMPLY DID NOT EXIST FOR IT TO CONTINUE AT THE TIME.  IT WAS ALSO NOTED IN THE EVALUATION HOW THE POLICE ADVISORY GROUP PROJECT WAS LABOR INTENSIVE FOR MPD DISTRICT COMMAND STAFF AND “THAT FINDING A MORE EFFICIENT WAY TO DELEGATE OR SHARE ADMINISTRATE DUTIES MAY HAVE BEEN HELPFUL.”   WE BELIEVE THROUGH A JOINT COLLABORATION WITH MCPF, WE CAN NOT ONLY REPLICATE THE 2016 POLICE ADVISORY GROUP PROJECT, BUT ALSO EXPAND THE MULTIRACIAL POLICE ADVISORY GROUP MODEL TO ALL SIX MPD POLICE DISTRICTS THROUGH A NEW COPS CPD MICROGRANT.  WE WILL ALSO LOOK TO RENAME THESE GROUPS TO “COMMUNITY POLICING ADVISORY BOARDS” WHILE CONTINUING THE PAST EMPHASIS ON BUILDING POLICE COMMUNITY TRUST AND LEGITIMACY THROUGH BUILDING POLICE COMMUNITY RELATIONSHIPS.
	TO JOINTLY AND BETTER COORDINATE ALL MPD-MCPF COMMUNITY POLICING AND OUTREACH ACTIVITIES IN AT-RISK AND UNDERSERVED NEIGHBORHOODS THROUGHOUT MADISON.  MCPF WAS CREATED IN 2016 BY RETIRED MPD OFFICERS ALL OF WHOM HAD PREVIOUSLY WORKED IN COMMUNITY POLICING ASSIGNMENTS DURING THEIR MPD CAREERS.  OVER THE PAST SIX YEARS, MCPF HAS RAISED OVER $300,000 IN DONATIONS TO PROVIDE DIRECT AND INDIRECT SUPPORT TO MPD COMMUNITY POLICING ACTIVITIES. THROUGH THIS CPD MICROGRANT, WE WILL SEEK TO BETTER INTEGRATE EXISTING COMMUNITY POLICING EFFORTS WITH MCPF.  THE LONG-TERM INTENT BEING A STRONGER, MORE SUSTAINABLE DONOR FUNDED MCPF ORGANIZATION THAT WILL HELP MPD IMPLEMENT COMMUNITY POLICING ENGAGEMENT STRATEGIES AND PARTNERSHIPS THAT HELP GROW THE RELATIONSHIP BETWEEN POLICE AND THE COMMUNITY WE SERVE.

THE RAPID CITY POLICE DEPARTMENT (RCPD) WILL CREATE BEST PRACTICES FOR A SERVICE-MEMBER-TO-OFFICER HIRING PROCESS AND STRUCTURE TO IMPLEMENT IT WITH LITTLE TO NO EFFORT AND CAN BE FACILITATED WITH OR WITHOUT A FULL-TIME RECRUITER. WORKING WITH COPS, AT END OF THE GRANT PERIOD THERE CAN BE A CASE STUDY DEVELOPED TO SHOW PROGRAM STRUCTURE AND DESIGN TO SHOW HOW RELATIONSHIP DEVELOPMENT CAN BE CORRELATED TO MILITARY SKILLBRIDGE EFFORTS TO IMPROVE SERVICE-READY OFFICERS. THE OTHER AVENUE OF THE SKILLBRIDGE PROGRAM IS WORKING WITH OUR NATIVE AMERICAN COMMUNITY TO RECRUIT FAMILY MEMBERS TRANSITIONING FROM THE MILITARY TO COME BACK TO RAPID CITY AND CONTINUE TO SERVE. MANY AGENCIES DO NOT HAVE INTERNSHIPS OR POSITIONS THAT CAN HANDLE LOW-LEVEL CALLS FOR SERVICE. THE INTERNSHIP CREATION HAS A FEW POSSIBLE OUTCOMES WHICH CAN IMPACT LE AGENCIES.

THE LOS ANGELES POLICE DEPARTMENT, IN COLLABORATION WITH THE 77TH STREET VICE HUMAN TRAFFICKING UNIT, AND JOURNEY OUT, WILL DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT AN INNOVATIVE, COMPREHENSIVE AND RESULTS-DRIVEN APPROACH TO COMBAT HUMAN TRAFFICKING ON THE FIGUEROA TRACK UTILIZING AN INTELLIGENCE-BASED STRATEGY OF ENFORCEMENT.

THE CITY OF NEWARK, NEW JERSEY WILL PILOT A COMMUNITY TRUST ANT LEGITIMACY PROJECT THROUGH INTERVIEWS WITH THE COMMUNITY AND THE POLICE DEPARTMENT TO DEVELOP AN EVALUATION REPORT. THE PROJECT SEEKS TO UTILIZE EVALUATIVE REPORT TO PRODUCE TRAINING AND DEVELOP A RESILIENCY MODEL.

THE CHULA VISTA POLICE DEPARTMENT WILL EXPAND CURRENT TEEN ACADEMY AND A CITIZEN’S ACADEMY PROGRAMS; AS WELL AS CREATE A CONDENSED 1 OR 2 DAY COMMUNITY LEADER’S ACADEMY WHICH WILL FOCUS ON THE PRIMARY COMMUNITY CONCERNS WITH REGARDS TO LAW ENFORCEMENT OPERATIONS.

HUNTINGTON POLICE DEPARTMENT WILL IMPLEMENT A NEW OFFICER RECRUITMENT AND RETENTION PROJECT. THE MULTI-FACETED PROJECT WILL UPDATE RECRUITMENT MATERIALS TO ATTRACT A LARGER, MORE DIVERSE POOL OF APPLICANTS.

THE TORRANCE POLICE DEPARTMENT WILL BUILD COMMUNITY TRUST WITH A BODY WORN CAMERA ANALYTICS PROJECT. THE ANALYTICS WILL EVALUATE THE CAMERA VIDEO CONTENT CRITERION AND LEVERAGE FINDINGS TO PRODUCE DATA DRIVEN MEASUREMENTS OF OFFICER ENGAGEMENT, PROFESSIONALISM AND RISK WHILE STEERING CORRECTIVE TRAINING, WARRANTED COMMENDATION, AND BEST PRACTICES INFORMED POLICY.

THE GREEN BAY IS OFFERING AN ALTERNATIVE APPROACH CALLED THE POLICE2PEACE PROJECT, PROVIDING INNOVATIVE AND ORIGINAL TRAININGS ON “COPS AS PEACE OFFICERS” (THE PEACE OFFICER FRAMEWORK) AND HOW TO OPERATIONALIZE “THE PEACE OFFICER PROMISE” (A POLICING HIPPOCRATIC OATH; TO DO NO HARM WHILE CONTROLLING CRIME).

THE UNIVERSITY POLICE DEPARTMENT, NORTHERN COMMAND (UPDNC) PROJECT WILL IDENTIFY AND TRAIN PROMISING PRACTICES IN COMMUNITY POLICING, INCLUDING PRACTICES THAT HAVE THE POTENTIAL TO INCREASE PUBLIC TRUST AND CONFIDENCE IN THE POLICE.  FOR EXAMPLE, REFRAMING PUBLIC PERCEPTION OF COPS AS ""PEACE OFFICERS"".

THE DANVILLE POLICE DEPARTMENT (DPD) PROJECT FULFILLS THE NEED TO BUILD TRUST/LEGITIMACY WITH THE COMMUNITY AND ENHANCE DPD’S CURRENT EFFORTS OF TRANSPARENCY WITH ITS COMMUNITY BY EXAMINING AND UNDERSTANDING THE NUANCES OF HOW DPD WAS ABLE TO DECREASE CRIME AND IMPROVE COMMUNITY COLLABORATION/TRUST. DPD WILL WORK WITH DRS. ROBERTO AND RACHEL SANTOS (CENTER FOR POLICE PRACTICE, POLICY AND RESEARCH, RADFORD UNIVERSITY IN RADFORD, VA), TO CONDUCT A COMPREHENSIVE CASE STUDY TO UNDERSTAND THE EFFECTS OF DPD’S EFFORTS ON ITS RELATIONSHIP WITH THE COMMUNITY AND CITY OFFICIALS, ITS ORGANIZATIONAL CULTURE, AND CRIME AND DISORDER. USING A MIXED-METHODS APPROACH FOR DATA COLLECTION FROM A WIDE ARRAY OF INDIVIDUALS AND GROUPS WITHIN THE COMMUNITY, LOCAL GOVERNMENT OFFICIALS, CRIMINAL JUSTICE PARTNERS, DPD PERSONNEL AT ALL RANKS, AND OFFICIAL CRIME DATA, THE PROJECT SEEKS TO DISSECT AND UNDERSTAND HOW DPD WAS SUCCESSFUL AND IDENTIFY WAYS THAT DPD CAN REFINE, ADJUST, AND IMPROVE ITS PRACTICES TO BETTER INSTITUTIONALIZE ITS PROACTIVE COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT AND CRIME REDUCTION EFFORTS. FOR THE BROADER LAW ENFORCEMENT COMMUNITY, THE CASE STUDY RESULTS WILL OFFER SPECIFIC COMMUNITY-BASED AND CRIME REDUCTION EXAMPLES BASED ON DPD EXPERIENCES AS WELL AS CONSIDERATIONS, LESSONS LEARNED, AND RECOMMENDATIONS FOR IMPLEMENTATION AND SUSTAINABILITY. THE GOAL IS TO PROVIDE GUIDANCE FOR OTHER AGENCIES AND THEIR COMMUNITIES ON IMPLEMENTING AN ORGANIZATIONAL MODEL THAT BRINGS TOGETHER PROACTIVE COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT AND EVIDENCE-BASED CRIME REDUCTION. THE AUDIENCE WHO WILL FIND THE CASE STUDY MOST HELPFUL ARE POLICE LEADERS, CITY MANAGERS, MAYORS, AND COMMUNITIES WHO ARE STRUGGLING TO SYSTEMATICALLY IMPLEMENT PROACTIVE CRIME REDUCTION, WHILE AT THE SAME TIME, ARE FACING HIGH LEVELS OF CRIME AND TRYING TO BUILD RELATIONSHIPS WITH THEIR COMMUNITIES WHERE THERE IS A LACK OF TRUST.

THE RUTGERS UNIVERSITY POLICE DEPARTMENT (RUPD) WILL USE FUNDS FROM THE COPS MICROGRANTS PROJECT  TO DEVELOP AND IMPLEMENT THE RUPD RECRUITMENT AND RETENTION PROGRAM WHICH WILL BE IN EFFECT FOR TWO HIRING CYCLES OVER THE 12 MONTH GRANT PERIOD.  THIS PROJECT HAS SIX MAIN OBJECTIVES. THE FIRST IS TO RECRUIT AND ATTRACT QUALIFIED APPLICANTS FOR THE POSITION OF POLICE OFFICER, WITH A SPECIFIC FOCUS ON WOMEN AND MINORITY APPLICANTS. THIS WILL BE ACCOMPLISHED THROUGH THE USE OF RECRUITMENT VIDEOS, ADVERTISING AND SOCIAL MEDIA CAMPAIGNS.  THE NEXT GOAL IS TO PROVIDE POTENTIAL APPLICANTS, JOB SEEKERS AND INTERESTED CITIZENS WITH AN OPPORTUNITY TO INTERACT WITH AND LEARN ABOUT VARIOUS TYPES OF LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCIES DURING RECRUITING EVENTS IN AN EFFORT TO ENSURE THAT APPLICANTS SELECT THE TYPE OF LAW ENFORCEMENT THAT IS MOST SUITED TO THEM.  THIS PROGRAM WILL FURTHER ACCOMPLISH THIS GOAL BY EXPOSING APPLICANTS TO THE REALITIES OF THE JOB BY OFFERING RIDE ALONG OPPORTUNITIES WITH ACTIVE POLICE OFFICERS THAT WILL GIVE REAL-WORLD AND FIRST-HAND EXPOSURE TO THE JOB AND PROVIDE POTENTIAL APPLICANTS WITH THE OPPORTUNITY TO EXPERIENCE POLICING BEFORE PROCEEDING IN THE APPLICATION PROCESS.  BY SHARING THIS REAL-WORLD EXPERIENCE WITH POTENTIAL APPLICANTS, POLICE DEPARTMENTS CAN SAVE THEMSELVES THE HEAVY FINANCIAL AND EMOTIONAL BURDEN OF OFFICER RESIGNATIONS, BURNOUT AND LOW MORALE.  THE FIFTH GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO INCREASE SUCCESS ON PHYSICAL ASSESSMENTS, SPECIALLY BY WOMEN, BY OFFERING PHYSICAL TRAINING PREPARATION SESSIONS THAT DEMONSTRATE THE EXERCISES AND PROVIDES THE OPPORTUNITY TO PRACTICE THE REQUIRED PHYSICAL EXERCISES. ADDITIONALLY, THIS PROGRAM WILL PREPARE APPLICANTS FOR THE HIRING PROCESS DURING PREPARATION SESSIONS THAT WILL PROVIDE DETAILS ABOUT WHAT TO EXPECT, WILL FOCUS IN INTERVIEWING TECHNIQUES AND OFFER GUIDANCE ON HOW TO BE SUCCESSFUL IN THE PROCESS.  THE FINAL GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO INCREASE RETENTION OF OFFICERS BY CREATING A STRONG CONNECTION BETWEEN THE OFFICERS AND DEPARTMENT, EVEN BEFORE THEY ARE HIRED.

THE YAVAPAI COUNTY COMMUNITY COLLEGE WILL PROVIDE INNOVATIVE AND ORIGINAL TRAININGS ON "COPS AS PEACE OFFICERS" (THE PEACE OFFICER FRAMEWORK) AND HOW TO OPERATIONALIZE "THE PEACE OFFICER PROMISE" (A POLICING HIPPOCRATIC OATH; TO DO NO HARM WHILE CONTROLLING CRIME).    THOUGH TRAINING AND EDUCATION, THE GOAL OF THIS PROJECT WILL BE TO BUILD CAPACITY AND PROMOTE MEANINGFUL ORGANIZATIONAL CHANGE BY LOCAL LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCIES. THE APPLICANT WILL CONTRACT WITH POLICE2PEACE, A NATIONAL NONPROFIT WHICH IS ADVANCING THE FRAMEWORK OF POLICE AS “PEACE OFFICERS.”  POLICE2PEACE HAS DEVELOPED INNOVATIVE TRAINING CURRICULA, WHICH WILL BE CUSTOMIZED FOR THE LOCAL COMMUNITY.  THE TRAINING ADDRESSES EFFECTIVE PRACTICES AND OUTCOMES FOR ORGANIZATIONAL CHANGE WHICH SUPPORT COMMUNITY POLICING. ONCE CUSTOMIZED, THE TRAINING CURRICULUM WILL BE DELIVERED IN A 1-DAY TRAINING FOR LOCAL POLICE PERSONNEL, HALF DAY “TRAIN THE TRAINER” TRAINING OF LOCAL POLICE PERSONNEL, AND HALF DAY TRAINING OF ELECTED OFFICIALS AND COMMUNITY MEMBERS.  TRAINING WILL BE HELD AT YAVAPAI COLLEGE IN PRESCOTT.  OTHER ACTIVITIES INCLUDE MARKETING, ONLINE SURVEYS, VIRTUAL LISTENING SESSIONS WITH YOUTH, AND ANALYSIS OF QUANTITATIVE AND QUALITATIVE DATA.  PERFORMANCE WILL BE MEASURED BY COMPARING DATA ABOUT PUBLIC PERCEPTIONS OF POLICE FROM BEFORE AND AFTER THE TRAINING.

THE GREENVILLE POLICE DEPARTMENT 'POLICE OFFICER CANDIDATE PROGRAM' IS A RECRUITMENT PROJECT TOOL THE AGENCY WILL USE AS AN EMPLOYMENT AND TUITION ASSISTANCE PROGRAM FOR COLLEGE JUNIORS AND SENIORS WHO PLAN TO SEEK FULL-TIME EMPLOYMENT AS LAW ENFORCEMENT OFFICERS.

THE TENNESSEE BUREAU OF INVESTIGATION (TBI), THE PRIMARY STATE INVESTIGATIVE AGENCY, WILL PLAN AND DELIVER THE “TBI DIVERSITY TARGETED OUTREACH INITIATIVE” OFFICER HIRING AND RECRUITMENT PROJECT. THE PROPOSED INITIATIVE WILL UTILIZE STATEWIDE SURVEY INFORMATION AND DATA ANALYSIS TO OPTIMIZE TARGETED RECRUITMENT.

THE FRANKFORT POLICE DEPARTMENT WILL PARTNER WITH 'YES ARTS AND BLAMELESS CHILDREN' TO DEVELOP PROGRAMMING AIMED AT HELPING DRUG ADDICTS OVERCOME SUBSTANCE ABUSE. THE PROGRAM WILL FOCUS ON SMALL GROUPS TO RECEIVE TARGETED SUPPORT SERVICES DURING RECOVERY AND SEEKS TO BUILD TRUST WITH INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES WHO REPEATEDLY INTERACT WITH THE CRIMINAL JUSTICE SYSTEM FACING DRUG-RELATED CHARGES.

THE RICHMOND POLICE DEPARTMENT (RPD) IS FOCUSED ON BUILDING A DIVERSE AGENCY, WITH EQUITABLE ACCESS TO OPPORTUNITIES, AND AN INCLUSIVE CULTURE. RPD AIMS TO BRIDGE ITS CURRENT DIVERSITY, EQUITY, AND INCLUSION (DEI) GAPS BY EXPANDING ITS ABILITY TO RECRUIT AND RETAIN A DIVERSE WORKFORCE AND TO BUILD TRUST AND CONFIDENCE WITH THE PUBLIC, AS WELL AS WITHIN THE AGENCY. RICHMOND POLICE DEPARTMENT IS WELL-POSITIONED TO MORE STRATEGICALLY LEVERAGE DEI TO ACCELERATE ITS MISSION OF PROVIDING THE BEST PUBLIC SAFETY SERVICES TO ENHANCE THE SAFETY AND SECURITY IN THE CITY OF RICHMOND, VIRGINIA. AS A FIRST STEP TO DRIVING A CULTURE OF DIVERSITY, EQUITY, AND INCLUSION, RPD MUST UNDERSTAND THE CURRENT STATE OF DEI AT THE DEPARTMENT. TO UNDERSTAND THE CURRENT STATE AND PROVIDE RECOMMENDATIONS TO IMPROVE DIVERSITY, EQUITY, AND INCLUSION, RPD IS SEEKING GRANT FUNDING TO HIRE A DEI COORDINATOR/CONSULTANT. THE DEI COORDINATOR WILL ANALYZE RPD’S CURRENT OFFICER RECRUITMENT AND RETENTION EFFORTS AND DEVELOPMENT AN OVERALL PLAN OF ACTION.

THE LACK OF TRUST IN THE POLICE IS NOT LIMITED TO ADULTS. ON THE CONTRARY, YOUTH – PARTICULARLY YOUTH OF COLOR – FREQUENTLY DISTRUST LAW ENFORCEMENT. THIS PRESENTS A SIGNIFICANT BARRIER TO SUCCESSFUL PROGRAMMING TO ADDRESS COMMUNITY AND YOUTH VIOLENCE. WHILE OUR UNDERSTANDING OF PUBLIC SENTIMENT TOWARD THE POLICE IS ALREADY EXTREMELY LIMITED FOR ADULTS, WE KNOW EVEN LESS ABOUT TRUST AND LEGITIMACY TOWARD LAW ENFORCEMENT FROM THE PERSPECTIVE OF YOUTH. THE PROPOSED PROJECT WILL HELP CLOSE THIS GAP. THE CITY OF ALTON POLICE DEPARTMENT WILL REVISE AND ADAPT THE POLICE-COMMUNITY INTERACTION (PCI) SURVEY FOR USE WITH YOUTH. THE REVISED SURVEY WILL BE ADMINISTERED TO A) OVER 4,000 STUDENTS ENROLLED IN THE ALTON COMMUNITY UNIT SCHOOL DISTRICT.  INFORMED BY SURVEY FINDINGS, OUR COLLABORATION WILL FACILITATE CONVERSATIONS BETWEEN LAW ENFORCEMENT, COMMUNITY LEADERS, AND YOUTH – BOTH AS VICTIMS AND PERPETRATORS OF VIOLENCE – ABOUT COMMUNITY POLICING AND RESTORATIVE JUSTICE. THESE CONVERSATIONS WILL ALLOW THE POLICE TO DEVELOP OPEN COMMUNICATION, TRANSPARENCY, ACCOUNTABILITY, AND MUTUAL TRUST WITH COMMUNITY GROUPS WHO OFTEN DISTRUST LAW ENFORCEMENT. TOGETHER, THE THREE STAKEHOLDER GROUPS WILL IDENTIFY AND PRIORITIZE COMMUNITY PROBLEMS AND SELECT AN EVIDENCE-BASED YOUTH VIOLENCE PROGRAM THAT MEETS THE NEEDS OF THE COMMUNITY BY THE END OF THE FUNDING PERIOD.

THE SOUTH SALT LAKE POLICE DEPARTMENT AND THE HOMELESS SHELTER LOCATED IN THE CITY WILL IMPLEMENT THE  CRITICAL TIME INTERVENTION MODEL. THE PROJECT WILL IMPROVE RECOVERY SUPPORT SERVICES AND REMOVE BARRIERS TO THE INDIVIDUAL’S RECOVERY. BY PROVIDING RECOVERY SUPPORT SERVICES, THE AGENCY WILL REMOVE BARRIERS IN HOMELESS INDIVIDUALS WITH ACQUIRING WORK OR A HOME.

THE MISSOURI CITY POLICE DEPARTMENT (MCPD) BUILDING TRUST AND LEGITIMACY PROJECT WILL COLLABORATE WITH THE FORT BEND INDEPENDENT SCHOOL DISTRICT (FBISD) POLICE DEPARTMENT TO HOST CPR AND FIRST AID COURSES AVAILABLE TO HIGH SCHOOL STUDENTS WHO ATTEND ANY FBISD HIGH SCHOOL. THE GOAL IS FOR THE STUDENTS TO PARTNER WITH AN OFFICER FROM EITHER AGENCY AND TAKE THE COURSE TOGETHER.

FUNDING UNDER THIS AWARD PROGRAM WILL BE USED BY THE SCHOOL JURISDICTION TO IMPLEMENT EVIDENCE-BASED PROGRAMS TO IMPROVE SCHOOL SECURITY AND PROMOTE A POSITIVE LEARNING ENVIRONMENT FOR ALL STUDENTS.
