THROUGH THIS INITIATIVE, THE DICKENSON COUNTY SHERIFF’S OFFICE WILL BECOME AN ACCREDITED LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCY THROUGH THE VIRGINIA LAW ENFORCEMENT PROFESSIONAL STANDARDS COMMISSION (VLEPSC).  BECOMING AN ACCREDITED AGENCY NOT ONLY WILL ASSIST IN MEETING THE NEEDS OF PUBLIC SAFETY BUT WILL ALSO BUILD TRUST WITHIN THE COMMUNITY, BRIDGING THE GAP THAT HAS BEEN CREATED THROUGH POVERTY AND DRUG ACTIVITY.

THE FAYETTEVILLE POLICE DEPARTMENT LEMHWA IMPLEMENTATION PROJECT SUPPORTS IF FUNDED, THE FPD WOULD EXPAND THEIR EFFORTS TO LEAD THE REGION AS AN EXAMPLE OF COMPASSIONATE CARE FOR LAW ENFORCEMENT IN NORTHWEST ARKANSAS. GRANT IS FOR PEER SUPPORT PROGRAM ENHANCEMENTS.

THE SAN FERNANDO POLICE DEPARTMENT LEMHWA IMPLEMENTATION PROJECT SUPPORTS  TRAINING FOR LEADERSHIP AND SUPERVISORS ALLOWING THEM TO MODEL THE WAY, SUPPORTIVE SERVICES AND SEMINARS FOR PERSONNEL AND THEIR FAMILIES, DEVELOPMENT OF A PEER SUPPORT TEAM THAT HAS NOT PREVIOUSLY EXISTED AT SFPD, AND THE AVAILABILITY OF A CRISIS RESPONSE TEAM TO IMMEDIATELY ADDRESS EMPLOYEE WELLNESS WHEN CRITICAL INCIDENTS OCCUR. THIS PROJECT PROVIDES SERVICES FOR FULL TIME SWORN PERSONNEL, RESERVE SWORN PERSONNEL, AND ALL PROFESSIONAL STAFF.

THE ANAHEIM POLICE DEPARTMENT LEMHWA IMPLEMENTATION PROJECT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING TO SUPPORT A ONSITE MENTAL HEALTH CLINICIAN AND TO BE ABLE TO PROVIDE ADDITIONAL TRAINING FOR MEMBERS OF THE APD PEER SUPPORT TEAM. BY BEING ABLE TO OFFER AN ONSITE CLINICIAN AND PROVIDE ADDITIONAL TRAINING TO OUR PEER SUPPORT TEAM, THE DEPARTMENT WILL HAVE STAFF THAT ARE MENTALLY HEALTHY AND WILLING TO SEEK OUT MENTAL HEALTH CARE BEFORE IT BECOMES AN ISSUE.

THE SALT LAKE COUNTY SHERIFFS LEMHWA IMPLEMENTATION PROJECT SUPPORTS TRAINING FOR 41 MEMBER PEER SUPPORT TEAM, NEW EMPLOYEES, FAMILIES OF SLCOSO EMPLOYEES, AND
A STATEWIDE PEER SUPPORT COALITION. FUNDS WILL ALSO BE USED TO EMPLOY A PART-TIME WELLNESS COORDINATOR TO SPEARHEAD THE PROGRAM AND PERFORM THE PROGRAM’S ADMINISTRATIVE TASKS.

THE DOUGLAS COUNTY SHERIFFS OFFICE LEMHWA IMPLEMENTATION PROJECT WILL PROVIDE RESOURCES FOR THE  NEWLY CREATED PEER SUPPORT TEAM TO COMPLETE TRAINING AT A STATE EVENT TO PROVIDE SUPPORT DURING CRITICAL INCIDENTS. THE PROJECT WILL ALSO SUPPORT T THE PEER SUPPORT TEAM IN A VARIETY OF WAYS. FIRST FROM A TRAINING ASPECT, THIS GRANT WILL ALLOW US TO HAVE THE EQUIPMENT, AND SUPPLIES NEED FOR THIS TEAM. IT ALSO WILL BE A TREMENDOUS HELP FROM A BUDGETARY STANDPOINT, IN THAT THIS GRANT HELPS WITH PER-DIEM RATES FOR BOTH LOGGING AND TRAVEL EXPENSES. THIS GRANT WILL ALSO HELP WITH THE PURCHASE OF COMPUTERS AND SOFTWARE THAT WILL ALLOW EACH OF THE TEAM MEMBERS TO HAVE A COMPUTER THAT IS NOT ATTACHED TO THE SHERIFF’S OFFICE THUS PROTECTING INTEGRITY.

OVERLAND PARK POLICE DEPARTMENT LEMHWA IMPLEMENTATION PROJECT SUPPORTS  THE EXPANSION OF ITS EXISTING PEER SUPPORT PROGRAM BY OFFERING THE FOLLOWING SERVICES:  1) CONFIDENTIAL WELL-CHECKS AND MENTAL HEALTH VISITS; 2) ADD A LICENSED DIETITIAN TO PROVIDE SEMI-ANNUAL DIET/NUTRITION CONSULTATIONS; 3) TRAINING/SEMINARS TO EDUCATE FIRST RESPONDERS IN DEALING WITH PTSD AND SUICIDE.   LASTLY, OVERLAND PARK POLICE DEPARTMENT WILL CONTRACT WITH HORSE AND HEROES, A LICENSED EQUINE THERAPY PROVIDER, TO PROVIDE GROUP AND/OR INDIVIDUAL SERVICES FOR PEER SUPPORT MEMBERS AND OTHER DEPARTMENT MEMBERS WHEN NEEDED.

THE CITY OF PARKERSBURG POLICE DEPARTMENT LEMHWA IMPLEMENTATION PROJECT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING TO OBTAIN THE SERVICES OF A LICENSED PSYCHOLOGICAL PROFESSIONAL TO IMPROVE THE DELIVERY OF AND ACCESS TO MENTAL HEALTH AND WELLNESS SERVICES FOR THE REGIONS LAW ENFORCEMENT OFFICERS THROUGH THE IMPLEMENTATION OF PEER SUPPORT, TRAINING, FAMILY RESOURCES, SUICIDE PREVENTION, AND OTHER APPROPRIATE WELLNESS PROGRAMS. THESE SERVICES  WILL BE MADE AVAILABLE TO ALL SURROUNDING AGENCIES IN WOOD COUNTY, INCLUDING THE WOOD COUNTY SHERIFFS, OFFICE, THE VIENNA POLICE DEPARTMENT AND THE WILLIAMSTOWN POLICE DEPARTMENT. THE  FUNDS WILL ALSO BE APPLIED TO OBTAINING NECESSARY MENTAL HEALTH TREATMENT THAT COULD FURTHER THE CURRENT SYSTEM PUT IN PLACE BY THE CITY OF PARKERSBURG.

THE BATON ROUGE POLICE DEPARTMENT (BRPD) LEMHWA IMPLEMENTATION PROJECT SUPPORTS EXPANSION OF THE AGENCY’S OFFICER WELLNESS PROGRAM WITH THE GOAL OF BUILDING RESILIENCY. THE BRPD WILL IMPLEMENT PEER SUPPORT, SUICIDE PREVENTION, AND RESILIENCY TRAINING AND EXPAND THE PROGRAM TO PROVIDE MORE SERVICES FOCUSED ON WELLNESS AND WHOLE HEALTH FOR EMPLOYEES AND THEIR FAMILIES.  THE SUICIDE PREVENTION AND CISM TRAININGS WILL HAVE A “TRAIN THE TRAINER” COMPONENT SO THAT THOSE WHO BECOME CERTIFIED CAN SHARE KNOWLEDGE AND TRAIN OTHER EMPLOYEES AND MEMBERS OF SURROUNDING DEPARTMENTS AND OTHER COMPONENTS OF THE CRIMINAL JUSTICE SYSTEM.

THE PROJECT WILL FUND A CHAPLAIN POSITION WITH THE DEPARTMENT ON A PART TIME BASES. THE CHAPLAIN WILL BE IN PERSON AND AVAILABLE AT THE DEPARTMENT FOR 5 HOURS PER WEEK. THE GOALS OF THE PROGRAM IS TO MAKE A CHAPLAIN MORE ACCESSIBLE TO AGENCY EMPLOYEES FOR PEER SUPPORT THROUGH OFFICE HOURS AND RIDE-ALONG, ASSIST WITH TRAINING OF OUR CURRENT PEER SUPPORT TEAM, ASSIST WITH DEATH NOTIFICATIONS, DEATH INVESTIGATIONS, CRITICAL INCIDENTS AS NEEDED TO TAKE THE BURDEN AND STRESS OFF OFFICERS WHEN PROVIDING SUPPORT TO FAMILIES.

THE JUNEAU POLICE DEPARTMENT LEMHWA IMPLEMENTATION PROJECT WILL FUND COUNSELING SERVICES, THROUGH MULTIPLE AVAILABLE COUNSELORS, TO THE STAFF OF THE AGENCY.  THE PROJECT WILL ALSO FUND A SERIES OF TRAININGS AND EVENTS.  COUNSELING SERVICES WILL BE OFFERED TO EMPLOYEES TO ENCOURAGE THEM TO SEEK HELP WHEN THEY NEED IT; THIS RESOURCE WILL BE AVAILABLE FOR EMPLOYEES STRUGGLING WITH ANY CHALLENGES THEY ARE CONFRONTING.  PEER SUPPORT TRAINING WILL BE OFFERED IN-HOUSE TO EMPLOYEES FROM VARIOUS UNITS WITHIN THE DEPARTMENT FOR TRAIN THEM TO RECOGNIZE WARNING SIGNS AND OFFER THEIR COWORKERS ASSISTANCE WITH REGARDS TO THEIR PHYSICAL, EMOTIONAL, AND MENTAL HEALTH.  SEVERAL SHORT WELLNESS TRAINING EVENTS WILL BE HELD ON TOPICS TO ROUND OUT EMPLOYEE WELLNESS INSIDE AND OUTSIDE OF THE WORK PLACE; THE TOPICS ARE STILL TO BE DETERMINED AND MAY INCLUDE SUBJECTS SUCH AS FINANCIAL HEALTH, PERSONAL RELATIONSHIPS, PHYSICAL HEALTH, MENTAL HEALTH, AND EMOTIONAL HEALTH.

THE EASTHAMPTON POLICE DEPARTMENT LEMHWA IMPLEMENTATION PROJECT FUNDING WILL SUPPORT THE HIRING OF A CLINICIAN TO SUPPORT THE DEPARTMENTS MENTAL HEALTH AND WELLNESS INITIATIVES. THE MAIN OBJECTIVE OF THE CLINICIAN WILL BE TO ADDRESS THE ONGOING MENTAL HEALTH NEEDS OF INDIVIDUALS WITHIN THE POLICE DEPARTMENT, RECOGNIZING THAT POLICE OFFICERS EXPERIENCE VICARIOUS TRAUMA WHICH, IF LEFT UNADDRESSED, HAS THE POTENTIAL TO NEGATIVELY IMPACT THEIR OWN MENTAL HEALTH AS WELL AS THE MENTAL HEALTH OF THEIR FAMILIES.  A SECONDARY OBJECTIVE INVOLVES PROVIDING SUPPORT ON AN AS-NEEDED BASIS TO CITY EMPLOYEES WHO HAVE BEEN EXPOSED TO A TRAUMATIC EVENT OR WHO ARE STRUGGLING WITH THEIR MENTAL HEALTH AS A RESULT OF CUMULATIVE STRESS. A DEDICATED CLINICIAN, EMBEDDED WITHIN THE POLICE DEPARTMENT AND FAMILIAR WITH THE SPECIFIC NEEDS OF POLICE OFFICERS AND CITY EMPLOYEES, WILL BE ABLE TO RESPOND TO MENTAL HEALTH DISTRESS IN WAYS THAT ARE CULTURALLY SENSITIVE AND RESPECTFUL OF THE CHALLENGES THAT COME FROM DIRECTLY SERVING THE COMMUNITY.

THE NEW JERSEY DEPARTMENT OF LAW AND PUBLIC SAFETY LEMHWA IMPLEMENTATION PROJECT SUPPORTS EXPANSION OF SEVERAL SUICIDE PREVENTION EFFORTS BY SUPPORT THE COSTS AND OFFICER OVERTIME FOR 2 OFFICERS GET CERTIFIED AND THEN PROVIDE 16 QUESTION, PERSUADE, REFER (QPR) TRAININGS AND DELIVER EIGHT SESSIONS OF TWO-DAY APPLIED SUICIDE INTERVENTION SKILLS TRAINING (ASIST) ON A REGIONALIZED BASIS AROUND THE STATE. IT ALSO INCLUDES PURCHASE COPIES OF THE BOOK “EMOTIONAL SURVIVAL FOR LAW ENFORCEMENT TO DISTRIBUTE AT SUICIDE PREVENTION TRAINING BLOCKS PRESENTED BY THE PAU AND EAP WHICH WOULD INCLUDE NEWLY PROMOTED NJSP SERGEANTS, SERGEANTS FIRST CLASS, AND LIEUTENANTS AS WELL AS RECRUITS ENROLLED IN THE NJSP ACADEMY. PARTNER WITH THE RUTGERS UNIVERSITY CENTER ON POLICING TO COLLECT AND ANALYZE DATA TO DETERMINE THE EFFICACY AND UTILITY OF THE TRAINING PROGRAMS ON SUICIDE AWARENESS, SUICIDE PREVENTION, AND APPLICATION IN OTHER AREAS OF COMMUNITY INTERACTION.

THE BOSTON POLICE DEPARTMENT LEMHWA IMPLEMENTATION PROJECT SPECIFICALLY AIMS TO PROVIDE PEER SUPPORT TO 911 CALL-TAKERS/DISPATCHERS AND FORENSICS ANALYSTS BY 1) STRENGTHENING THE PEER SUPPORT GROUP FOR CIVILIAN BPD EMPLOYEES; 2) TEACHING 911 CALL-TAKERS/DISPATCHERS AND FORENSICS ANALYSTS ABOUT VICARIOUS TRAUMA, RECOGNIZING THE SIGNS OF DEPRESSION, THE IMPORTANCE OF SELF-CARE, AND OTHER IMPORTANT TOPICS RELATED TO WELLNESS; AND 3) PROVIDING 911 CALL-TAKERS/DISPATCHERS WITH A PLACE WHERE THEY CAN STEP AWAY FROM HIGH-STRESS WORK ENVIRONMENT TO DECOMPRESS. THE PROJECT WILL ALSO SUPPORT SWORN OFFICERS BY 4) PROVIDING MUCH-NEEDED SUPPLIES FOR THE PEER SUPPORT UNIT (PSU) AND 5) MAKING THE ABOVE TRAININGS AVAILABLE TO SWORN OFFICERS AS WELL. BY TAKING THESE STEPS, THE PROJECT WILL ALSO EFFECTIVELY REDUCE THE WORKLOAD OF PSU SO THAT IT CAN FOCUS SOLELY ON SWORN OFFICERS AND THEIR FAMILIES. THE PROJECT WILL FURTHER ASSIST THE PSU BY ENHANCING ITS ABILITY TO WORK REMOTELY WITH SWORN OFFICERS, IMPROVING THE ROOMS IN WHICH SWORN PERSONNEL AND THEIR FAMILIES RECEIVE IN-PERSON SERVICES, AND TRAINING MORE BPD SWORN OFFICERS ON VARIOUS TOPICS RELATED TO WELLNESS.

THE CHICAGO POLICE DEPARTMENT LEMHWA IMPLEMENTATION PROJECT SUPPORTS D PROFESSIONAL COUNSELING DIVISION (PCD) PROPOSES FUNDING FOR CONTRACTUAL PSYCHIATRIC CARE AND COUNSELING SERVICES WILL BE MADE AVAILABLE TO THE DEPARTMENT’S 13,640 SWORN AND CIVILIAN WORKFORCE. THIS PROGRAM WILL ADDRESS A DOCUMENTED NEED THAT HAS RESULTED FROM VARIOUS FACTORS THAT INCLUDE LIMITATIONS TO INSURANCE COVERAGE, SCHEDULING AND PREFERENCE, AND FINANCIAL PRESSURE. THE DIVISION WILL ACTIVELY CONDUCT OUTREACH TO INCREASE AWARENESS OF THESE PROGRAMS THROUGH EXISTING MECHANISMS SUCH AS BROCHURES AND PEER SUPPORT CONTACTS. IN ADDITION TO PROVIDING CRITICAL AND MUCH NEEDED INTERVENTION, THIS INITIATIVE WILL ALSO ASSIST TO CREATE A TAILORED WELLNESS PLAN FOR MEMBERS THAT PARTICIPATE IN THE PROGRAM.

THE MADISON POLICE DEPARTMENT LEMHWA IMPLEMENTATION PROJECT SUPPORTS THIS PROJECT IS TO EXPAND THEIR PEER SUPPORT PROGRAM TO ENCOMPASS OVERALL MENTAL HEALTH WELLNESS COORDINATION TO IMPROVE THE DELIVERY OF AND ACCESS TO MENTAL HEALTH AND WELLNESS SERVICES FOR EMPLOYEES THROUGH EXPANDING PEER SUPPORT, TRAINING, FAMILY RESOURCES, SUICIDE PREVENTION, AND OTHER PROMISING PRACTICES FOR WELLNESS PROGRAMS, BY ADDING A PART-TIME (.33 FTE) LICENSED, WELLNESS COORDINATOR. IT WOULD ALSO PROVIDE TRAVEL FOR THEIR FIVE PEER SUPPORT MEMBERS TO ATTEND THE C.O.P.S. NATIONAL CONFERENCE ON LAW ENFORCEMENT WELLNESS AND TRAUMA.

THE CHARLOTTE-MECKLENBURG POLICE DEPARTMENT LEMHWA IMPLEMENTATION PROJECT FUNDING WILL SUPPORT ONE FULL-TIME EMPLOYEE WELLNESS SPECIALIST POSITION. THIS POSITION WILL INCLUDE ASSISTING IN THE COORDINATION AND COMMUNICATION OF INFORMATIONAL UPDATES REGARDING THE CMPD’S EMPLOYEE WELLNESS DIVISION, PROVIDING ADMINISTRATIVE OVERSIGHT AND COORDINATION OF RESOURCES FOR THE DEPARTMENT’S VARIOUS WELLNESS INITIATIVES AND PROGRAMS, ASSISTING WITH THE EDUCATION, COORDINATION, IDENTIFICATION, AND DEVELOPMENT OF MENTAL HEALTH SUPPORT SERVICES, AND PROVIDING ADDITIONAL ADMINISTRATIVE SUPPORT TO THE CMPD’S EMPLOYEE WELLNESS DIRECTOR AND SPIRITUAL WELLNESS SUPERVISOR AS NEEDED.

FREDERICKSBURG (VA) POLICE DEPARTMENT LEMHWA IMPLEMENTATION PROJECT SUPPORTS WILL PROVIDE TRAINING CLASSES RELATED TO MENTAL AND PHYSICAL WELLNESS AND RAISING AWARENESS. AN ADVANCED LEVEL OF MENTAL HEALTH TRAINING AND COUNSELING WILL BE PROVIDED BY LICENSED PROFESSIONALS, INCLUDING ACCESS TO TECHNIQUES TO DEAL WITH TRAUMA. LAW ENFORCEMENT PROFESSIONAL'S FAMILY MAY ALSO RECEIVE SUPPORT. SERVICES WILL BE OFFERED TO 42 AGENCIES IN 16 COUNTIES, 14 TOWNS AND 1 CITY COMPRISING OVER 2,200 PERSONNEL INCLUDING LAW ENFORCEMENT, JAIL, COURT SECURITY, CIVIL PROCESS AND EMERGENCY COMMUNICATIONS STAFF PROVIDING SERVICE TO OVER 500,000 VIRGINIA RESIDENTS.

THE LAWRENCE POLICE DEPARTMENT LEMHWA IMPLEMENTATION PROJECT SUPPORTS THIS PROJECT WOULD FUND A FULL-TIME WELLNESS PROGRAM COORDINATOR IMPROVING ACCESS TO MENTAL HEALTH AND WELLNESS SERVICES AND INCREASING AWARENESS AND EMPLOYEE ASSISTANCE SERVICES.

THE SHEBOYGAN FALLS POLICE DEPARTMENT LEMHWA IMPLEMENTATION PROJECT SUPPORTS THIS PROGRAM WILL UTILIZE THERAPISTS AND PSYCHOLOGISTS FROM THE FIRST RESPONDERS PSYCHOLOGICAL SERVICES, L.L.C. OF DOUSMAN, WISCONSIN, TRAINED EXPLICITLY TO TREAT LAW ENFORCEMENT OFFICERS AND FIRST RESPONDERS.  ONCE IMPLEMENTED, THE PROGRAM WILL PROVIDE A PSYCHOLOGICAL ASSESSMENT FOR ONE HOUR, MANDATED FOR EVERY OFFICER, INCLUDING COMMAND STAFF, IN 2022.  THE PROGRAM WOULD REQUIRE EVERY OFFICER, INCLUDING COMMAND STAFF, TO HAVE A ONE-HOUR THERAPY CHECKUP SESSION IN 2023 AND 2024.   FURTHER, THE PROGRAM WOULD PROVIDE A MINIMUM OF ONE ADDITIONAL PSYCHOLOGICAL VISIT FOR EVERY OFFICER AS NEEDED EACH YEAR. THE PROGRAM WILL PROVIDE FOUR HOURS OF TRAINING SPLIT OVER THE TWO YEARS FOR TRAINING WHICH WOULD INCLUDE THE PSYCHOLOGISTS PRESENTING TO EVERYONE DURING THE ANNUAL DEPARTMENT IN-SERVICE HELD IN THE FIRST QUARTER OF THE YEAR.  FINALLY, THE PROGRAM WILL PROVIDE TWO INCIDENT GROUP CRITICAL INCIDENT DEBRIEF SESSIONS AS NEEDED IN 2023 AND 2024.

THE OHIO ATTORNEY GENERAL’S OFFICE BUREAU OF CRIMINAL INVESTIGATION (BCI)WILL IMPLEMENT A RESILIENCE RESOURCES AND WELLNESS PROGRAM. THE IMPLEMENTATION OF A RESILIENCE PROGRAM FOR THE 190 SWORN AND CIVILIAN STAFF MEMBERS WHO DEAL WITH CRITICAL INCIDENTS. THE FIRST TRAINING WILL BE FOR THE 90 MEMBERS OF SWORN AND CIVILIAN LEADERSHIP, MANAGEMENT, AND EXECUTIVE STAFF. THE SECOND TRAINING SESSION WILL BE FOR THE OTHER 100 BCI SWORN AND CIVILIAN STAFF MEMBERS WHO DEAL WITH CRITICAL INCIDENTS. IN ADDITION TO THESE TWO TRAINING SESSIONS, BCI WILL HOST THREE “FAMILY DAYS FOR EDUCATION” WORKSHOPS TO EDUCATE SWORN AND CIVILIAN PERSONNEL AND THEIR FAMILIES ON THE MENTAL AND PHYSICAL EFFECTS ON SOMEONE WHO DEALS WITH CRITICAL INCIDENTS AND OFFER PROPER COPING SKILLS. FINALLY, BCI WILL PROVIDE CRITICAL INCIDENT TRAINING TO UP TO 40 STAFF MEMBERS WHO WILL SERVE AS PEER SUPPORTERS.

THROUGH THIS PROJECT,  DEPARTMENT (BPD) SEEKS TO IMPLEMENT A YOUTH-FOCUSED CO-RESPONSE MODEL - YOUTH CRISIS & EARLY DIVERSION NAVIGATION. THIS MODEL WILL CREATE CAPACITY FOR YOUTH TRAUMA-INFORMED RESPONSE WITHIN BPD AND FORGE A STRONG ORGANIZATIONAL ALLIANCE. TOGETHER, OUR GOAL IS TO EFFECTIVELY PROVIDE YOUTH WITH MOMENT-OF-CRISIS CARE, FOLLOW-UP, AND RESOURCES IN AND FOLLOWING A LAW ENFORCEMENT INTERACTION. THROUGHOUT THIS PROCESS, WE WILL FOCUS ON UNDERSTANDING THE YOUTH’S NEEDS, GIVING YOUTH A VOICE, DE-ESCALATION, NAVIGATING AND MITIGATING CRISIS AND TRAUMA, AND EMPOWERING YOUTH TO CHOOSE A PATH TOWARDS POSITIVE CHANGE IN THEIR LIVES.  FUNDING WILL ALSO INCLUDE A FORMAL EVALUATION.

THE LONG BEACH LEMHWA IMPLEMENTATION PROJECT WILL FUND SEVERAL INITIATIVES TO SUPPORT WELLNESS INITIATIVES INCLUDING: 1) RAPID EXPANSION OF THEIR PEER SUPPORT PROGRAM (PSP) AND WELLNESS PROGRAMMING THE PROJECT WILL TRAIN 60 PERSONNEL, SWORN STAFF IN VARYING RANKS, AND PUBLIC SAFETY DISPATCHERS. THE PSP WILL BE AVAILABLE TO SWORN PERSONNEL AND THE CIVILIAN STAFF WHO SUPPORT THEM; A TOTAL OF 1,191 EMPLOYEES. THE PSP WILL SUPPORT THE REGIONAL NETWORK OF PSPS TO SHARE ADVANCEMENTS IN TECHNIQUES AND PROVIDE SUPPORT VIA MUTUAL AID EFFORTS; 2) SUPPORT COMPREHENSIVE TRAINING FOR THE LBPD ACADEMY; 3) THE FACILITATION OF A SERIES OF INFORMATIVE EVENTS REFERRED TO AS “WELLNESS WEDNESDAYS” INTENDED FOR SWORN PERSONNEL, DISPATCH STAFF AND THEIR FAMILIES AND 4) EXPANDED CONFERENCE ATTENDANCE TO THE IACP SAFETY AND WELLNESS SYMPOSIUM.

THIS PROJECT WILL FUND A HIRING 1 FTE TO DEVELOP A CO-RESPONSE DEPARTMENTWIDE PROGRAM WHILE PROVIDING MENTAL HEALTH SERVICES, THAT WOULD INCORPORATE A COMPREHENSIVE COMMUNITY BASED BEST PRACTICE REVIEW OF EXISTING CIT PROGRAMS, SUPPORT KCSO DEPUTIES WITH MHP SERVICES, AND DEVELOP AN ADAPTIVE PHASED PROGRAM DEPLOYMENT PLAN THAT WOULD INCORPORATE ADDITIONAL MHPS WHO WOULD BE ASSIGNED TO GEOGRAPHIC REGIONS BASED ON DATA AND COMMUNITY IDENTIFIED NEED.

THE MUSKOGEE POLICE DEPARTMENT LEMHWA IMPLEMENTATION PROJECT WILL SUPPORT REGIONAL EXPANSION OF THE BLUE LINE WELLNESS INITIATIVE PROGRAM THAT CURRENTLY OFFERS HEALTH AND WELLNESS SERVICES. THE PROJECT EXPANSION WITH CREATE A MULTIJURISDICTIONAL PEER SUPPORT NETWORKS, PROVIDE CONNECTION WITH LICENSED MENTAL HEALTH PROFESSIONALS, AND PROVIDE SUPPORT TO FAMILIES. IN 2019 THE MUSKOGEE POLICE DEPARTMENT IMPLEMENTED THE BLUE LINE WELLNESS INITIATIVE, A COMPREHENSIVE CRISIS INTERVENTION PROGRAM THAT PROVIDES MPD. OFFICERS WITH THE OPPORTUNITY TO RECEIVE TANGIBLE CRISIS INTERVENTION SERVICES AND STRESS MANAGEMENT EDUCATION. THE PROGRAM CLOSELY FOLLOWS THE INTERNATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF CHIEFS OF POLICE PEER SUPPORT GUIDELINES.

THE PROJECT WILL HIRE TWO CRISIS INTERVENTION/MENTAL HEALTH SPECIALIST.  THE SPECIALIST WILL BE AVAILABLE TO RESPOND TO CALLS FOR SERVICE AT THE REQUEST OF THE LAW ENFORCEMENT, TO SUPPORT THE DEPUTIES, ASSIST WITH DE-ESCALATION, PROVIDE MENTAL HEALTH REFERRALS AND FOLLOW-UP WITH HIGH UTILIZERS. IN ADDITION, EVERY EMPLOYEE WILL COMPLETE EITHER THE 40-HOUR CRISIS INTERVENTION TEAM COURSE OR THE MENTAL HEALTH FIRST AID.

THE ESSEX COUNTY SHERIFFS DEPARTMENT LEMHWA IMPLEMENTATION PROJECT WILL PROVIDE FUNDS TO HIRE A CIVILIAN WELLNESS COORDINATOR AND PURCHASE AN APP.  THE WELLNESS COORDINATOR IS CENTRAL TO THEIR PLANS TO BROADEN THEIR WELLNESS PROGRAM. THE ECSD WELLNESS INITIATIVE WILL ENHANCE TRAINING, SUPPORT SERVICES FOCUSED ON OFFICER EMOTIONAL, MENTAL HEALTH, AND SELF-AWARENESS, INCLUDING SUICIDE PREVENTION EFFORTS, PEER SUPPORT, CLINICAL AND FAMILY SUPPORT SERVICES TO CURRENT, RETIRED EMPLOYEES, AND FAMILY MEMBERS THROUGH A CONFIDENTIAL CENTRALIZED SUPPORT SYSTEM. THROUGH THIS INITIATIVE ECSD HOPES TO DEVELOP A PROMISING PRACTICE THAT CAN BE REPLICATED WITH THE BROADER CORRECTIONAL AND LAW ENFORCEMENT COMMUNITY.

PROJECT WILL PROVIDE ONE FULL-TIME MENTAL HEALTH PROFESSIONAL AND ONE PART-TIME MENTAL HEALTH PROFESSIONAL TO ASSIST THE DEPARTMENT AS IT RESPONDS TO AN INCREASE IN MENTAL HEALTH CALLS FOR SERVICE ACROSS THE CAMPUS COMMUNITY. THE GRANT FUNDED MENTAL HEALTH PROFESSIONALS WILL WORK WITH THE JMU COUNSELING CENTER AND THE DEAN OF STUDENTS OFFICE TO ASSIST IN THE PROPER FOLLOW-UP CARE

THE BALTIMORE COUNTY POLICE DEPARTMENT LEMHWA IMPLEMENTATION PROJECT WILL ENHANCE THE POLICE DEPARTMENT’S EXISTING PEER SUPPORT AND WELLNESS TEAM INITIATIVES THAT OFFER TRAINING AND SERVICES RELATED TO OFFICER EMOTIONAL AND MENTAL HEALTH, PEER MENTORING, SUICIDE PREVENTION, STRESS REDUCTION, AND SUPPORT SERVICES FOR OFFICERS AND THEIR FAMILIES. FUNDING IS REQUESTED FOR THE PURCHASE OF CRITICAL INCIDENT TRAINING RESOURCES: 1) EMPIRICALLY-BASED CRITICAL INCIDENT STRESS MANAGEMENT TRAINING SWORN SUPERVISORY PERSONNEL; 2) INCIDENT STRESS MANAGEMENT INSTRUCTOR TRAINING; 3) SUICIDE PREVENTION INSTRUCTOR TRAINING, AND 4) ADVANCED THREAT ASSESSMENT TRAINING.  FUNDING IS ALSO REQUESTED TO PURCHASE RESOURCE/COURSE MATERIALS TO CONDUCT TRAININGS WITHIN THE DEPARTMENT.

THIS PROJECT IS A PARTNERSHIP WITH TRI-COUNTY AND CONTRACT 2 FULL-TIME MASTERS LEVEL QUALIFIED MENTAL HEALTH PROVIDERS (QMHP) WHO WILL BE EMBEDDED IN THE FIELD WITH A SWORN PEACE OFFICER ON PATROL. THESE UNITS WOULD BE DEDICATED TO RESPONDING TO CIT AND MENTAL HEALTH CRISIS 911 CALLS. CIT UNITS WOULD ALSO BE USED FOR ROUTINE FOLLOW UP AND PROACTIVE VISITS WITH MENTAL HEALTH CLIENTS.

THE CLARKSVILLE POLICE DEPARTMENT LEMHWA IMPLEMENTATION PROJECT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING TO HIRE A COUNSELOR AND THIS POSITION WILL BE CERTIFIED IN AND LICENSED TO PRACTICE BEHAVIORAL SCIENCES. BY ADDING COUNSELING SERVICES, WE WOULD ENHANCE AND IMPROVE THE ESTABLISHED WELLNESS PROGRAM.  THIS GRANT-FUNDED POSITION WILL WORK SIDE BY SIDE WITH THE WELLNESS COORDINATOR AND WOULD BE ABLE TO HAVE IN PERSON COUNSELING SESSIONS WITH EMPLOYEES AND THEIR FAMILY MEMBERS. ULTIMATELY THE GOAL FOR THIS POSITION IS TO ENHANCE THE EMOTIONAL WELLNESS OF CLARKSVILLE POLICE DEPARTMENT EMPLOYEES. EMPLOYEE WELLNESS AFFECTS ALL INTERACTIONS FROM PEERS TO PERSONAL LIFE TO CITIZENS. ANY IMPROVEMENT TO OFFICERS’ WELLNESS IS A DIRECT BENEFIT TO THE COMMUNITY WE SERVE.

THIS PROJECT WILL SUPPORT; 1) CRISIS COUNSELOR CALL-TAKERS RECEIVING CIT INTERNATIONAL’S CIT SUPPORT TRAINING ; 2) AUGMENT CIT/LE-MENTAL HEALTH CO-RESPONSE EFFORTS: 3) CIT SUPPORT TRAINING FOR 911 FOR FIVE SHERIFF’S OFFICE DISPATCH SUPERVISORS AND THREE EMBEDDED MENTAL HEALTH PROFESSIONALS; AND 4) COMPLETE CIT COORDINATOR TRAINING FOR TWO SWORN CIT PERSONNEL. THE PROJECT WILL BE A COLLABORATION BETWEEN FBCSO AND FORT BEND COUNTY BEHAVIORAL HEALTH SERVICES, THE TEXANA CENTER, OTHER AREA MENTAL HEALTH PROFESSIONALS, AREA MENTAL HEALTH HOSPITALS AND HOSPITAL ERS, AND OTHER COMMUNITY-BASED AGENCIES AND SERVICE PROVIDERS.

THE CINNAMINSON POLICE DEPARTMENT LEMHWA IMPLEMENTATION PROJECT WILL SUPPORT THE DEPARTMENT’S RESILIENCY AND WELLNESS PROGRAM WHICH INCLUDE PEER SUPPORT SERVICES, RESILIENCY TRAINING, SUICIDE PREVENTION TRAINING, PHYSICAL FITNESS AWARENESS, NUTRITION PROGRAM, EMPLOYEE ASSISTANCE PROGRAM, FAMILY SUPPORT SERVICES, ALCOHOL AND SUBSTANCE ABUSE RESOURCES, CHAPLAINCY SERVICES, AND FINALLY, CRITICAL INCIDENT STRESS DEBRIEFING SESSIONS.

THE BROWARD COUNTY SHERIFF'S OFFICE LEMHWA IMPLEMENTATION PROJECT WILL PROVIDE ADVANCED TRAINING AND AUGMENTS THE NUMBER OF PEER SUPPORT TEAM MEMBERS. AN INITIAL 16-HOUR TRAINING WILL COVER STRESS CONTINUUM, ACTIVE LISTENING SKILLS, DEPRESSION, SUBSTANCE USE, ANXIETY AND PTSD, SUICIDE, TACTICAL WELLNESS, AND RELATIONSHIPS/WORK-LIFE BALANCE. AFTER INITIAL TRAINING PEERS WILL BE READY TO COMMENCE PROVIDING SUPPORT TO EMPLOYEES IN NEED. PEERS WILL RECEIVE CONTINUED TRAINING BI-MONTHLY.

THE SALINAS POLICE DEPARTMENT LEMHWA IMPLEMENTATION PROJECT WILL SUPPORT THE DEPARTMENT'S PEERS SUPPORT TEAM, TO INCLUDE ASSISTANCE TO PURCHASE AN APP, ADD TO CHAPLAINCY AND RECRUIT MEMBERS OF THE PEER SUPPORT/CISM TEAM. PROJECT WILL ALSO SEND PEER SUPPORT CISM TEAM TO TRAINING. THE PROJECT WILL BE LED BY THE COMMANDER OF SPD’S PERSONNEL AND TRAINING/ADMINISTRATION UNIT, ASSISTED BY THE ASSISTANT CHIEF OF FIELD OPERATIONS AND ADMINISTRATION AND FOUR SERGEANTS WHO LEAD THE PEER SUPPORT TEAM. KEY PARTNERS INCLUDE THE MONTEREY COUNTY BEHAVIORAL HEALTH BUREAU, WHO WILL PROVIDE TRAINING AND EXPERT SUPPORT, AND DR. MATT FLEMING, SPD’S CHAPLAIN OF SIXTEEN YEARS.

THE MIRAMAR POLICE DEPARTMENT LEMHWA IMPLEMENTATION PROJECT SEEKS TO DEVELOP A MENTAL WELLNESS PROGRAM TO IMPROVE ACCESS TO MENTAL HEALTH AND WELLNESS SERVICES FOR ITS LAW ENFORCEMENT AND CIVILIAN STAFF IN AN AREA COMPRISED PRIMARILY OF MINORITIES. PROJECT PLANS TO CONTRACT WITH MENTAL HEALTH AGENCIES AND PROFESSIONALS TO PROVIDE SERVICES AND TRAININGS, SUCH AS PEER-TO-PEER TRAINING AND CRITICAL INCIDENT STRESS MANAGEMENT (CISM) TRAININGS.

THE VIRGINIA BEACH POLICE DEPARTMENT LEMHWA IMPLEMENTATION PROJECT WILL SUPPORT THE DEPARTMENTS TRAINING EFFORTS TO SUPPORT THE MENTAL HEALTH AND WELLNESS OF ITS OFFICERS. THE MENTAL HEALTH FIRST AID FOR PUBLIC SAFETY TRAINING PROVIDES OFFICERS WITH MORE RESPONSE OPTIONS TO HELP DE-ESCALATE INCIDENTS AND BETTER UNDERSTAND MENTAL ILLNESSES SO THEY CAN RESPOND TO MENTAL HEALTH-RELATED SITUATIONS APPROPRIATELY WITHOUT COMPROMISING SAFETY. IN ADDITION TO THE DEPARTMENT’S MENTAL HEALTH AND WELLNESS PROGRAMS, THE DEPARTMENT WOULD LIKE TO ADD A MINDFULNESS-BASED PEER TRAINING TO COMPLEMENT THE CADRE OF SUPPORT SERVICES CURRENTLY BEING OFFERED IN THE DEPARTMENT.  PEER COACHES ARE TRAINED TO SUPPORT FOUNDATIONAL MINDFULNESS SKILLS TRAINING AND TO WORK WITH LEADERS ACROSS THE ORGANIZATION TO CREATIVELY INTEGRATE MINDFULNESS INTO THE CULTURE, TRAINING, OPERATIONS, AND ADMINISTRATION. THE DEPARTMENT IS IN NEED OF TEACHING OFFICERS TO BECOME MORE RESILIENT ON THE JOB. RESILIENCE TRAINING WILL HELP OFFICERS MANAGE THEIR ON-THE-JOB AND OFF-THE-CLOCK BALANCE IN THEIR LIVES. AS MORE OFFICERS ARE ASKED TO TAKE ON ADDITIONAL RESPONSIBILITIES WITH LITTLE INSTRUCTION ON HOW TO ACCOMPLISH THIS. PARTICIPANTS WILL LEARN HIGH STRESS JOB RESILIENCY, WORK AND FAMILY BALANCE, UNDERSTANDING SIGNS AND SYMPTOMS OF PTSD, SUICIDE, AND DEPRESSION. THEY WILL BE EDUCATED ON MENTAL PERFORMANCE, STRESS RESPONSE/AUTONOMIC NERVOUS SYSTEM FUNCTION, PROPER BREATHING TECHNIQUES, HEART RATE VARIABILITY TRAINING, BENEFITS OF REGULATING PSYCHOPHYSIOLOGY, PROGRESSIVE MUSCLE RELAXATION, SLEEP & FATIGUE MANAGEMENT.

THE NEW JERSEY DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS LEMHWA IMPLEMENTATION PROJECT WILL IMPLEMENT THREE MENTAL HEALTH AND WELLNESS INITIATIVES: 1) AN EVIDENCE-SUPPORTED CO RECRUIT WELLNESS TRAINING CURRICULUM THAT PRIORITIZES CO TRAUMA, STRESS, AND SUICIDE RISK, 2) A PEER-TO-PEER MENTOR SUPPORT PROGRAM FOR NEW RECRUITS AND JUNIOR COS, AND 3) A CO FAMILY OUTREACH PROGRAM TO HELP ADULT FAMILY MEMBERS UNDERSTAND COMMON STRESSORS THAT STEM FROM CORRECTIONS WORK AND TEACHES STRATEGIES TO REDUCE THE IMPACT OF CORRECTIONS WORK ON HOME LIFE.

THE METROPOLITAN (DC) POLICE DEPARTMENT LEMHWA IMPLEMENTATION PROJECT WILL SUPPORT MPD'S MENTORING AND TRANSITIONING TO RETIREMENT PROGRAMMING EFFORTS. MENTORING PROGRAMS HAVE BEEN REQUESTED FOR SUPPORT EMOTIONALLY AND PROFESSIONALLY. THERE ARE SIGNIFICANT SOURCES OF STRESS ASSOCIATED WITH JOINING MPD AS A RECRUIT AND FOR THOSE SEEKING PROMOTIONS OR TRANSFERS. PAIRING UP MEMBERS TO PROVIDE SUPPORT DURING THESE PERIODS IS CRITICAL FOR PROMOTING MENTAL HEALTH AND RESILIENCY. RETIREMENT EDUCATION SESSIONS AT MPD HAVE TRADITIONALLY FOCUSED ON FINANCIAL ASPECTS, HOWEVER THE FACT THAT THE NATIONAL OFFICERS DIE ON AVERAGE WITHIN 5 YEARS OF RETIREMENT IS DAUNTING. IN OUR QUEST TO SUPPORT MEMBERS BEFORE THEY RETIRE AND CONNECT THEM WITH RESOURCES AND ENSURE A SUCCESSFUL TRANSITION OUT OF MPD WE WILL ESTABLISH A RETIREMENT TRANSITION PROGRAM. FINALLY, WE WILL CONDUCT A FEASIBILITY STUDY ON CHILDCARE. THIS IS A TOP STRESSOR ACROSS THE DEPARTMENT AND WAS ONLY EXACERBATED BY THE PANDEMIC. OUR MEMBERS HAVE REQUESTED THAT WE EXPLORE THIS AS A BENEFIT. AT MINIMUM, WE WANT TO BE ABLE TO SHARE CHILDCARE SERVICES AVAILABLE TO THEM WITH A THOUGHTFUL MARKET REVIEW. TOGETHER THESE EFFORTS WILL ENHANCE OUR EXISTING PROGRAMS AND SERVICES AVAILABLE TO SUPPORT MENTAL HEALTH AND WELL-BEING. WE WILL CONDUCT EVALUATIONS THROUGHOUT EACH PROJECT AND ENSURE THAT WE COMPLEMENT EXISTING PROGRAMS AND SERVICES. WE WILL ENSURE THAT THESE NEW PROJECTS WILL BE LAUNCHED THOUGHTFULLY AND WITH CREATIVE MARKETING TO ADVERTISE THEM TO MEMBERS.

THE NEW YORK CITY POLICE DEPARTMENT LEMHWA IMPLEMENTATION PROJECT WILL IMPLEMENT AN IMPLEMENT EARLY INTERVENTION PROCESS FOR RISK FACTORS RELATED TO SUBSTANCE ABUSE. THE PROJECT SEEKS TO IMPLEMENT RESOURCES AND PROVIDE ENHANCED AWARENESS TO SUPPORT EARLY INTERVENTION THROUGH DEVELOPMENT AND ASSESSMENT OF A WEB BASED PROGRAM.

THE SAN JOSE POLICE DEPARTMENT LEMHWA IMPLEMENTATION PROJECT SUPPORTS DEPARTMENT’S GOAL IS TO ENHANCE WELLNESS SERVICES BY PROVIDING TRAININGS, DEVELOPING FAMILY SUPPORT TOOLS, SUICIDE PREVENTION, BOOSTING PEER SUPPORT RESOURCES FOR LAW ENFORCEMENT PERSONNEL. THE PROGRAM WILL BE TO EXPAND ON PRIOR TRAININGS, SUCH AS TRAUMA INFORMED CARE, THAT FOCUSED ON HOW BOTH LONG-TERM AND ACUTE EXPOSURE TO TRAUMA CAN AFFECT LAW ENFORCEMENT PERSONNEL AND PROFESSIONAL STAFF, DETAILING BOTH PHYSIOLOGICAL AND PSYCHOLOGICAL EFFECTS. THE PROGRAM WILL HAVE TRAININGS TAILORED FOR OFFICERS AND DISPATCHERS, AS WELL AS FOR PROFESSIONAL STAFF WHO HAVE VARYING LEVELS OF EXPOSURE.  IN ADDITION, A MENTAL HEALTH FIRST-AID TRAIN-THE TRAINER COURSE WILL BE PROVIDED TO 16 EMPLOYEES, WHO IN TURN WILL PROVIDE TRAININGS ON MENTAL HEALTH RISK FACTORS AND WARNING SIGNS FOR MENTAL HEALTH AND ADDICTION CONCERNS, STRATEGIES FOR HOW TO HELP SOMEONE IN BOTH CRISIS AND NON-CRISIS SITUATIONS, AND WHERE TO TURN FOR HELP. CERTIFYING EMPLOYEES AS TRAINERS WILL ALSO HELP TO INCREASE SUSTAINABILITY OF THE MENTAL HEALTH AND WELLNESS PROGRAM FOLLOWING THE GRANT. ANOTHER KEY COMPONENT OF THE PROGRAM WILL BE TO EXPAND UPON SERVICES AVAILABLE TO FAMILIES. DURING THE ACADEMY THERE ARE EVENTS FOR RECRUITS’ FAMILIES TO ATTEND AND LEARN ABOUT THE CAREER THEIR RESPECTIVE FAMILY MEMBERS HAVE CHOSEN; HOWEVER, THERE ARE LIMITED OPTIONS FOR FAMILIES THROUGHOUT THEIR CAREERS. THIS FUNDING WILL HELP TO ESTABLISH A FAMILY READINESS AND MENTAL HEALTH AND WELLNESS PROGRAM, LIKE SUCCESSFUL PROGRAMS IDENTIFIED IN THE LEMHWA REPORT TO CONGRESS AND CASE STUDIES. THE PROGRAM WILL DESIGN AND DEVELOP MENTAL HEALTH EDUCATIONAL VIDEOS AVAILABLE TO ALL STAFF AND FAMILY, AS WELL AS THE IMPLEMENTATION OF A MOBILE APPLICATION TO ALLOW EMPLOYEES TO REACH OUT FOR HELP WITH ANONYMITY TO THEIR EMPLOYEE ASSISTANCE PROGRAM AND ACCESS A VARIETY OF RESOURCES, INCLUDING SELF-ASSESSMENT TOOLS AND RESOURCES FOR SUBSTANCE ABUSE, MENTAL HEALTH, AND PERSONAL WELLNESS.  FUNDING WOULD ALSO ALLOW FOR PERSONNEL IN CRISIS TO ATTEND THE WEST COAST POST-TRAUMA RETREAT, A SIX-DAY RESIDENTIAL PROGRAM FOR MENTAL AND EMOTIONAL HEALTH ISSUES RELATED TO ACUTE AND CUMULATIVE STRESS. THE ACQUISITION OF THIS GRANT WILL ASSIST TO STRENGTHEN DEPARTMENT MEMBERS EMOTIONAL AND PSYCHOLOGICAL WELLBEING, WHICH IN TURN WILL INCREASE WORK PRODUCTIVITY AND ENHANCE THE CONTRIBUTIONS ALL DEPARTMENT MEMBERS MAKE TO THE COMMUNITIES THEY SERVE.

THE LEON COUNTY SHERIFF'S OFFICE IMPLEMENTATION  PROJECT WILL FUND TWO KEY BEHAVIORAL HEALTH TRAININGS THAT WILL BE AVAILABLE TO ALL 726 AGENCY MEMBERS ON-LINE VERSIONS OF DR. GILMARTIN’S VIRTUAL EMOTIONAL SURVIVAL FOR LAW ENFORCEMENT SERIES OFFERED BY POLICE ONE ACADEMY AND HOST A REGIONAL TRAINING INCLUDING ANNETTE T. HILL, LPC THAT COULD SERVE UP TO A TOTAL OF 1500 PEOPLE.

THE NORTH RICHLAND HILLS POLICE DEPARTMENT PROJECT WILL FOCUS ON THE CREATION OF THE DEPARTMENT’S CRISIS RESPONSE TEAM.  FUNDING WILL BE USED TO HIRE A MENTAL HEALTH COORDINATOR WHO WILL PROVIDE ASSISTANCE TO POLICE PERSONNEL IN THE FIELD RESPONDING TO CALLS INVOLVING INDIVIDUALS UNDERGOING A MENTAL HEALTH CRISIS.  THEY WILL PROVIDE CRISIS INTERVENTION, COORDINATE RESOURCES AND ASSIST WITH DECISIONS INVOLVING APPLICATIONS FOR EMERGENCY DETENTION WHEN APPROPRIATE. THE MENTAL HEALTH COORDINATOR WILL ALSO WORK WITH STAFF TO DEVELOP BEST PRACTICES REGARDING STRATEGIES FOR RESPONDING TO MENTAL HEALTH INDIVIDUALS REQUIRING REPEAT INTERVENTIONS.

THE ASHEVILLE POLICE DEPARTMENT LEMHWA IMPLEMENTATION PROJECT SUPPORTS FUNDING WILL BE USED TO HIRE AND FUND A WELLNESS COORDINATOR POSITION WITHIN THE ASHEVILLE POLICE DEPARTMENT. THIS NEW POSITION WILL DEVELOP A WELL-ROUNDED APPROACH TO RESPOND TO OFFICERS' NEEDS AS THEY RELATE TO THE MENTAL HEALTH AND PHYSICAL WELLNESS OF OFFICERS. THE WELLNESS COORDINATOR WILL HAVE A VITAL ROLE IN THE SUCCESS OF THE AGENCY AS “HEALTHY OFFICERS ARE CRITICAL TO BUILDING HEALTHY AND SAFE COMMUNITIES.” IN CLOSING, THIS POSITION WILL ENSURE THE SUCCESS OF OUR CURRENT AND FUTURE PROGRAMS THAT SUPPORT OFFICERS AND ALLOWS THE AGENCY TO PRIORITIZE THE OVERALL WELL-BEING OF OFFICERS.

TOGETHER, THE BETHLEHEM HEALTH BUREAU AND BETHLEHEM POLICE DEPARTMENT LAUNCHED THE COMMUNITY CONNECTIONS PROGRAM IN AN EFFORT TO BETTER SERVE RESIDENTS WITH MENTAL HEALTH, SUBSTANCE USE DISORDERS AND OTHER UNMET SOCIAL SERVICE NEEDS.  THE FUNDING PROVIDED BY THE COPS OFFICE FY22 COMMUNITY POLICING DEVELOPMENT (CPD) PROGRAM WILL BE UTILIZED TO EXPAND THE COMMUNITY CONNECTIONS PROGRAM BY HIRING ADDITIONAL SOCIAL WORKERS TO ASSIST WITH THE DEMAND. THE CITY OF BETHLEHEM PLANS TO EXPAND THE PROGRAM IN ORDER TO ALLOW FOR THE FOLLOWING: MORE TIME SPENT CO-RESPONDING OUT IN THE FIELD IMMEDIATELY WITH THE POLICE DEPARTMENT, OFFER RESPONSIVE SERVICES AT NIGHT AND ON WEEKENDS, CONDUCT HOME VISITS WITH THOSE WHO CANNOT BE REACHED BY PHONE AND PROACTIVELY WORK IN TANDEM WITH THE POLICE DEPARTMENT IN THE FIELD TO SHOW A PRESENCE IN AREAS EXPERIENCING HOMELESSNESS, OVERDOSES, ETC.

THE BOISE POLICE DEPARTMENT (BPD) LEMHWA IMPLEMENTATION PROJECT   WILL UTILIZE GRANT FUNDING TO IMPLEMENT ITS PILOT MENTAL HEALTH AND WELLNESS PROGRAM AND DELIVER DEDICATED MENTAL HEALTH AND WELLNESS SUPPORT FOR LAW ENFORCEMENT OFFICERS, THEIR FAMILIES, CIVILIAN SUPPORT STAFF, VOLUNTEER CHAPLAINS, AND RETIREES THROUGH SPECIALIZED TRAINING WORKSHOPS AND ONGOING EDUCATIONAL RESOURCES. BPD’S TRAINING WORKSHOPS WILL FOCUS ON A VARIETY OF IMPORTANT TOPICS, INCLUDING SLEEP RECOVERY, STRESS MANAGEMENT, PEER SUPPORT, SUICIDE PREVENTION, SPOUSAL SUPPORT, FINANCIAL STABILITY, PHYSICAL WELLNESS, AND MORE.

PROJECT FUNDING WILL BE USED TO EMBED A LICENSED MENTAL HEALTH COUNSELOR EMBEDDED WITHIN THE AGENCY'S MOBILE CRISIS TEAM. THE MOBILE CRISIS TEAM WILL BE PROACTIVE IN CONTACTING HOMELESS INDIVIDUALS AND CHECKING ON THEIR WELFARE TO ASSIST THEM IN RECEIVING THE NEEDED CARE. THE MOBILE CRISIS TEAM WILL ALSO RESPOND TO ALL 911 MENTAL HEALTH-RELATED CALLS. A MENTAL HEALTH COUNSELOR WITH THE TEAM ALLOWS BOTH THE OFFICER AND COUNSELOR TO CONTACT AN INDIVIDUAL THAT MAY BE RELUCTANT TO SEEK BEHAVIORAL HEALTH SERVICES. THE FUNDING WILL ALSO ALLOW THE DEPARTMENT TO HOST CRISIS INTERVENTION TRAINING AND DE-ESCALATION TRAINING TO GET MORE OFFICERS CIT CERTIFIED. HAVING THE OFFICERS ATTEND THIS ADVANCED TRAINING WILL GIVE OUR OFFICERS THE TOOLS TO HAVE A BETTER UNDERSTANDING AND PATIENCE WHEN DEALING WITH INDIVIDUALS THAT ARE EXPERIENCING A MENTAL HEALTH CRISIS. WE ALSO PLAN FOR OUR NON-SWORN CIVILIAN PERSONNEL (DISPATCHERS AND RECORDS PERSONNEL) TO ATTEND CRISIS INTERVENTION AND DE-ESCALATION TRAINING. OUR DISPATCHERS ARE USUALLY THE FIRST CONTACT FOR AN INDIVIDUAL DEALING WITH A MENTAL HEALTH CRISIS BUT OCCASIONALLY INCIDENTS OCCUR WITHIN OUR POLICE DEPARTMENT LOBBY WHERE RECORDS PERSONNEL MAY BE REQUIRED TO INITIALLY DEAL WITH SOMEONE WITH MENTAL HEALTH ISSUES.
THE SEDGWICK COUNTY SHERIFFS OFFICE LEMHWA IMPLEMENTATION PROJECT WILL SUPPORT AN EMERGENT COLLABORATIVE NETWORK OF PEER SUPPORT FOR LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCY OFFICERS AND FAMILY MEMBERS.

THIS PROJECT WILL ADD ADDITIONAL CO-RESPONDERS TO PROVIDE BROADER COVERAGE TO THEIR CO-RESPONDER MODEL ALREADY IN PLACE. THE CO-RESPONDER TEAM WILL ALSO PROVIDE MONTHLY MENTAL/BEHAVIORAL HEALTH, SUBSTANCE USE, INTELLECTUAL AND DEVELOPMENTAL DISABILITY, AND/OR CRISIS RESPONSE TRAININGS TO THE PATROL TEAMS DURING BRIEFINGS.

THE LEXINGTON POLICE DEPARTMENT LEMHWA IMPLEMENTATION PROJECT WILL FUND A FULL-TIME MENTAL HEALTH PROFESSIONAL WHO BE RESPONSIBLE FOR THE FOLLOWING FUNCTIONS: (1) PROVIDE ON-SITE COUNSELING, (2) PROVIDE EDUCATION AND GUIDANCE TO CURRENT PEER SUPPORT TEAM, (3) ATTEND CALL-OUTS AND DEBRIEFING SESSIONS WITH PEER SUPPORT TEAM, (4) PROVIDE INSTRUCTION ON PTSD, SUICIDE PREVENTION, DEPRESSION, ANXIETY AND STRESS MANAGEMENT TO THE BASIC AND IN-SERVICE TRAINING CLASSES, AND (5) REVIEW EARLY WARNING SYSTEM ALERTS TO OFFER SUPPORT OR GUIDANCE AND COUNSELING SERVICES IF NEEDED.
THIS PROJECT WILL FUND TWO FULL TIME CO-RESPONDERS FOR THE AGENCY.  ADDITIONALLY, IT WILL FUND TRAVEL TO A NATIONAL CONFERENCE AND TRAINING FOR BOTH SWORN AND CIVILIAN STAFF.

THE OMAHA POLICE DEPARTMENT IMPLEMENTATION PROJECT WILL TO PROVIDE WELLNESS, TRAINING AND PEER SUPPORT SERVICES TO IMPROVE OFFICER RESILIENCY, WELLBEING, AND CLOSE GAPS IN MENTAL HEALTH AND WELLNESS POLICIES AND SERVICES. PROJECT WILL ACCOMPLISH THIS BY INCREASING TRAINING PEER MENTORS, PROVIDING ENHANCED TRAINING, PROVIDING MENTAL HEALTH CHECKS AND DEVELOPMENT CRITICAL INCIDENT STRESS MANAGEMENT POLICIES.

THE HUNTINGTON POLICE DEPARTMENT (HPD) AND ITS PARTNERS WILL ESTABLISH A CIT STEERING COMMITTEE CONSISTING OF REPRESENTATIVES FROM LAW ENFORCEMENT, MENTAL HEALTH PROVIDERS, ADVOCATES, AND OTHER COMMUNITY STAKEHOLDERS. THE STEERING COMMITTEE WILL BE TASKED WITH THE FOLLOWING RESPONSIBILITIES; 1) DEVELOPING A 40-HOUR CIT TRAINING CURRICULUM; 2) TRAINING PATROL OFFICERS AND DISPATCHERS IN CRISIS RESPONSE; 3) FORMALLY CERTIFYING CIT OFFICERS; AND 4) COORDINATING BEHAVIORAL HEALTH REFERRAL SERVICES.

THE CHOCKTAW NATION OF OKLAHOMA LEMHWA IMPLEMENTATION PROJECT SUPPORTS PROJECT APESVCHI IKANA, WHICH WILL PROVIDE TARGETED TRAINING TO STRENGTHEN CRISIS RESPONSE, SELF-CARE, SUICIDE PREVENTION, AND GENERAL TRAUMA RESPONSE. IN ADDITION, CNO WILL HOST AN ANNUAL CONFERENCE TO ENCOURAGE COLLABORATION AND BUILD RELATIONSHIPS. CRISIS INTERVENTION TRAINING AND OTHER MODULES WILL BE OFFERED THROUGH THE COUNCIL ON LAW ENFORCEMENT EDUCATION AND TRAINING (CLEET), DURING AND IN ADDITION TO CONFERENCE.

THIS PROJECT WILL FUND THE HIRING OF A LICENSED SOCIAL WORKER TO FUNCTION AS A CO-RESPONDER.  IT WOULD ALSO FUND TRAVEL TO TWO CONFERENCES AND CERTIFICATION AS A CIT COORDINATOR FOR MULTIPLE SENIOR OFFICERS.

THE CHARLES COUNTY SHERIFF’S OFFICE (CCSO) LEMHWA IMPLEMENTATION PROJECT WILL FOCUS ON TWO GRANT-FUNDED COMPONENTS WHICH WILL ENHANCE OUR OVERALL MENTAL HEALTH, WELLNESS AND RESILIENCY PROGRAM. THE PROJECT WILL IMPROVE STRESS MANAGEMENT AND RESILIENCY FOR STAFF, FAMILY MEMBERS AND RETIREES THROUGH THE IMPLEMENTATION OF A CRITICAL INCIDENT STRESS MANAGEMENT (CISM) REGIONAL TRAINING COURSE AND YOGA FOR FIRST RESPONDERS (YFFR) TRAINING.

COPS CIT FUNDING WILL SUPPORT THE DEVELOPMENT OF A MOBILE CRISIS INTERVENTION TEAM (MCIT) THAT WILL FUNCTION IN AND AROUND THE UNIVERSITY OF WEST GEORGIA AND COLLABORATE WITH THE CARROLL COUNTY MOBILE CRISIS INTERVENTION TEAM (CCERT). THE MCIT IS COMPOSED OF A SWORN PEACE OFFICER TRAINED IN BUT NOT LIMITED TO ADVANCED CRISIS INTERVENTION, ADVANCED FIRST AID AND MENTAL HEALTH FIRST AID. THE OFFICER WOULD TEAM WITH A LICENSED PROFESSIONAL COUNSELOR (LPC) AND RESPOND TO SCENES OF PEOPLE IN ACTIVE CRISIS. THE TEAM WILL ASSESS IF THE PERSON IS MENTALLY ILL AND IN IMMEDIATE DANGER TO SELF AND OTHERS AND FACILITATES THE EVALUATION AND TRANSPORTATION TO A DESIGNATED MENTAL HEALTH FACILITY.

THE SIOUX FALLS POLICE DEPARTMENT LEMHWA IMPLEMENTATION PROJECT WILL PROVIDE FUNDING TO HIRE A FULL-TIME WELLNESS COORDINATOR POSITION THAT WILL PROVIDE THE ADMINISTRATIVE SUPPORT TO THE INDIVIDUALS AND TEAMS RESPONSIBLE FOR THESE WELLNESS DUTIES AND SERVICES, WHICH WILL, IN TURN, DECREASE THEIR ADMINISTRATIVE WORKLOAD, IMPROVE THE DELIVERY OF SERVICES AND SUPPORT, AND ALLOW FOR MORE PROACTIVE GROWTH OF THE BREADTH OF OUR PROGRAM.

THE MARIETTA POLICE DEPARTMENT WILL USE FUNDS FROM THE FY22 IMPLEMENTING CRISIS INTERVENTION TEAMS- COMMUNITY POLICING DEVELOPMENT SOLICITATION TO DEVELOP AND DEPLOY A LAW ENFORCEMENT-BASED CO-RESPONDER TEAM. CO-RESPONDER TEAMS UTILIZE THE COMBINED EXPERTISE OF THE OFFICER AND THE BEHAVIORAL HEALTH SPECIALIST OR LICENSED CLINICAL SOCIAL WORKER TO DE-ESCALATE SITUATIONS AND HELP LINK INDIVIDUALS WITH BEHAVIORAL HEALTH ISSUES TO APPROPRIATE SERVICES. THE MARIETTA POLICE DEPARTMENT WILL CONTRACT A BEHAVIORAL HEALTH SPECIALIST OR LICENSED CLINICAL SOCIAL WORKER TO RESPOND WITH THE COMMUNITY RESPONSE UNIT AND IN SOME CASES, RESPOND TO CALLS WHERE CRISIS INTERVENTION AND SERVICES MAY BE NEEDED. THE OFFICERS INVOLVED IN THE PROGRAM WILL UNDERGO CRISIS INTERVENTION TRAINING AS WELL AS ADDITIONAL BEHAVIORAL HEALTH RESPONSE TRAINING. THE CO-RESPONDER TEAM RESPOND TO A VARIETY OF SITUATIONS. WHILE THE OFFICER WILL ENSURE THE SAFETY OF THOSE INVOLVED, THE BEHAVIORAL HEALTH SPECIALIST OR LICENSED CLINICAL SOCIAL WORKER WILL ASSIST WITH CONNECTING THE INDIVIDUAL IN CRISIS WITH TEMPORARY HOUSING, OBTAINING PROTECTIVE ORDERS, ADDICTION TREATMENT AND A VARIETY OF OTHER SERVICES.  A BEHAVIORAL HEALTH SPECIALIST OR LICENSED CLINICAL SOCIAL WORKER WILL ALSO BE ABLE TO PROVIDE ON SCENE INTERVENTION FOR INDIVIDUALS EXPERIENCING A BEHAVIORAL HEALTH CRISIS. THE CO-RESPONDER MODEL WILL ALLOW OFFICERS AND LICENSED CLINICAL SOCIAL WORKERS TO FOLLOW UP ON SITUATIONS MORE EASILY, WHICH DOES NOT ALWAYS HAPPEN. ADDITIONALLY, IN THE EVENT THAT BEHAVIORAL HEALTH INTERVENTION IS NEEDED, GEORGIA LAW PERMITS LICENSED CLINICAL SOCIAL WORKERS TO COMPLETE AND SIGN 10-13 FORMS, GOOD FOR 48-HOURS, FOR PSYCHOLOGICAL EVALUATIONS. THIS WILL ALLOW THE CO-RESPONDER TEAM TO PROVIDE IMMEDIATE STABILIZATION IN CASE OF URGENT MEDICAL NEED OR BEHAVIORAL HEALTH CRISIS, ASSESSMENT, INFORMATION, REFERRAL, ADVOCACY & (IN SOME CASES) TRANSPORTATION TO THE NEXT STEP IN TREATMENT.  ON SCENE, THE CO-RESPONDER TEAM WILL NOT ONLY WORK TO DE-ESCALATE TENSE SITUATIONS, BUT WILL ALSO PROVIDE BEHAVIORAL HEALTH SCREENING AND ASSESSMENT, AND REFERRAL TO NEEDED SERVICES. OUTCOMES CAN RANGE FROM LEAVING THE INDIVIDUAL WITH NECESSARY RESOURCES, TRANSPORTING THE INDIVIDUAL TO A LOCAL HOSPITAL OR WALK-IN CLINIC, OR PROVIDING SUPPORT AND RESOURCES FOR FAMILY MEMBERS AND OTHERS ON-SCENE. THE CO-RESPONDER MODEL HAS SEEN SUCCESS IN SIMILAR LOCAL POLICE DEPARTMENTS TO INCLUDE THE COBB COUNTY POLICE DEPARTMENT AND THE GWINNETT COUNTY POLICE DEPARTMENT. THROUGH THE CO-RESPONDER TEAM, THE MARIETTA POLICE DEPARTMENT SEEKS TO IMPROVE SERVICES AVAILABLE AND PROVIDED TO CITIZENS IN CRISIS, BUT ALSO TO BETTER SERVE THE CITIZENS OF MARIETTA. THE CO-RESPONDER TEAM WILL BE BETTER ABLE TO DE-ESCALATE BEHAVIORAL HEALTH CRISIS’ AND LESSEN THE USE OF FORCE ON CALLS FOR SERVICE WHERE A BEHAVIORAL HEALTH CRISIS IS A KEY FACTOR IN THE INCIDENT.

THE STOCKBRIDGE POLICE DEPARTMENT LEMHWA IMPLEMENTATION PROJECT IS BEING FUNDED TO IMPLEMENT A COMPREHENSIVE MENTAL HEALTH AND WELLNESS PLAN FOR SPD OFFICERS, WHICH WILL CONSIST OF ANNUAL PSYCHOLOGICAL WELLNESS CHECKS, FAMILY SUPPORT, PEER SUPPORT, AND TRAINING.

THE PROJECT IS TO INTEGRATE INTERVENTION SPECIALISTS IN THE 911 CALL CENTER TO CREATE A CRISIS INTERVENTION DISPATCH SERVICE (CIDS). THE CIDS PROGRAM WILL DELIVER A 911 DISPATCH DIVERSION PROGRAM TO IMPROVE AND ENHANCE OUTCOMES OF PERSONS IN CRISIS. THIS PROGRAM WILL INCLUDE REVIEW AND UPDATE OF POLICIES AND PROCEDURES FOR CRISIS INTERVENTION DISPATCH SERVICES (CIDS) AND INTEGRATE IT INTO THE OVERALL CRISIS INTERVENTION STRATEGIC PLANS.

THE ARLINGTON POLICE DEPARTMENT LEMHWA IMPLEMENTATION PROJECT WILL SUPPORT APD PEER SUPPORT TEAM MEMBERS TO ATTEND TRAINING AND CONFERENCES TO ENHANCE THEIR KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES TO ASSIST EMPLOYEES IN A CRISIS, AS WELL AS BECOME CRITICAL INCIDENT STRESS MANAGEMENT (CISM) APPROVED INSTRUCTORS TO TEACH CISM COURSES TO EMPLOYEES AND ONBOARD NEW PEER SUPPORT TEAM MEMBERS. OVERALL, THESE TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES WILL CONTRIBUTE TO CHANGING THE WELLNESS CULTURE AT THE APD AND INCREASE OUR ABILITY TO SERVE OUR OFFICERS’ AND OUR COMMUNITY.
THIS PROJECT WILL FUND THE HIRING OF A CO-RESPONDER CLINICIAN, TRAINING FOR FIRST LINE SUPERVISORS, AND INCLUDES A WRITTEN EVALUATION AS A DELIVERABLE.

THE DONA ANA SHERIFFS OFFICE LEMHWA IMPLEMENTATION PROJECT SUPPORTS REQUESTED FUNDS WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT OUR PEER SUPPORT PROGRAM BY HELPING US TO OBTAIN MORE TRAINING AND BE ABLE TO PAY FOR WORKSHOPS AND TRAVEL FOR CURRENT MEMBERS AND TO BE ABLE TO EXPAND AND TRAIN NEW MEMBERS.  FUNDS WILL ALSO BE USED TO BRING PROFESSIONALLY TRAINED MENTAL HEALTH PROVIDERS T COME INTO OUR AGENCY AND OFFER TRAINING'S AND TOOLS TO IMPROVE MENTAL HEALTH FOR OUR EMPLOYEES AND THEIR FAMILIES.

THE VISALIA POLICE DEPARTMENT (VPD) CIT PROJECT THIS PROJECT WILL FUND THE HIRING OF A CO-RESPONDER CLINICIAN.  THE POSITION WILL COORDINATE WITH VPD TEAM BY DIRECTING REFERRALS TO THE VARIOUS RESOURCES AT OUR DISPOSAL, PROVIDE DIRECTED FOLLOW-UP FOR THESE REFERRALS IN FIELD AND OFFICE SETTINGS, AND SERVE AS THE COLLABORATION’S LIAISON TO THE NEWLY FORMED ENHANCED CARE MANAGEMENT INITIATIVE WHICH SERVES AS A MULTIDISCIPLINARY TEAM FOCUSED CONNECTING MEMBERS OF OUR COMMUNITY EXPERIENCING HOMELESSNESS TO OUR VARIOUS COMMUNITY RESOURCES AND AGENCIES. THIS POSITION WILL HELP THE DEPARTMENT CONDUCT PROACTIVE OUTREACH TEAM MEMBERS WILL BE ABLE TO PROVIDE A HIGHER LEVEL OF OUTREACH SERVICES AND REACH MORE CLIENTS IN NEED OF SERVICES. FUNDING WILL ALSO FUND TRAINING FOR FIRST LINE SUPERVISORS, AND INCLUDES A WRITTEN EVALUATION AS A DELIVERABLE.

THE RURAL GUSTINE POLICE DEPARTMENT WILL DEVELOP AND LAUNCH A CRISIS INTERVENTION TEAM (CIT) PROGRAM THAT APPRECIATES RURAL CULTURE THROUGH POSITIVE INTERACTIONS WITH POLICE, COUPLED WITH ORGANIZED ENGAGEMENT AND PROCEDURAL JUSTICE, TO IMPROVE RESPONSE AND REDUCE INJURY TO OFFICERS AND CITIZENS. FEDERAL FUNDING WILL FUND THE HIRING OF A CO-RESPONDER.  IT WOULD ALSO FUND TRAINING FOR DISPATCHER AND OFFICERS SERVING BOTH THE APPLICANT AND A PARTNER AGENCY, AND ATTENDANCE AT A NATIONAL CONFERENCE.

THE FUNDS WILL ALLOW THE INTEGRATED HEALTH AND RESOURCE TEAM TO OPERATE A 24/7/365 MOBILE CRISIS RESPONSE UNIT, DEPLOYED BY VPD DISPATCH, STAFFED BY ONE CRISIS COUNSELOR AND AN EMT OR NURSE, A LICENSED SOCIAL WORKER, TO RESPOND TO INCIDENTS TO WORK ON DE-ESCALATION, SOCIAL WORK, INTERVENTIONS, MEDIATION, AND SUICIDE ASSESSMENTS/INTERVENTIONS AND CONDUCT FOLLOW-UP CARE AND FAMILY INTERVENTIONS AS NEEDED.

THE CUYAHOGA COUNTY SHERIFF’S DEPARTMENT (CCSD) LEMHWA IMPLEMENTATION PROJECT SUPPORTS  PROPOSES TO IMPLEMENT A NEW WELLNESS PROGRAM THAT: 1) RECRUITS AND TRAINS FIVE (5) CCSD LAW ENFORCEMENT OFFICERS TO OVERSEE PEER SUPPORT ACTIVITIES AND A WELLNESS TEAM; 2) PROVIDES SERVICES THAT SUPPORT OFFICER EMOTIONAL AND MENTAL HEALTH; 3) AFFORDS SUPPORT SERVICES TO CCSD OFFICERS’ FAMILIES; AND 4) FOSTERS POSITIVE RELATIONSHIPS BETWEEN POLICE AND THE COMMUNITY.

THIS PROJECT WILL SUPPORT ; 1) 40-HOUR CIT TRAININGS FOR ALL YTP SWORN PERSONNEL AND ASSOCIATED TRIBAL JUSTICE PARTNERS; 2) HIRE AN EMBED IN YTP A QUALIFIED MENTAL HEALTH/BEHAVIORAL HEALTH CLINICIAN; 3) HOST A REGIONAL CIT “TRAIN-THE-TRAINERS” EVENT FOR TRIBES AND LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCIES; 4) SEND YTP SWORN PERSONNEL TO THE NATIONAL CIT CONFERENCE; 5) PURCHASE COMPUTERS AND EPROSECUTOR SOFTWARE VITAL TO CAPTURING THE METRICS OF THE CIT PROGRAM; 7) PRODUCE A REPORT AND PROMOTE WIDELY YTP’S CIT PROGRAM FOR OTHER JURISDICTIONS AND AGENCIES.

THIS GRANT WILL ALLOW THE SHERIFF’S DEPARTMENT TO HIRE A BEHAVIORAL HEALTH CLINICIAN WHO WILL WORK WITH MENTAL HEALTH SUPPORT TEAM. THE CLINICIAN WILL ASSIST MHST DETECTIVES WITH THEIR CASES AND ATTEND COMMUNITY EVENTS. THE GRANT WILL ALLOW THE DETECTIVES TO ATTEND ADDITIONAL TRAININGS AND THE CIT CONFERENCE.

THIS PROJECT WILL SUPPORT A FULL TIME CRISIS INTERVENTION SPECIALIST, WHO WILL WORK WITH OUR EXISTING SOCIAL WORK INTERNSHIP PROGRAM THROUGH THE UNIVERSITY OF ARKANSAS AND CIT OFFICERS TO PROVIDE ACTIVE CRISIS INTERVENTION, JAIL DIVERSION, CONNECTION WITH APPROPRIATE COMMUNITY RESOURCES, INCREASING CONNECTION WITH COMMUNITY STAKEHOLDERS AND EDUCATION ON CRISIS INTERVENTION FOR LAW ENFORCEMENT, COMMUNICATIONS PERSONNEL AND THE COMMUNITY.

MUNICIPALITY OF ANCHORAGE WILL USE FUNDING TO ENHANCE THE CURRENT CIT MODEL BY CREATING AN ADDITIONAL CO-RESPONSE TEAM.  THE NEWLY FORMED TEAM WILL INCREASE PUBLIC SAFETY BY EXPANDING CO-RESPONSE TEAM COVERAGE/AVAILABILITY.

FUNDING UNDER THIS AWARD PROGRAM WILL BE UTILIZED BY LOCAL LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCIES TO HIRE AND REHIRE CAREER LAW ENFORCEMENT OFFICERS NECESSARY TO INCREASE THE JURISDICTION’S COMMUNITY POLICING CAPACITY TO PREVENT AND DISRUPT CRIME AND VIOLENCE.

THE PURPOSE OF THE COPS OFFICE TRIBAL RESOURCES GRANT HIRING PROGRAM (TRGP-HIRE) IS TO ADVANCE THE PRACTICE OF COMMUNITY POLICING IN TRIBAL JURISDICTIONS THROUGH THE HIRE OR REHIRE OF ADDITIONAL CAREER SWORN LAW ENFORCEMENT OFFICERS, TRIBAL/VILLAGE POLICE OFFICERS, AND VILLAGE PUBLIC SAFETY OFFICERS. FUNDING UNDER THIS AWARD PROGRAM WILL BE UTILIZED BY THE TRIBAL JURISDICTION TO HIRE AND REHIRE CAREER SWORN LAW ENFORCEMENT OFFICERS, TRIBAL/VILLAGE POLICE OFFICERS, AND VILLAGE PUBLIC SAFETY OFFICERS NECESSARY TO INCREASE THE JURISDICTION’S COMMUNITY POLICING CAPACITY TO PREVENT AND DISRUPT CRIME AND VIOLENCE.

THE PURPOSE OF THE COPS OFFICE ANTI-HEROIN TASK FORCE PROGRAM (AHTF) TO ADVANCE PUBLIC SAFETY BY PROVIDING FUNDS TO INVESTIGATE ILLICIT ACTIVITIES RELATED TO THE DISTRIBUTION OF HEROIN, FENTANYL, AND CARFENTANIL, UNLAWFUL DISTRIBUTION OF PRESCRIPTION OPIOIDS, OR UNLAWFUL HEROIN AND PRESCRIPTION OPIOID TRAFFICKERS. FUNDING UNDER THIS AWARD PROGRAM WILL BE USED BY THE STATE LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCY TO FOSTER STATEWIDE COLLABORATE IN SUPPORT OF SUCH INVESTIGATIVE ACTIVITIES.

THE PURPOSE OF THE COPS OFFICE ANTI-HEROIN TASK FORCE PROGRAM (AHTF) TO ADVANCE PUBLIC SAFETY BY PROVIDING FUNDS TO INVESTIGATE ILLICIT ACTIVITIES RELATED TO THE DISTRIBUTION OF HEROIN, FENTANYL, AND CARFENTANIL, UNLAWFUL DISTRIBUTION OF PRESCRIPTION OPIOIDS, OR UNLAWFUL HEROIN AND PRESCRIPTION OPIOID TRAFFICKERS. FUNDING UNDER THIS AWARD PROGRAM WILL BE USED BY THE STATE LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCY TO FOSTER STATEWIDE COLLABORATE IN SUPPORT OF SUCH INVESTIGATIVE ACTIVITIES.

THE FY 2022 COPS OFFICE TECHNOLOGY AND EQUIPMENT PROGRAM (TEP) INVITATIONAL SOLICITATION IS AN INVITATION-ONLY GRANT PROGRAM DESIGNED TO DEVELOP AND ACQUIRE EFFECTIVE EQUIPMENT, TECHNOLOGIES, AND INTEROPERABLE COMMUNICATIONS THAT ASSIST IN RESPONDING TO AND PREVENTING CRIME.

THE OBJECTIVE IS TO PROVIDE FUNDING FOR PROJECTS WHICH IMPROVE POLICE EFFECTIVENESS AND THE FLOW OF INFORMATION AMONG LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCIES, LOCAL GOVERNMENT SERVICE PROVIDERS, AND THE COMMUNITIES THEY SERVE. FUNDING SHALL BE USED FOR THE PROJECTS, AND IN THE AMOUNTS, SPECIFIED UNDER THE HEADING “COMMUNITY ORIENTED POLICING SERVICES, TECHNOLOGY AND EQUIPMENT COMMUNITY PROJECTS/ COPS LAW ENFORCEMENT TECHNOLOGY AND EQUIPMENT” IN THE JOINT EXPLANATORY STATEMENT – DIVISION B, WHICH IS INCORPORATED BY REFERENCE INTO PUBLIC LAW 117-103.

FUNDING SHALL BE USED FOR THE PROJECTS, AND IN THE AMOUNTS, SPECIFIED UNDER THE HEADING “COMMUNITY ORIENTED POLICING SERVICES, TECHNOLOGY AND EQUIPMENT COMMUNITY PROJECTS/ COPS LAW ENFORCEMENT TECHNOLOGY AND EQUIPMENT” IN THE JOINT EXPLANATORY STATEMENT – DIVISION B, WHICH IS INCORPORATED BY REFERENCE INTO PUBLIC LAW 117-103.

FUNDING SHALL BE USED FOR THE PROJECTS, AND IN THE AMOUNTS, SPECIFIED UNDER THE HEADING “COMMUNITY ORIENTED POLICING SERVICES, TECHNOLOGY AND EQUIPMENT COMMUNITY PROJECTS/ COPS LAW ENFORCEMENT TECHNOLOGY AND EQUIPMENT” IN THE JOINT EXPLANATORY STATEMENT – DIVISION B, WHICH IS INCORPORATED BY REFERENCE INTO PUBLIC LAW 117-103.

WE, DOÑA ANA SHERIFF’S OFFICE, ARE SEEKING OUR COMMISSION ON ACCREDITATION FOR LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCIES, HEREIN AFTER CALEA ACCREDITATION. LAW ENFORCEMENT ACCREDITATION IS A SELF-INITIATED, VOLUNTARY PROCESS WHERE AGENCIES COMPLETE A SELF-ASSESSMENT AGAINST A SPECIFIC SET OF INDUSTRY RECOGNIZED BEST PRACTICES. ACCREDITATION HELPS POLICE DEPARTMENTS OPERATE MORE PROFESSIONALLY, JUSTIFY THEIR OPERATIONS, AND PROMOTE TRUST IN THEIR COMMUNITY. THE ACCREDITATION PROCESS WILL ALLOW US TO ASSESS HIGH-LIABILITY AREAS OF OUR OPERATIONS, PROVIDE OFFICERS MORE TRAINING, AND IMPROVE OFFICER ACCOUNTABILITY TO POLICIES AND TRAINING. BY ENROLLING IN THE ACCREDITATION PROCESS WE ARE COMMITTING TO PROFESSIONAL EXCELLENCE IN LEADERSHIP, RESOURCE MANAGEMENT, AND SERVICE DELIVERY. THE AWARD FROM THIS GRANT WILL HELP TO FUND THE PERSONNEL, TECHNOLOGY, AND RESOURCES NEED TO EFFECTIVELY COMPLETE THE SELF-ASSESSMENT PROCESS WITH THE GOAL OF ACHIEVING ACCREDITATION THROUGH CALEA
CITY OF DULUTH, MN ACCREDITATION PROJECT

THE BROWNSTOWN POLICE DEPARTMENT IS PARTNERING WITH THE MICHIGAN ASSOCIATION OF CHIEFS OF POLICE (MACP) TO OBTAIN OUR INITIAL ACCREDITATION. THE MICHIGAN ASSOCIATION OF CHIEFS OF POLICE ACCREDITATION PROGRAM HAVE BEEN DEVELOPED AND APPROVED BY THE MICHIGAN LAW ENFORCEMENT ACCREDITATION COMMISSION (MLEAC). THIS ACCREDITATION PROCESS IS AN IMPORTANT GOAL OF CHIEF JEFFREY WATSON AND ALL WHO WORK AT THE BROWNSTOWN POLICE DEPARTMENT. ACCREDITATION IS SELF-INITIATED, VOLUNTARY PROCESS WHERE WE WILL COMPLETE A SELF-ASSESSMENT AGAINST A SPECIFIC SET OF RECOGNIZED BEST PRACTICES AS SET FORTH BY MACP. THE GOAL IS TO HELP THE BROWNSTOWN POLICE DEPARTMENT OPERATE MORE PROFESSIONALLY IN ORDER TO IMPROVE OPERATIONS AND PROMOTE TRUST IN THEIR COMMUNITY.   BY SEEKING ACCREDITATION THROUGH OUR STATE’S RECOGNIZED ACCREDITATION PROGRAM, WE ARE COMMITTING TO PROFESSIONAL EXCELLENCE IN LEADERSHIP, RESOURCE MANAGEMENT, AND COMMITMENT OF SERVICE TO OUR COMMUNITY. THE AWARD FROM THIS GRANT WILL HELP TO FUND THE PERSONNEL, TECHNOLOGY, AND RESOURCES NEEDED TO EFFECTIVELY COMPLETE THE SELF-ASSESSMENT PROCESS WITH THE GOAL OF ACHIEVING ACCREDITATION THROUGH THE MICHIGAN ASSOCIATION OF CHIEFS OF POLICE.

THE NEWLY ELECTED SHERIFF FOR HENRY COUNTY GEORGIA, SHERIFF REGINALD SCANDRETT, HAS FOCUSED HIS MISSION ON INCREASING COMMUNITY UNITY AND TRUST. THIS MISSION WAS ESTABLISHED AROUND SIX SIMPLE AND POWERFUL GOALS KNOWN AS THE “TOP SIX." THESE INCLUDE REDUCING RECIDIVISM, COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT, MULTI-JURISDICTIONAL COLLABORATION, RESTORATIVE JUSTICE, EMPOWERING EMPLOYEES, AND GARNER NATIONAL ACCREDITATIONS. AN IMMEDIATE PRIORITY WAS MADE IN REVIEWING AND DEVELOPING POLICIES AND PROCEDURES OF THE HENRY COUNTY SHERIFF’S OFFICE (HCSO), ENSURING THEY COMPLIED WITH NATIONAL STANDARDS. NATIONAL ACCREDITATION IS A VITAL WAY TO ENSURE THE PUBLIC THAT THE BEST PRACTICES AND POLICIES HAVE BEEN CREATED FOR HCSO, IN TURN INCREASING THE COMMUNITY TRUST. AS THE PROCESS CONTINUES, HCSO WILL CONTINUE TO EDUCATE COUNTY LEADERS ON THE BENEFITS OF NATIONAL ACCREDITATIONS TO OBTAIN FUNDING NOT CURRENTLY RECEIVED. WE WILL SHOW AS WE INCREASE OUR PROFESSIONALISM AND STANDARDS THAT THE COUNTY WILL SEE A REDUCTION IN LIABILITIES, WITH AN INCREASE IN SERVICES.
SAVANNAH-CHATHAM BOARD OF EDUCATION, GA ACCREDITATION PROJECT

THE NEW COLLEGE OF FLORIDA POLICE DEPARTMENT IS CURRENTLY THE ONLY STATE UNIVERSITY SYSTEM POLICE DEPARTMENT IN THE STATE OF FLORIDA THAT IS NOT ACCREDITED OR IN THE PROCESS OF OBTAINING ACCREDITATION. WE RECOGNIZE THE IMPORTANCE OF ADHERING TO THE HIGHEST STANDARDS OF POLICE POLICIES AND OPERATIONS AS WELL AS THE IMPORTANCE OF ACCOUNTABILITY AND TRANSPARENCY. AS SUCH, FUNDS ARE REQUESTED FOR THE DEPARTMENT TO BEGIN - AND COMPLETE - THE ACCREDITATION PROCESS. THE COMMUNITY IN WHICH THE NEW COLLEGE OF FLORIDA POLICE DEPARTMENT SERVES WILL UNDOUBTEDLY BENEFIT WHEN THE AGENCY IS ACCREDITED AS IT WILL BE ASSURED THAT LAW ENFORCEMENT PERSONNEL ARE FOLLOWING BEST PRACTICE POLICIES AND PROCEDURES TO PROVIDE EFFICIENT, EFFECTIVE AND FAIR POLICING. ACCREDITATION HELPS TO ENSURE ACCOUNTABILITY AND TRANSPARENCY THAT CAN ENHANCE CONFIDENCE AND TRUST IN LAW ENFORCEMENT AMONG COMMUNITY MEMBERS. ACCREDITATION IS A COVETED HONOR THAT SYMBOLIZES PROFESSIONALISM, EXCELLENCE AND COMPETENCE.

THE JUDICIARY OF GUAM IS COMMITTED TO PROVIDING TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES THAT PROVIDE THE REQUISITE KNOWLEDGE TO, AND RAISE AWARENESS AND SENSITIVITY AND DEVELOP AND IMPROVE THE SKILLS SET OF LAW ENFORCEMENT REGARDING DE-ESCALATION TECHNIQUES AND CONFLICT AND DISPUTE RESOLUTION STRATEGIES AND METHODS TO PREVENT, ADDRESS AND RESOLVE POTENTIALLY VIOLENT AND ACTIVE VIOLENCE SITUATIONS AND CONFRONTATIONS BETWEEN LAW ENFORCEMENT AND OTHER INDIVIDUALS. THE GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO INCREASE THE CAPACITY OF LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCIES IN GUAM TO SAFELY, EFFECTIVELY AND EFFICIENTLY PREVENT, ADDRESS AND RESOLVE POTENTIALLY VIOLENT AND ACTIVE VIOLENCE SITUATIONS AND CONFRONTATIONS BETWEEN LAW ENFORCEMENT AND OTHERS THROUGH TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES THAT PROVIDE THE REQUISITE KNOWLEDGE TO, AND RAISE THE AWARENESS AND SENSITIVITY AND DEVELOP AND IMPROVE THE SKILLS SET OF, LAW ENFORCEMENT REGARDING DE-ESCALATION TECHNIQUES AND CONFLICT AND DISPUTE RESOLUTION STRATEGIES AND METHODS. THIS WILL BE ACCOMPLISHED THROUGH THE FOLLOWING OBJECTIVES: DEVELOP AND CONDUCT A DE-ESCALATION TRAIN THE TRAINER FOR LAW ENFORCEMENT PERSONNEL IDENTIFIED WITHIN THEIR RESPECTIVE AGENCIES TO BECOME CERTIFIED TRAINERS; CERTIFIED TRAINERS CONDUCT DE-ESCALATION END USER TRAINING WITHIN EACH RESPECTIVE LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCY; AND ENSURE ALL LAW ENFORCEMENT PERSONNEL WITHIN EACH RESPECTIVE AGENCY RECEIVE AND COMPLETE DE-ESCALATION TRAINING.

THE CITY OF LAS CRUCES (CITY), ON BEHALF OF THE LAS CRUCES POLICE DEPARTMENT (LCPD), THE CITY’S LOCAL MUNICIPAL LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCY, RESPECTFULLY REQUESTS $188,500 FROM THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF JUSTICE, OFFICE OF COMMUNITY ORIENTED POLICING SERVICES (COPS) TO SUPPORT EFFORTS TO FURTHER DEVELOP AND MAINTAIN OFFICERS’ DE-ESCALATION PROFICIENCY. LCPD CURRENTLY OPERATES A COMPREHENSIVE TRAINING ACADEMY AND PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT SYSTEM THAT ACKNOWLEDGES THE VALUE OF DE-ESCALATION TRAINING AND INCORPORATES ITS PRINCIPLES THROUGHOUT TRAINING CURRICULA. HOWEVER, LCPD HAS IDENTIFIED THE NEED FOR ADDITIONAL RESOURCES TO ENHANCE THESE EFFORTS AND ESTABLISH A MORE ROBUST SYSTEM FOR ONGOING QUALITY IMPROVEMENT. THIS NEED STEMS FROM A FEW AREAS: OFFICER TRAINING AND SKILLS GAPS OBSERVED BY LCPD INSTRUCTORS; A LACK OF DEPARTMENTAL RESOURCES TO EXPAND TRAINING OPTIONS AND MEASURE THE EFFECTIVENESS AND EFFICACY OF TRAINING; AND ENVIRONMENTAL FACTORS, INCLUDING LOCAL TRENDS IN CRIME AND MENTAL HEALTH ISSUES. FEDERAL FUNDING WILL SUPPORT LCPD TO IMPLEMENT CRITICAL TRAINING ENHANCEMENTS TO PROVIDE A MORE DYNAMIC SUITE OF TRAINING THAT ENCOMPASSES DIVERSE LEARNING TECHNIQUES. LCPD WILL BE ABLE TO REPLACE OUTDATED SUPPLIES, PURCHASE VIRTUAL REALITY TECHNOLOGY AND OTHER TRAINING ENHANCEMENTS, AND BUILD DEPARTMENT CAPACITY TO COLLECT TRAINING DATA AND ASSESS ITS EFFECTIVENESS AND EFFICACY. THESE DATA WILL SUPPORT EFFORTS TO CONTINUALLY ASSESS AND REFINE TRAINING AS NEEDED AND HELP TO JUSTIFY SUSTAINING A MORE ROBUST TRAINING PROGRAM IN THE FUTURE. THE GOALS OF THE PROJECT ARE TO:  1) INCREASE INTERNAL CAPACITY TO PROVIDE DE-ESCALATION, PROMOTE CONTINUAL LEARNING, AND MAINTENANCE OF OFFICER DE-ESCALATION SKILLS; 2) INCREASE ACCESS TO THE AMOUNT AND TYPE OF DE-ESCALATION TRAINING PROVIDED TO ALL OFFICERS; AND 3) INCORPORATE METHODS FOR MEASURING EFFECTIVENESS AND EFFICACY OF DE-ESCALATION TRAINING AND CONTINUOUS QUALITY IMPROVEMENT OF OFFICER DE-ESCALATION PROFICIENCY.

THE GOAL OF BALTIMORE COUNTY POLICE DEPARTMENT’S DE-ESCALATION TRAINING PROJECT IS TO ENHANCE EXISTING CRISIS INTERVENTION AND DE-ESCALATION TRAINING USING NEW DELIVERY METHODS AND EXPANDED CAPACITIES. FOLLOWING THE PRINCIPLES OF GOOD GUIDANCE, THE PROJECT IS: A) QUALITY-DRIVEN AND MODELED ON EVIDENCE- BASED RESEARCH AND BEST PRACTICES FOR LAW ENFORCEMENT TRAINING; B) ACCESSIBLE FOR LAW ENFORCEMENT AND THE COMMUNITY; AND C) MEMORABLE FOR ITS DEVELOPMENT OF NEW AND EXPANDED RESOURCES THAT ENHANCE LAW ENFORCEMENT’S RESPONSES TO CRITICAL INCIDENTS, AND THAT INCREASE THE SAFETY OF OFFICERS AND THE PUBLIC. FUNDING IS REQUESTED FOR THE PURCHASE, INSTALLATION, ON-SITE TRAINING AND IMPLEMENTATION OF A FIXED VIRTUAL REALITY (VR) TRAINING SYSTEM FOR USE AT THE POLICE DEPARTMENT’S FIREARMS TRAINING FACILITY, AND TWO (2) PORTABLE VR SYSTEMS THAT WILL BE USED BY THE DEPARTMENT’S MOBILE TRAINING TEAMS. THE VR SYSTEMS WILL EXPAND THE DEPARTMENT’S ABILITIES TO PROVIDE SPECIALIZED INSTRUCTION AND COMMUNITY TRAINING ON DE-ESCALATION AND USE OF FORCE POLICY.

THE CITY OF MENIFEE, AND MENIFEE POLICE DEPARTMENT STRIVE TO BE A LEADER IN UTILIZING THE NEWEST TECHNOLOGIES TO KEEP US AHEAD OF THE CURVE. IMPLEMENTING APEX OFFICER TO OUR TRAINING PROGRAM IS ONE KEYWAY THAT WE CAN ACCOMPLISH THIS. THIS SYSTEM PROVIDES A COMPREHENSIVE SOLUTION COMBINING VIRTUAL TECHNOLOGY TO PRODUCE TRAINING SIMULATIONS AND HANDS-ON SCENARIO-BASED EXERCISES. IT PROVIDES THE ABILITY TO IMPART PRESENTATIONS, CLASSES, DEBRIEFINGS, AND AFTER-ACTION REVIEWS AS WELL. THIS TOOL WILL ALLOW THE STAFF TO PREVIEW REAL WORLD SITUATIONS FROM THE SAFETY OF A TRAINING ENVIRONMENT AND PRACTICE THE BEST WAYS TO REACT AND DEFUSE A VOLATILE ATMOSPHERE. THE MENIFEE POLICE DEPARTMENT IS A NEWER AGENCY HAVING JUST CELEBRATED ITS ONE-YEAR ANNIVERSARY ON JULY 1, 2021. AS SUCH, THERE IS STILL A LARGE AMOUNT OF KEY DATA THAT WE ARE STILL GATHERING ON POTENTIAL HOTSPOTS WITHIN THE CITY. THIS TRAINING SOFTWARE WILL ALLOW US TO SIMULATE CRITICAL INCIDENTS WITHIN SIMILAR LOCATIONS AND SIMULATIONS TO BETTER BE PREPARED FOR AN CONFRONTATION THAT COULD ARISE.

THE PURPOSE OF THE COPS ANTI-METHAMPHETAMINE PROGRAM (CAMP) IS TO ADVANCE PUBLIC SAFETY BY PROVIDING FUNDS TO INVESTIGATE ILLICIT ACTIVITIES RELATED TO THE MANUFACTURE AND DISTRIBUTION OF METHAMPHETAMINE.  FUNDING UNDER THIS AWARD WILL BE USED BY THE STATE LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENCY TO LOCATE AND INVESTIGATE SUCH ILLICIT ACTIVITIES.

THE CITY OF COLUMBIA HEIGHTS IS A FIRST RING MINNEAPOLIS SUBURB WITH ABOVE AVERAGE CRIME, BELOW AVERAGE INCOME, A LARGE DIVERSE POPULATION AND A HIGH VOLUME OF MENTAL HEALTH CALLS INCLUDING CRISIS INCIDENTS REQUIRING MEDICAL HOLD TRANSPORTS. THIS GRANT PROPOSAL IS FOR A PARTNERSHIP WITH A LOCAL HEALTH RESOURCE PROVIDER TO STAFF A FULL TIME MENTAL HEALTH PROFESSIONAL AT THE POLICE DEPARTMENT TO RESPOND WITH POLICE OFFICERS TO THOSE IN CRISIS AND IN NEED OF RESOURCES. THE MENTAL HEALTH PROFESSIONAL WILL WORK ALONGSIDE THE POLICE TO DE-ESCALATE SITUATIONS, AS WELL AS TO CONNECT INDIVIDUALS IN NEED WITH SUPPORT RESOURCES. THE SELECTED CONTRACT ORGANIZATION HAS AN ESTABLISHED TRACK RECORD OF PROVIDING SERVICE IN THIS AREA.

THE CITY OF HYATTSVILLE, CITY OF MOUNT RAINIER, AND TOWN OF BRENTWOOD ARE THREE SMALL MARYLAND SUBURBS NORTH OF WASHINGTON DC WITH POPULATIONS OF APPROXIMATELY 20,000, 8,100, AND 2,800 PEOPLE, RESPECTIVELY. CURRENTLY, THE HYATTSVILLE POLICE DEPARTMENT HAS 43 SWORN OFFICERS, MOUNT RAINIER PD HAS 18, AND BRENTWOOD PD HAS FIVE.  OF THE MUNICIPALITIES CAN AFFORD TO OPERATE A CIT MOBILE CRISIS PROGRAM ALONE, AND DUE TO EACH DEPARTMENT’S SIZE, THEY DO NOT HAVE ENOUGH OFFICERS TO DEDICATE SOLELY TO A CO-RESPONDER TEAM. SINCE THESE NEIGHBORING JURISDICTIONS FALL ALONG WHAT IS KNOWN AS THE “ROUTE ONE CORRIDOR,” A MAJOR ROAD THAT STRETCHES NORTH FROM WASHINGTON DC THROUGH EACH MUNICIPALITY, WE ARE PROPOSING A JOINT CIT MOBILE CRISIS PROGRAM. THIS COPS CIT GRANT WILL ADD TO THE AGENCIES’ EXISTING BEHAVIORAL HEALTH SUPPORT EFFORTS BY FUNDING ONE FULL-TIME AND ONE PART-TIME MENTAL HEALTH CLINICIAN TO RESPOND TO BEHAVIORAL HEALTH CRISIS CALLS AND MEET CIT-CERTIFIED OFFICERS ALREADY ON THE SCENE.

THE OVERLAND PARK (KS) POLICE DEPARTMENT (OPPD) IS UTILIZING A COLLABORATIVE APPROACH TO ADDRESS EMERGING MENTAL AND BEHAVIORAL HEALTH ISSUES. OPPD CURRENTLY HAS A BEHAVIORAL HEALTH UNIT COMPOSED OF 3 CO-RESPONDERS, 1 CRISIS INTERVENTION TEAM (CIT) COORDINATOR, ONE CIT OFFICER, AND ONE CIT SERGEANT. THE CITY UTILIZES A MEMORANDUM OF UNDERSTANDING WITH THE JOHNSON COUNTY MENTAL HEALTH CENTER (JCMHC) FOR THE PROVISION OF CO-RESPONDER SERVICES. OPPD IS SEEKING GRANT FUNDING TO ADDRESS THE FOLLOWING: ACHIEVE CRISIS CIT AGENCY PROGRAM CERTIFICATION: CIT INTERNATIONAL PROVIDES CIT PROGRAMS THE OPPORTUNITY TO RECEIVE CERTIFICATION THROUGH A STRUCTURED ASSESSMENT AND FEEDBACK PROCESS. HIRE TWO (2) CO-RESPONDERS: HIRING TWO ADDITIONAL CO-RESPONDERS WILL PROVIDE BETTER COVERAGE IN REACHING INDIVIDUALS EXPERIENCING A MENTAL HEALTH CRISIS AND MOVE THE BHU TOWARDS ITS GOAL OF PROVIDING AROUND THE CLOCK SERVICE. PROVIDE SPECIALIZED TRAINING FOR CRISIS INTERVENTION TEAM MEMBERS: SEND 2 CIT TEAM MEMBERS TO THE CIT INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE, NATIONAL CO-RESPONDER CONFERENCE, AND APPLIED SUICIDE INTERPRETATION SKILLS (ASIST) TRAINING IN 2022 AND 2023.

IN AUGUST 2019, THE CITY OF HYATTSVILLE FUNDED A MEDIA RELATIONS/MENTAL HEALTH PROGRAMS MANAGER ROLE FOR THE CITY OF HYATTSVILLE POLICE DEPARTMENT (HCPD). THE ROLE, CREATED BY HCPD LEADERSHIP, MEETS TWO NEEDS, AND IN MARCH, THE DEPARTMENT LAUNCHED THE HCPD MENTAL HEALTH AND WELLNESS PROGRAM. IT INCLUDES THE MENTAL WELLNESS CHECK-IN INITIATIVE, FOR WHICH WE ARE REQUESTING FUNDING. THE HCPD MENTAL HEALTH AND WELLNESS PROGRAM, DEVELOPED BY THE HCPD MEDIA RELATIONS/MENTAL HEALTH PROGRAMS MANAGER, INCLUDES REQUIRED AND OPTIONAL MENTAL HEALTH EDUCATION AND TRAINING PROGRAMS TO SUPPORT FIRST RESPONDERS PROFESSIONALLY AND PERSONALLY. WELLNESS PROGRAMMING INCLUDES FREE MEDITATION AND YOGA, AND THE MENTAL WELLNESS CHECK-IN INITIATIVE, SLATED TO BEGIN IN SEPTEMBER.  THE MENTAL WELLNESS CHECK-IN INITIATIVE REQUIRES ALL HCPD OFFICERS AND DISPATCHERS TO MEET QUARTERLY IN 50-MINUTE, ONE-ON-ONE VIRTUAL SESSIONS WITH LICENSED PSYCHOLOGISTS WHO HAVE EXPERIENCE WORKING WITH FIRST RESPONDERS. THE INITIATIVE IS DESIGNED TO REMOVE THE STIGMA OF CHOOSING TO SEE A THERAPIST AND GUARANTEES HCPD FIRST RESPONDERS RECEIVE MENTAL HEALTH SUPPORT. THE CHECK-INS ARE NOT FITNESS-FOR-DUTY ASSESSMENTS. THE CONFIDENTIAL SESSIONS WILL INCLUDE CLINICAL AND PSYCHO-EDUCATIONAL COACHING. DISCUSSIONS WOULD ONLY BE REPORTED IF SOMEONE IS DEEMED A DANGER TO THEMSELVES OR OTHERS.

THE MUNICIPALITY OF BAYAMON IN PUERTO RICO IS APPLYING FOR FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $125,000 FOR THE PURPOSE OF DEVELOPING AND IMPLEMENTING A CULTURALLY ADAPTED AND HOLISTIC MENTAL HEALTH AND WELLNESS PROGRAM FOR ITS MUNICIPAL POLICE DEPARTMENT. THE NEED FOR SUCH A PROGRAM HAS BEEN ADDRESSED NATIONWIDE, HOWEVER, A STATEWIDE INITIATIVE INCORPORATING PEER SUPPORT IN LAW ENFORCEMENT DOES NOT EXIST. THE MUNICIPALITY IS PILOTING THE PROGRAM FOR FUTURE REPLICATION IN OTHER POLICE DEPARTMENTS THROUGHOUT THE ISLAND. THE PROJECT SERVES 114 SWORN-IN PERSONNEL, WITH A REACH OF APPROXIMATELY 177 FAMILY MEMBERS. WITH FUNDING, THE MUNICIPALITY WILL CARRY OUT A CURRICULUM DEVELOPMENT AND IMPLEMENTATION FOR TRAINING FOR POLICE OFFICERS ON MENTAL HEALTH AND SUICIDE PREVENTION, IMPLEMENT A PEER SUPPORT SYSTEM INVOLVING SOCIAL WORKERS, A CHAPLAIN AND DEPARTMENT CHAMPION OFFICERS, AND OFFER ADDITIONAL COUNSELING AND EDUCATION FOR FAMILY MEMBERS. BAYAMON, AS A LOCAL GOVERNMENT ENTITY, IS SEEKING ASSISTANCE TO ACHIEVE THE PRIMARY OBJECTIVES: INCREASE OFFICER AWARENESS IN MENTAL HEALTH, PROVIDE AN INVITING PEER SUPPORT ENVIRONMENT WITH FAITH-BASED SPIRITUAL COUNSELING, TRAINING ON MENTAL HEALTH TOPICS, INCORPORATE FAMILY MEMBERS IN EDUCATION AND COUNSELING AND IMPROVE COMMUNICATION BETWEEN OFFICERS AND THEIR FAMILY MEMBERS. THE PRIMARY STAKEHOLDER IS THE BAYAMON MUNICIPAL POLICE DEPARTMENT. KEY PARTNERSHIPS INCLUDE THE UNIVERSITY OF PUERTO RICO - BAYAMON CAMPUS AND THE INTERNATIONAL ASSOCIATION OF CHIEFS OF POLICE. THE PROJECT’S DELIVERABLES ARE TO DEMONSTRATE: AN INCREASE IN MENTAL HEALTH KNOWLEDGE AMONG OFFICERS, INCREASE PARTICIPATION IN MENTAL HEALTH TRAINING, A POSITIVE SHIFT IN OVERALL ATTITUDES, INCREASED FAMILY INVOLVEMENT IN OFFICER WELLBEING. BAYAMON WILL HOST A CONFERENCE ON MENTAL HEALTH AND WELLBEING TO PROMOTE THE IMPORTANCE OF MENTAL HEALTH IN LAW ENFORCEMENT. WITH THE PROJECT’S QUANTITATIVE AND QUALITATIVE DATA COLLECTED THROUGHOUT THE 24 MONTH PERIOD, THE PROGRAM WILL SERVE AS AN EXAMPLE FOR OTHER POLICE DEPARTMENTS ON THE ISLAND ON LESSONS LEARNED AND REPLICATION TO IMPLEMENT SIMILAR CULTURE-SPECIFIC PROGRAMS.

EVEN STRONGER! A PEER SUPPORT PROGRAM BASED IN NATIVE AMERICAN TRIBAL CULTURE IS PURPOSEFULLY DESIGNED BY A PEER TEAM OF TRIBAL SWORN AND RETIRED OFFICERS, LINE STAFF, TRADITIONAL TRIBAL HEALERS AND TEACHERS, AND ALSO INCLUDES PRACTITIONERS AND TRAINERS WHO ARE WELL-INFORMED OF TODAY’S MENTAL HEALTH AND WELLNESS RESEARCH AND FINDINGS.  THE PROGRAM IS DESIGNED FOR TRIBAL PUBLIC SAFETY OFFICERS AND LINE STAFF WHOSE JURISDICTIONS ARE OFTEN REMOTE AND RURAL, WITH UNIQUE CULTURES, LANGUAGES AND COMMUNITY STRUCTURES OF THEIR OWN.    THE NAME, “EVEN STRONGER!” COMES FROM THE WORDS OF A FORMER DISPATCHER WHO SAID OF THE OFFICERS WHO WERE HER CO-WORKERS, “THEY SEE SO MUCH, YET THEY’RE SO BRAVE AND STRONG.  MENTAL HEALTH SERVICES THEY COULD DESIGN FOR THEMSELVES WOULD MAKE THEM EVEN STRONGER.”  ONE OF THE MAIN PURPOSES OF THIS PEER-DESIGNED AND PEER-PROVIDED MENTAL HEALTH AND WELLNESS PROGRAM IS TO MAKE SURE OFFICERS CAN ACCESS WELL PLANNED SERVICES THAT ARE ALREADY FAMILIAR TO THEM.  AND BECAUSE THE SERVICES ARE BASED IN THEIR OWN CULTURE, THERE IS NO STIGMA ATTACHED TO THEIR USE.  ACTIVITIES CAN INCLUDE CEREMONY FOR NAMING, HEALING AND OTHER PURPOSES, SWEAT LODGE, TRAINING, TALKING STICK, REFERRAL TO CLINICS IF NEEDED AND ACCEPTED BY A PARTICIPANT, QUIET AND PEACE, COOKING AND EATING TRADITIONAL FOODS.  ALSO: DEVELOPMENT OF A MENTAL HEALTH AND WELLNESS AWARENESS CAMPAIGN, TRAINING FOR ALL FIRST RESPONDERS, DIRECTION AND EXPERTISE IN DEVELOPING CONFIDENTIAL MENTAL HEALTH AND WELLNESS POLICY AND PROCEDURES, PEER-LED SUPPORT SERVICES FOR STRESS MANAGEMENT, SUICIDE PREVENTION, VICARIOUS TRAUMA, CRITICAL INCIDENT DEBRIEFING, AND TRAUMA INFORMED CARE GROUP PROCESS.  CONTRIBUTING PARTNERS INCLUDE: A CHEMICAL HEALTH PROGRAM WITH EXTENSIVE SERVICES AND A DECADES-LONG PRACTICE OF BASING THEIR SERVICE IN OJIBWE CULTURE AND TRADITION; TRADITIONAL TRIBAL PEOPLE WHO CONDUCT CEREMONY AND TEACHINGS; A LOCAL BEHAVIORAL HEALTH UNIT; TRIBAL SPIRITUAL LEADERS AND LOCAL CLERGY.
